Title: Cyber Security Architect

Job_Description: <div><strong>Join our team</strong></div>  <br/>At TELUS, we are committed to securing our customers’ data and systems as well as improving their overall cybersecurity health. To honour that commitment, the Security Product Management team leverages new technologies, solutions and new market trends to ensure our portfolio of security solutions remain competitive. <br/><br/> <strong>Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Product Manager, you oversee TELUS Security service roadmap planning. You play a pivotal role gathering competitive intelligence research, defining products/services, monitoring trends in the cyber security services market and building financial business models for new services. Moreover, you are a champion for these development opportunities driving these initiatives to commercial availability in close collaboration with various teams such as architecture, design & development and go-to- market teams.<br/>  <div><strong>Here's how</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Full-life cycle product planning, including processes, operations, support, pricing, service level agreements, terms and conditions, marketing programs, training, sales collateral and presentations, webinars and profit & loss management</li> <li>Work with cross functional teams (such as Professional Services, Product Management, Secure Operations Center and Product Management teams) in development of product and service development from concept to launch</li> <li>Strategic pipeline planning for new product development including the definition, sourcing, marketing, logistics, and product development</li> <li>Establish, negotiate and manage vendor, partner and hosting relationships</li> <li>Develop a deep understanding of emerging global trends and technologies by leveraging competitive landscape research, market reports and analyst reports to create winning business cases</li> <li>Lead cross functional teams across all business units to translate new product ideas and strategies into successful businesses, by utilizing expert leadership skills and gaining alignment behind these initiatives through the effective influencing of stakeholders</li> <li>Investigate opportunities for collaboration on service introduction with other TELUS Product teams</li> <li>Responsible to prime the economic, competitive, and technical analysis of emerging products and solutions to support growth initiatives</li> <li>Accountable for managing the capital envelope associated with given project and/or initiative (including measurement of project performance and ROI)</li> </ul>  <div><strong>You're the missing piece of the puzzle</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>With your 5 years of product management experience in a technology focused vertical</li> <li>Acknowledged for your solid IT Security knowledge (Governance, risk, compliance, technical, operations, deployment)</li> <li>Respected for your strong product management knowledge</li> <li>Valued for your visionary approach</li> <li>Recognized for your excellent leadership, communication and presentation skills</li> <li>Skilled in financial modelling and building compelling business cases</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Great-to-haves</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Understanding of security information event management (SIEM), next generation firewall, threat intelligence, endpoint, identity and access management or similar security technologies</li> <li>With a college or University degree</li> <li>Accreditations such as CISSP, CSSLP, CCSP or similar</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Who is TELUS?</strong></div> <div> <div>We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.</div> <br/>  <div>Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.</div> <br/>  <div>Do you share our passion?</div><br/>   <div>At TELUS, <strong>you</strong> create future friendly® possibilities.</div> <br/>  <div>At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.</div></div>

Job_Description: JOB DESCRIPTION<br/><br/>In this position, you will perform ethical hacking assessments on multi-protocol networks and application systems to our various clients ranging from banking to law enforcement. Tasks will be highly technical, requiring a good understanding of security technologies and strategies. Qualified candidates will:  <ul> <li>Provide strategic and technical recommendations following identification of vulnerabilities in operating systems, applications, and network infrastructure;</li>  <li>Evaluate security controls and recommend corrective actions to mitigate technical risks;</li>  <li>Deliver reports outlining test results and present to technical and non-technical staff;</li>  <li>Develop and maintain methodologies and tools to enhance the company security testing services;</li>  <li>Participate as a subject matter expert in cyber security incident and breach investigations and post-breach remediation work.</li> </ul>  DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE<br/><br/>The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:  <ul> <li>A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or in another equivalent program;</li>  <li>Analytical and problem-solving skills;</li>  <li>Knowledge of popular operating systems and networking protocols;</li>  <li>Understanding of web applications, servers, frameworks and protocols;</li>  <li>Knowledge of infrastructure and application security technologies;</li>  <li>Hands on experience with one or more programming languages (C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Ruby, etc.);</li>  <li>Good communication and writing skills, for both technical and non-technical audiences;</li>  <li>Contributions to bug bounty programs or multiple Capture-the-Flag activities is considered a plus.</li> </ul> <strong><em>Due to the nature of services we provide and our clients, we conduct strict criminal, financial and reputational background checks. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada and have (or be able to obtain) Government of Canada Level II (SECRET) clearance.</em> </strong><br/><br/>Ideal previous consulting experience<br/><br/>Experience and/or industry specific certifications in the following fields:  <ul> <li>Telecommunications, Networking or Systems integration</li>  <li>Vulnerability Assessments</li>  <li>Code Review</li>  <li>Penetration Testing</li>  <li>Reverse engineering</li>  <li>Malware analysis</li>  <li>This position requires some weekend and evening hours.</li> </ul>  The following personal abilities are favoured at GoSecure:   <ul> <li>Exceptional organizational skills;</li>  <li>Ability to think of problems and operational activities beyond technical scope, envisioning general business and political ramifications;</li>  <li>Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks concurrently;</li>  <li>Adaptable to diverse environments;</li>  <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills in English and French are mandatory;</li>  <li>Energetic and positive with a “can do” attitude.</li> </ul> <strong>GoSecure has a policy in place to support Canadian Forces reservists.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>GoSecure has a strong continuing education policy for its employees, ensuring our personnel achieves graduate level degrees within a few years of hire.</strong>
Title: Junior Cyber Security Analyst, Ethical Hacking

Job_Description: <div>We are looking for a Director of Security Orchestration to work in a dynamic and exciting new position within the FortiGuard Security Strategy organization (FSSG) office of the CISO. The Security Orchestrator’s main responsibilities will be creating new systems for the security strategy organization to work with, including FortiGuard SE, Threat Researchers and Data Scientists. These systems will orchestrate information flow from multiple key backend FortiGuard research systems, from various locations. This consolidated system will help to provide further contextual threat intelligence information that will be used for key information sharing relationships, including Cyber Threat Alliance, national CERT, and commercial FortiGuard services. <br/><br/> The Security Orchestrator will be instrumental working day to day on information flow channels that these key relationships rely on. They will work to ensure proper, quality information flows from point A to B in an operational manner. <br/><br/> The role reports into the Security Strategy organization, office of the CISO. The Director of Security Orchestration will work with many interfaces, both technical and human – and must possess a driven spirit with strong communication skills. Strong knowledge and experience of threat intelligence protocols such as MISP, STIX and TAXII are a must. <br/><br/> FortiGuard Services offer broad security solutions including antivirus, intrusion prevention, Web content filtering and anti-spam capabilities. These services help protect against threats on both application and network layers. FortiGuard Services are updated by FortiGuard Labs, which enables Fortinet to deliver a combination of multi-layered security intelligence and zero-day protection from new and emerging threats. FortiGuard Labs has experts in cyber threat response and analysis world wide. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Responsibilities:</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Develop new environments to support information flow channels, including front end user interfaces</LI><LI>Support ingest of threat intelligence information, orchestrate and facilitate relationships to appropriate departments</LI><LI>Participate in industry forums such as Cyber Threat Alliance, and OASIS Cyber Threat Intelligence Technical Committee</LI> <LI>Help support and develop threat demonstration systems that use FortiGuard intelligence and the security fabric</LI><LI>Facilitate internal response to breaking threats to ensure research teams have appropriate protections in place (indicators of compromise), in order to achieve optimal customer protection in a timely manner</LI><LI>Collaborate closely with marketing and technical marketing and be able to clearly position Fortinet both from a technical and business perspective against competitors</LI> <LI>Work closely with the security strategy and sales engineering team, to ensure the growth of the associated products in the region</LI><LI>Carry quarterly and annual revenue targets linked to commission structure that support FortiGuard SE team</LI>  </ul> <STRONG>Required Skills:</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Solid understanding of scripting languages including Shell, Ruby, Perl, Python o C/C++ is a strong asset</LI><LI>Solid understanding of how web service work together, include HTTP, REST, XMLRPC, JSON and preferably STIX/TAXII</LI><LI>Solid understanding and working experience with threat intelligence protocols including MISP, STIX and TAXII</LI><LI>Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively to technical and business leaders through written and spoken communication</LI><LI>Technical documentation skills are a must</LI><LI>Clear understanding of competitive landscape and differentiators in regard to APT defense</LI><LI>Familiar understanding of malware and sandbox concepts</LI><LI>Familiar understanding of security vulnerability and exploit lifecycle</LI><LI>Presentation skills to technical and business audiences are a strong asset</LI> <LI>Hands on experience in database design/operation/maintenance and MySQL is a strong asset</LI><LI>Networking concepts and Linux system administration skills are an asset</LI><LI>Ability to work both collaboratively and independently</LI><LI>Highly motivated and responsible quick learner</LI> </ul> <STRONG>Education:</STRONG> <ul> <LI>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field</LI> </ul>  <strong><DIV>#LI-HD1</DIV><DIV>#GD</strong>  <li>FTNT*</li> <li>MSJA</li>  </DIV></div>
Title: Security Orchestrator

Job_Description: <DIV>EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>We currently have a career opportunity for a Manager in our Cybersecurity advisory team to participate in multiple client engagement teams and related activities. As a member, you'll deliver and lead cybersecurity and IT risk client engagements as well as internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish internal and external relationships. You'll also identify potential business opportunities for EY within existing engagements, and escalate these as appropriate. Similarly, you'll anticipate and identify risks within engagements and raise any issues with senior members of the team. In line with EY's commitment to quality, you'll confirm that work is of high quality and is reviewed by the next-level reviewer.</DIV> <DIV><B><U>Responsibilities:</U></B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Client Responsibilities</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to assimilate to new knowledge. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Possess good business acumen. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Remain current on new developments in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems. Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations.</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B>People Responsibilities</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Contribute to people-related initiatives, including development, coaching, recruiting, training and retaining staff</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintain an educational program to continually develop personal skills of staff</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures</DIV></LI></UL> <DIV><B><U><B><U>Qualifications</U></B></U></B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV>Desired qualifications include:</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Undergraduate or masters’ degree preferably in one of the following areas: Information Security, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, and other related majors</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Knowledge and 5-7 years of hands-on experience with key components of cybersecurity incl. network & infrastructure security, access and identity management, threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, security governance, risk and compliance, security architecture, data protection, privacy, security awareness and others. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expert knowledge and 4-5 years of practical experience with common frameworks, standards and methodologies used in cybersecurity field </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Practical experience with conducting risk assessments and testing of controls </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of data analytics methods</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Possession of at least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISA CISM </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Familiarity with or knowledge of cybersecurity in Industrial Control Systems and Operational Technology </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Demonstrated leadership abilities </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills </DIV></LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B><U>Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50-70>.</U></B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV>
Title: Cyber Security – Manager

Job_Description: About Us<br/><br/><strong>BDO. Because relationships matter.</strong> There are many world-class accounting firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter.<br/><br/>Job Description (EN)<br/><br/><strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> BDO is seeking a leader for its national Cybersecurity Practice. <br/><br/> The Cybersecurity helps businesses develop, assess and implement Information Systems strategies, architectures and mechanisms. Candidates must have relevant experience in IT security operations and / or management consulting. The chosen collaborator will ensure the development of the partnerships, expertise and Cybersecurity Advisory Services at BDO. He or she will be involved in advisory mandates for clients of all sizes in a variety of industries such as financial institutions, retail, public services, transportation, etc. <br/><br/> Candidates will have excellent written and spoken communication abilities, proven leadership qualities and exceptional capacity to understand our clients’ needs. We are looking for team oriented people with strong professional ethics. Our very broad range of clients allows us to offer stimulating and interesting jobs. <br/><br/> The position can be fulfilled in the following locations: Montréal, Québec City, Ottawa or Toronto. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>   <li>Develop new cybersecurity service offers with our cybersecurity allied firms;</li> <li>Combine cybersecurity resources and expertise at national level and establish relations with partners of the different Canadian geographical areas;</li> <li>Supervise /manage the execution of cybersecurity mandates (in collaboration with our cybersecurity allied firms), including:</li></ul>  <ul>    <ul>   <li>Evaluate IT security postures and architectures;</li> <li>Develop IT security improvement programs;</li> <li>Assess security configurations for firewalls, databases, servers, work stations;</li> <li>Develop IT strategies and recovery plans in the event of a disaster;</li> <li>Manage the performance of penetration tests or “red teaming” at web application level, on infrastructures, networks (internal/external), physical security, wireless technologies;</li> <li>Intervene in IT internal audit mandates as a cybersecurity expert;</li> <li>Develop methods and processes for security development in business solutions;</li> <li>Review and write up security policies, guidelines, standards and procedures;</li></ul>  </ul>    <ul>   <li>Recruit a team of cybersecurity strategists across the country to develop and deliver cybersecurity services.</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Professional Skills/Knowledge</strong>  <ul>   <li>A minimum of 8 to 10 years of experience in IT security for a consulting firm or in an IT management position;</li> <li>Bachelors or Masters in computer science or Information System Security;</li> <li>Knowledge of main best practices frameworks and references: OWASP, OSSTMM, etc.;</li> <li>Experience or specialization in information systems security an asset;</li> <li>Hold CISSP, CEH, SANS GIAC certification or equivalent an asset;</li> <li>Knowledge of ISO27000, Cobit, ITIL standards and frameworks an asset;</li> <li>Bilingual French and English - written and spoken - is essential;</li> <li>Excellent analytical capacity;</li> <li>Dynamic and self-directed;</li> <li>Curiosity and well-informed of later trends;</li> <li>Excellent written and spoken communication qualities is essential;</li> <li>Will be required to travel. "One firm engaged in making a difference through building strong relationships with our people, our clients and our communities."</li> </ul> <strong>Our Vision</strong> <br/><br/> At BDO we create opportunities for our employees while providing an exciting environment promoting work and experience diversity. Our employees may participate at many work aspects and communicate with our partners, which accessible to our staff and clients, reinforcing our common vision of One BDO for all. <br/><br/> #LI-MM1
Title: Manager, Cyber Security

Job_Description: <div>Our client within the professional services industry is looking for a Senior Analyst, Cyber Security for a PERMANENT opportunity. The client is located in Downtown Toronto close to Union Station. The successful candidate will be expected to communicate and provide feedback on IT Security operations and strategic planning, delivering on IT project initiatives while ensuring appropriate project milestones and objectives are being met. The successful candidate will assist with resolving complex issues for day to day operations as required. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Work closely with business managers, external auditors, technical team members, architects and other senior team members to understand the Firm’s requirements related to information systems security and regulatory compliance, and to map those requirements to security initiatives and projects</li> <li>Develop, oversee and implement the Firm’s information security policies, standards and guidelines</li> <li>Oversee the continuous monitoring and protection of the IT infrastructure, IT systems and Firm information</li> <li>Ensure unauthorized intrusions, access and tampering are prevented and that any such security incidents are quickly remediated</li> <li>Evaluate suspected security breaches and recommend corrective actions (including incidents involving outside vendors)</li> <li>Serve as the Firm’s focal point for security incident response planning and execution and lead the Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT)</li> <li>Assist with and participate in the execution of Internal/External Audits, Risk Assessments and Risk Management and develop appropriate criteria needed to assess the level of compliance of new/existing applications and/or technology infrastructure with firm-wide security standards</li> <li>Support the design, implementation, operation and maintenance of the Information Security Management System based on the ISO 27000 series standards, including certification against ISO 27001</li> <li>Form a “center of excellence” for information security management, offering internal advice and practical assistance on information security risk and control matters throughout the organization; promote the effective management of information security risks</li> <li>Assist the Infrastructure and Application Architects in the review of applications and/or technology environments during the design and/or development process to (a) assure compliance with Firm security policies and directions and (b) assist in the overall integration process within the Firm’s technology environment</li> <li>Research, develop, recommend and deploy the most effective and appropriate security technology tools to minimize information security threats</li> <li>Provide leadership, mentoring, guidance and advice to other network and security team members as required</li> <li>Perform research, evaluate, review and make recommendations for new technologies or for changes to existing technologies to enhance the Firm’s security posture</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience in establishing, implementing, operating, monitoring, reviewing, maintaining and improving an Information Security Management System based on the ISO 27001 standards</li> <li>Knowledge of L4-L7 protocols such as SSL, HTTP, DNS, SMTP and IPSec</li> <li>Intermediate to expert knowledge with IDS/IPS solutions</li> <li>Strong understanding of firewall technologies such as Palo Alto or Cisco</li> <li>Strong understanding of endpoint protection technologies such as McAfee ePO and Carbon Black</li> <li>Understanding of information management and data classification</li> <li>Intermediate to expert virus protection and content filtering knowledge</li> <li>Knowledge of encryption techniques and PKI infrastructure</li> <li>Penetration Testing / Risk Assessment / Audit and Compliance knowledge</li> <li>Audits and security accreditation process experience</li>   <li>Experience in ISO compliance</li> <li>Understanding of incident investigations processes and reporting</li> <li>Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</li> <li>A minimum of 5 years full-time work experience in information systems security management</li>   <li>Information Systems Security qualifications such as CISSP, CISA, or CISM</li> <li>In-depth experience in: vulnerability testing and penetration testing; developing information systems security practices as a people problem versus a technical problem; standards-based architecture with an understanding of how to get there, including compliance monitoring and enforceability; knowledge of network systems and security protocols; knowledge of security software programs and implementation; knowledge of best practices in developing security procedures and infrastructure.</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Analyst, Cyber Security

Title: Manager – Cyber Security

Job_Description: <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 3566 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category:</strong> Information Technology <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Mississauga, ON, Canada <br/><br/> With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve. <br/><br/> <strong>Scope of Position:</strong> <br/><br/> The mining, energy, infrastructure and other industry sectors are going through a transformation of their operating model as a way to become leaner and more nimble to the market conditions. Fundamental elements of this transformation for our clients are Digitalization and the implementation of Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) technologies. The integration of these new technologies with traditionally disconnected assets presents a challenge as it relates to securing not only the data being generated from these assets but the assets themselves. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be an entrepreneurial thought leader and demonstrated hands-on experience related to the design and implementation of secure industrial information infrastructures by using a comprehensive suite of services and technology that is designed specifically for reducing cyber-related risk within SCADA, DCS, PCN, ICS, ICT and Cloud environments. Specializing in technical assessments, architecture reviews, compliance strategies and threat analysis, the ideal candidate will combine unparalleled security experience with engineering excellence. <br/><br/> Further, the candidate will deliver realistic and effective security solutions that will protect the very systems that are critical to our clients’ operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Functional Tasks</strong> <ul> <li>Serve as Digital Thought Leader in the conception and inception of our client’s Cyber-Security vision and strategies</li><li>Serve as Program Management Officer (PMO) in the execution of Cyber-Security projects</li><li>Work closely with the other practice leads within the client’s Digital Sector to understand, map and leverage Hatch’s capabilities to improve positioning</li><li>Coach / Mentor others to further develop Cyber-Security capabilities in Hatch</li><li>Develop, refine and own the tools (e.g. methodologies and frameworks) required to deliver Cyber-Security projects</li><li>Build a culture of collaboration with peers and partners</li><li>Manage relationship with key partners</li><li>Remain abreast of the industry, competitors and technology trends with a view to ensuring that the firm&apos;s services best align to market needs</li><li>Serve as Subject Matter Expert for the Digital BU representing it at conferences, speaking engagements, and other external industry related events</li><li>Participate and be recognized as Subject Matter Expert in the Operations Workgroup of the Global Mining Standards and Guidelines Group</li><li>Build a team to support the business</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Experience / Education</strong> <br/><br/> The following indicate specific industry, academic and functional experience/qualifications that are important to the successful achievement of the identified responsibilities and performance deliverables: <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Cyber Security or an equivalent combination of formal education and experience appropriate for the assigned duties</li><li>Minimum of 10 years of experience in relevant sectors coupled with implementation of cyber-security services and solutions</li><li>Expertise in sector-specific assessment and compliance services (NERC, NRC, NEI, AWWA, NIST, etc…)</li><li>Expertise in SCADA and industrial control system cyber threat risk assessments (penetration testing, vulnerability analysis, threat modelling, etc…)</li><li>Expertise in delivering security architecture assessments for yet-to-be-built and existing assets</li><li>Development of customized security solutions for SCADA/ICS/DCS using commercial security countermeasures (IDS/IPS, SIEM, firewalls, etc…)</li><li>SCADA/ICS Incident Response and Forensics investigation support (real time, fly-away, law enforcement coordination)</li><li>Technical SCADA/ICS cyber security exercise development and execution; mock audits; no-knowledge security reviews; OSINT and exposure analysis programs</li><li>Procurement language support and development of security-focused procurement specifications for pre-acquisition activities</li><li>SCADA/ICS cyber risk management framework development, policy development services, business impact analysis, inventory and asset prioritization programs</li><li>Comprehensive curriculum of SCADA/ICS security training and awareness (introductory, intermediate, advanced, and executive-level)</li><li>AMI and Distribution Automation security assessments, including laboratory and field testing, reverse engineering code/firmware analysis, cryptographic analysis, and standards compliance (NISTR 7628, DHS, AMISEC, etc.)</li><li>Proven experience in successfully applying digital technologies / solutions to a very traditional working environment</li><li>Expertise with an agile implementation model and will have demonstrated its effective use on past projects</li><li>Detailed knowledge of IT/OT and digital technology trends including IIoT, Big Data, Cloud Computing, AR/VR, Automation, Operations Management and Business Systems</li><li>Able to communicate with different levels of client organizations from COMEX to site operations</li><li>Experience in working with distributed teams of professionals</li><li>Experience building and managing vendors and other parties relationships</li><li>A relevant industry cerfication ( CISSP with an optional concentration, or a similar relevant recognized industry designation e.g. CISM from ISACA or something from GIAC)</li>  </ul> We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.</div>
Title: Cyber Security Specialist

Job_Description: <strong>The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place.</strong> <br/><br/> This individual will be responsible for providing tier II support for a Managed Service and Security Provider (MSSP). The successful candidate will be an integral member of the security engineering team and will need to be fully cognizant of state-of-the-art network, firewall, and other security technologies, products and solutions as well as industry best practice with regard to the design, implementation and deployment of firewall solutions. <br/><br/> This individual should have hands-on experience managing firewalls such as Fortigate, Cisco ASA, Linux, Checkpoint, SonicWall or Palo Alto. This person must be able to communicate, and document instructions effectively with Tier 1, 2, and 3 support teams. Excellent customer service skills and written communication are required. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Qualifications:</em></strong>  <ul>  	<li>An Associate, Bachelors, or Master’s degree preferably in Computer Engineering/Networking, international equivalent, or equivalent experience</li> <li>2+ years of experience designing, implementing, and deploying firewalls, IDS/IPS, authentication systems, log management, content filtering , and technologies based on Information Security Best Practices</li> <li>2+ years of experience in networking, troubleshooting, and analysis tools</li> <li>Expert understanding and working knowledge of TCP/IP, access-control lists, VLANs, VPNs, firewalls, MPLS, and dynamic routing protocols such as BGP, OSPF and EIGRP</li> <li>Evaluates and recommends solutions for highly complex security systems according to industry best practices to safeguard internal information systems and databases</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and experience working collaboratively in cross-functional teams.</li> <li>Exceptional ability to work in a cooperative team environment to formulate complex technical solutions</li> <li>On-call Duties</li> </ul> <em><strong>Required:</strong></em> CCNA, NSE4 <br/><br/> <strong><em>Desired:</em></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Firewall Vender Certification, preferably Fortinet/Cisco/Linux/Checkpoint/Palo Alto</li> <li>Security Certifications: CompTIA Security+, GIAC, CCNA, FCNSA, FCNSP</li> <li>The ability to define security requirements and subsequently reviews complex systems to determine if they have been designed to comply with established standards</li> <li>The ability to conduct research and inform management of appropriate developments in firewall, IDPS, WCF, VPN, and secure networking technologies/products</li> </ul> Security Clearance is required for this vacancy. If you are not currently Security Cleared, you will need to be eligible for this and willing to go through the process. For more guidance on National Security Vetting please click here. <br/><br/> <strong>About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence:</strong> <br/><br/> We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cyber crime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes. <br/><br/> Our success is down to our people. The changing nature of our business means that we’re constantly looking for the brightest talent to help us fulfil our ambitions. As an experienced professional, we’ll entrust you with responsibility; this means that you’ll have client contact, variety and support from day one. <br/><br/> We'll encourage and support you to develop your skills and reward you as you grow. Whatever your area of expertise, you'll be much more than just a job title; you'll be an integral part of the business where your individual contribution makes a difference every day. Great minds deserve great rewards, so we also offer a very competitive salary and benefits package. <br/><br/> Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. Staying competitive in today’s global marketplace requires an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working. <br/><br/> <strong>Division Overview:</strong> <strong>Commercial Solutions</strong> <br/><br/> BAE Systems has been in the business of protecting some of the world’s most important assets and networks for over 100 years. We apply the same techniques, intelligence and strategy used in defending nations and governments to businesses as well. That’s us – Commercial Solutions - a division of BAE Systems that specializes in providing businesses around the globe with the products and services they need to stay protected in today’s connected world. <br/><br/> We offer a broad portfolio of on premise, managed and cloud-based products and services that are proven to protect our clients against financial crime and persistent cyber attackers. <br/><br/> We aim to be a global industry-leading, cyber and financial crime products business and will do this by leveraging the BAE Systems brand and by delivering higher grade security solutions for our clients. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Help us secure a connected world by being an unseen hero. Apply now and be inspired.</em></strong>
Title: Security Device Management Engineer L2

Job_Description: • Provide guidance on security architecture, practices & solutions to help business units to build & deliver solutions that meet CGI security requirements;   <ul> <li>Recommend security strategies, plans, priorities and investments needed for improvements to CGI security controls;</li> <li>Develop and maintain security architecture artifacts (e.g., models, templates, standards) that can be used to integrate CGI security requirements in projects & operations;</li> <li>Support business units to respond to client questions, assessments, and audits regarding CGI’s security posture and controls;</li> <li>Provide oversight, support and orientation to ensure security is integrated throughout the delivery lifecycle of Corporate projects;</li> <li>Track developments and changes in business, technology and threat environments to ensure they are addressed in CGI’s security strategy;</li> <li>Support the development and maintenance of CGI’s security architecture framework and processes;</li> <li>Review, evaluate the design and operational effectiveness of security controls and countermeasures used to protect CGI applications, services and solutions;</li> <li>Remain current on security technologies, tools and services and make recommendations for their use based on security, financial and operational criteria;</li> <li>Liaise with other security architects and practitioners to communicate CGI security practices and processes;</li> </ul>  Required qualifications to be successful in this role:   <ul> <li>University degree in a relevant field of study combined with at least 10 years experience in a security role;</li> <li>Proven experience in security architecture practices, processes, frameworks (TOGAF, Zachman, Sabsa) and strategic security planning;</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of security and risk management trends as well as emerging threats and vulnerabilities;</li> <li>Expert knowledge of security controls and countermeasures (defense in depth) including practical experience with identity management, cyber-security and IT processes / solutions;</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of application development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Dev Ops) and the processes and practices used to secure them;</li> <li>Experience with methodologies to conduct threat / risk modeling on new applications and services;</li> <li>Expert knowledge of security / risk control frameworks (COBiT, ISO 27001, ITIL), and business continuity / disaster recovery frameworks (ISO 22301, ISO 27031);</li> <li>Strong leadership and facilitation skills with an ability to build relationships with stakeholders;</li> <li>Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills (bilingual preferred);</li> <li>Highly self-motivated, self-directed and attentive to detail;</li> </ul>  <strong>Desired qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience in security incident response and investigation as well as Security Operations Centers;</li> <li>Experience with business case development, budgeting, IT governance and supplier management;</li> <li>Knowledge of applicable laws and regulations as they relate to security and the protection of personal information and client data;</li> <li>Relevant industry certifications including Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certification, Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certification, Open Group TOGAF, SANS GIAC or equivalent;</li>  </ul>

TCP/IP networks</div></li> <li> <div>Experience drafting security procedures and guidelines</div></li> <li> <div>Experience in web site and web application security assessment or pentest;</div></li> Use knowledge of the current IT environment <br/>  and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues, and <br/>  communicate this information to the engagement team and client management <br/>  through written correspondence and verbal presentations.</li> </ul>  <div><strong>People Responsibilities</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Contribute to people-related <br/>  initiatives, including development, coaching, recruiting, training and retaining <br/>  staff</li><li>Maintain an educational <br/>  program to continually develop personal skills of staff</li><li>Understand and follow <br/>  workplace policies and procedures</li> </ul>  <div><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></div> <br/>Desired <br/> qualifications include: <ul> <li>Undergraduate or masters’ <br/>  degree preferably in one of the following areas: Information <br/>  Security, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, <br/>  Engineering, and other related majors</li><li>Knowledge and 10 years of hands-on <br/>  experience with key components of cybersecurity incl. network & <br/>  infrastructure security, access and identity management, threat detection, <br/>  incident response, vulnerability management, security governance, risk and <br/>  compliance, security architecture, data protection, privacy, security <br/>  awareness and others.</li> <li>Expert knowledge and 8 - Title: Senior Manager – Cyber Security

Job_Description: <div>Auto req ID 198831BR </div><div> Job Title Sr Information Security Analyst - Cyber Threat Hunting </div><div> Report Location Toronto </div><div> Country Canada </div><div> Province/State Ontario </div><div> City1 Toronto </div><div> TD Description <p>Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.</p><p>Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</p> </div><div> Department Overview <p><strong>Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD</strong></p><p>We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.</p> </div><div> Job Type Regular </div><div> Job Status Full Time </div><div> Hours 37.5 </div><div> Business line Other </div><div> Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions </div><div> Job Category(s) Technology Solutions </div><div> Job Description <p>About This Role<br>Reporting to the Senior Manager, Threat Hunting, the Threat Hunting Analyst is responsible for helping the team in the detection, disruption, and the eradication of threat actors from enterprise networks. The Threat Hunting team will use advanced analytics, threat intelligence, and cutting-edge security technologies to participate in threat actor based investigations, create new detection methodologies, and provide subject matter expertise to incident response and monitoring functions. The Threat Hunting Analyst will also directly support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats.<br> <br>Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:</p><ul><li>Participate in threat hunting operations using threat intelligence, analysis of anomalous log data and results of brainstorming sessions to detect and mitigate threat actors on the network</li><li>Develop advanced methodologies to identify threat actor groups and associated tools, techniques and procedures</li><li>Produce metrics and develop dashboards to identify potential threats, suspicious/anomalous activity, malware, etc.</li><li>Drive the tuning of detection infrastructure with technology teams to identify emerging threats</li><li>Document best practices to enhance analyst playbooks, response procedures, and courses of action</li><li>Support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats</li><li>Provide guidance and/or lead on the development of on-going Information Security risk reporting monitoring key trends and defining metrics to regularly measure control effectiveness</li><li>Proactively review internal processes and activities and identify opportunities for improvement</li><li>Remain informed of emerging issues, industry trends and/or relevant changes to the security landscape</li></ul> <br>Job Description<br>We are looking for someone to join us as we develop and implement policies, programs and tools related to TD Technology Controls and Information Security. We'll look to you to help provide specialized expertise and guidance on assessing risks, identifying potential gaps and providing security solutions to mitigate risks and protect TD. <br><br>Here are the essential job functions of this position:<ul><li>Guide and advise partners on a broad range of specific Technology Controls and Information Security programs, policies, standards and incidents.</li><li>Engage in assessments related to risk, controls, implemented control procedures, vulnerability etc..</li><li>Lead or contribute to risk and control design assessments for an assigned business application, business portfolio, and overall enterprise, as well as risk mitigation and remediation plans and remediation strategy.</li><li>Actively contribute to the definition, development, and oversight of a global security management strategy and framework.</li><li>Ensure technology, processes, and governance are in place to monitor, detect, prevent, and react to both current and emerging technology and security threats to TD.</li><li>Develop on-going technology risk reporting, monitoring key trends and defining metrics to measure control effectiveness for your own area.</li><li>Participate in computer security incident responses relevant to business (or enterprise wide), represent your respective position to the business while conveying their needs to the incident response team.</li><li>Adhere to, advise, oversee, monitor and enforce enterprise frameworks and methodologies related to technology controls / information security activities.</li><li>Influence behavior to reduce risk, foster a strong technology risk management culture.</li><li>Define, develop, implement and manage standards, policies, procedures, and solutions that mitigate risk and maximize security, service availability, efficiency and effectiveness.</li></ul> </div><div> Job Requirements <p>Preferred Requirements</p><ul><li>At least 3-5 years of previous experience working in hunt teams, threat intelligence, incident response, or security operations</li><li>Strong working knowledge of security-relevant data, including network protocols, ports and common services, such as TCP/IP network protocols and application layer protocols (e.g. HTTP/S, DNS, FTP, SMTP, Active Directory etc.)</li><li>A background in Data Science, Statistics, anomaly detection or similar skills would be an asset</li></ul> <br>Job Requirements<ul><li>What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. Title: Sr Information Security Analyst - Cyber Threat Hunting

Job_Description: <strong>Must have minimum 3-5 years of Cyber Security Middle Management Experience.</strong>   <ul> <li>University or college degree in Computer Science/Engineering or 5 years of equivalent experience in the domain of computer science.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Knowledge of offensive and defensive operational security tactics and support of tactical response teams in the event of a security incident.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications/Competencies:</strong>   <ul> <li>Knowledge of NIST, ISO 27001, ITIL and other regulatory and standard compliance controls.</li>  <li>Proven experience in the design, implementation and troubleshooting solutions related to the security domain.</li>  <li>Good understanding of network infrastructure protection systems.</li>  <li>Good understanding of operating systems security measures.</li>  <li>Good understanding of application protection systems. (WEB)</li>  <li>Good understanding of Security Information and Events Management (SIEM).</li>  <li>Experience in the analysis of security events from the SIEM platform.</li>  <li>Experience in analyzing and protecting against cyber threats (malware )</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Duties/Accountabilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Analyze the effectiveness of the service and operational security processes and propose necessary adjustments</li>  <li>Ensure a technology watch in relation to customer and security environments under the governance of operational security management center.</li>  <li>Observe strict security protocols associated with all security management practices.</li>  <li>Authenticate all requests for services by applying authentication techniques in constant evolution.</li>  <li>Support sales as a subject matter expert and provide adequate assistance to meet the bid or help them provide the best possible solutions to meet the needs expressed.</li>  <li>Exercise a technical advisory role; endorse a mentoring approach to other members of the Security Operations Management team.</li>  <li>Coordinate projects and operational activities to enable the development of beneficial solutions for customers in the context of a high performance security operation.</li>  <li>Supervise the implementation and the development of new technologies and new services, analysis of operational impacts and network management processes, training and management platforms plans.</li>  <li>Reviews and interprets alerts and system notifications and provide advanced emergency services, incident management and analysis (according to industry specific and contractual requirements) to support security management clients.</li>  <li>Perform comparative analysis on the results from the industry specific constant evolving threats, vulnerabilities and all other malware launched on the Internet.</li>  <li>Depending on the nature of the threat perceived, assess and develop mitigation measures to ensure that appropriate mitigation is applied, and ensure that customers and management are informed.</li>  <li>Take proactive measures to manage all security equipment under the responsibility of the SOC.</li>  <li>Develop complex documentation to allow trend analysis, design solutions and operating guides or various deliverables agreed with customers.</li> </ul>

In this position, you will be able to grow and learn new skills though exciting interactions with clients and other CGI teams across Canada and the world.</div><br/>  <div> Your future duties and responsibilities:<br/><br/>You will be able to leverage your experience and interest in many technologies and apply your analytical skills to identify and assess risk to our clients. Job_Description: Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the clients business. <br/> Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. <br/> Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge.
