Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations. <br/> People Responsibilities <br/> Contribute to people-related initiatives, including development, coaching, recruiting, training and retaining staff <br/> Maintain an educational program to continually develop personal skills of staff <br/> Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures <br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/> <strong>Desired qualifications include:</strong> <br/> Undergraduate or masters’ degree preferably in one of the following areas: Information Security, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, and other related majors <br/> Knowledge and 5-7 years of hands-on experience with key components of cybersecurity incl. network & infrastructure security, access and identity management, threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, security governance, risk and compliance, security architecture, data protection, privacy, security awareness and others. <br/> Expert knowledge and 4-5 years of practical experience with common frameworks, standards and methodologies used in cybersecurity field <br/> Practical experience with conducting risk assessments and testing of controls <br/> Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of data analytics methods <br/> Possession of at least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISA CISM <br/> Familiarity with or knowledge of cybersecurity in Industrial Control Systems and Operational Technology <br/> Demonstrated leadership abilities <br/> Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills
Title: Cyber Security Manager

Job_Description: Safe Software is currently looking for an Information Security Analyst, to join our Operations Team. In this role, you will support the formation and execution of the data governance and security framework, policies, procedures and standards. You will facilitate compliance initiatives with respect to the definition, standardization, quality, integrity, access, privacy and security of data. As well, you will formalize compliance initiatives related to organizational security and investigate, initiate, and manage third party security certifications. <br/><br/> Initially reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the successful candidate will be required to work closely with IT and Legal department heads and to participate as a key stakeholder on various teams tasked with the evolution and continuous improvement of our business processes. <br/><br/> Safe Software was founded in Vancouver, BC in 1993 by two people and a dream to unleash the power of data. From this vision, FME (Feature Manipulation Engine) was born. FME is the integration platform with the best support for spatial data and the tool that organizations can employ to transform their data in limitless ways. Our software allows anyone to move and share their data to create useful workflows in a simple drag-and-drop format. Whatever the type of data – be it sensors, maps, building models, imagery, databases, social media, web services, and more – FME is up for the task. <br/><br/> Now, with over 150 staff and an exciting office move on the horizon, Safe Software is looking for talented people to join our growing team! Are you up for the challenge?<br/><br/>Key Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Collaborate with stakeholders to define, implement and maintain corporate security and data governance policies.</li> <li>Perform vulnerability testing, risk analyses and security assessments for all organizational facilities and teams.</li> <li>Recommend, develop, document and maintain standards and procedures that ensure data integrity, privacy, quality and security.</li> <li>Recommend, develop, document and maintain standards and procedures that are in compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements that cover internal and external parties, physical security systems, internet and computer systems.</li> <li>Monitor and respond to regulatory developments and industry best practices in a timely manner.</li> <li>Develop and manage security breach protocols and investigation procedures.</li> <li>Communicate data governance and organizational security information and policies to the organization, ensuring awareness and understanding.</li> <li>Act as a subject matter expert in data governance and organizational security topics and issues.</li> <li>Develop and refine appropriate reports (internal and external-facing) which demonstrate program activities and results.</li>   <li>Develop and coordinate security plans with outside vendors.</li> <li>Perform other related duties as assigned.</li> </ul>  Key Characteristics   <ul> <li>Ability to prepare and analyze data governance and security issues in a logical manner and be able to summarize findings to both a technical and non-technical audience.</li> <li>Ability to facilitate discussions which clearly define an opportunity, recommend creative solutions and implement changes in a dynamic team environment.</li> <li>Must be a committed, enthusiastic team player with a focus on continuous performance improvement.</li> <li>You are a curious and creative thinker who is deeply interested in the latest security developments and tools.</li> <li>Must have the ability to work constructively with individuals across the organization.</li> <li>Excellent organizational skills.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively write reports, standards, and policies.</li> </ul>  Education Requirements & Experience   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Cyber Security, or other technology field or equivalent work experience.</li> <li>CISSP, CISM, or other security certification is desirable.</li> <li>Experience working on information management, data governance and/or electronic records in a business operational environment.</li> <li>Knowledge of CASL, PIPEDA, GDPR and other data privacy laws is an asset.</li> <li>Experience with cloud-based services and infrastructure is an asset.</li> </ul>  What It’s Like to Work Here<br/><br/>Safe Software is full of passionate and innovative people who thrive on working together as a team to deliver state-of-the-art technology to our customers. We take our work seriously, but have fun doing it. <br/><br/> On your first day at Safe, you’ll receive a new hire orientation with our People & Culture team, tour our facilities and visit our lounge, games room, fitness centre, bike room, and kitchen (with free beverages) – before ending at your own private office. You’ll then get your choice between PC or Mac, meet your team, and start shipping production code! <br/><br/> Join us as we build the data integration technology that tens of thousands of customers depend on.
Title: Information Security Analyst

Job_Description: Company Overview <br/> <div>Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com</div>  <br/>Department Overview <br/> <div><strong>Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD</strong> <br/><br/> We can’t afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD’s technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.</div>  <br/><strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div>About This Role <br/> Reporting to the Senior Manager, Threat Hunting, the Threat Hunting Analyst is responsible for helping the team in the detection, disruption, and the eradication of threat actors from enterprise networks. The Threat Hunting team will use advanced analytics, threat intelligence, and cutting-edge security technologies to participate in threat actor based investigations, create new detection methodologies, and provide subject matter expertise to incident response and monitoring functions. The Threat Hunting Analyst will also directly support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats. <br/><br/> Here’s some of what you may be asked to perform:  <ul> <li>Participate in threat hunting operations using threat intelligence, analysis of anomalous log data and results of brainstorming sessions to detect and mitigate threat actors on the network</li> <li>Develop advanced methodologies to identify threat actor groups and associated tools, techniques and procedures</li> <li>Produce metrics and develop dashboards to identify potential threats, suspicious/anomalous activity, malware, etc.</li> <li>Drive the tuning of detection infrastructure with technology teams to identify emerging threats</li> <li>Document best practices to enhance analyst playbooks, response procedures, and courses of action</li> <li>Support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats</li> <li>Provide guidance and/or lead on the development of on-going Information Security risk reporting monitoring key trends and defining metrics to regularly measure control effectiveness</li> <li>Proactively review internal processes and activities and identify opportunities for improvement</li> <li>Remain informed of emerging issues, industry trends and/or relevant changes to the security landscape</li> </ul> Job Description <br/> We are looking for someone to join us as we develop and implement policies, programs and tools related to TD Technology Controls and Information Security. We’ll look to you to help provide specialized expertise and guidance on assessing risks, identifying potential gaps and providing security solutions to mitigate risks and protect TD. <br/><br/> Here are the essential job functions of this position:  <ul> <li>Guide and advise partners on a broad range of specific Technology Controls and Information Security programs, policies, standards and incidents.</li> <li>Engage in assessments related to risk, controls, implemented control procedures, vulnerability etc..</li> <li>Lead or contribute to risk and control design assessments for an assigned business application, business portfolio, and overall enterprise, as well as risk mitigation and remediation plans and remediation strategy.</li> <li>Actively contribute to the definition, development, and oversight of a global security management strategy and framework.</li> <li>Ensure technology, processes, and governance are in place to monitor, detect, prevent, and react to both current and emerging technology and security threats to TD.</li> <li>Develop on-going technology risk reporting, monitoring key trends and defining metrics to measure control effectiveness for your own area.</li> <li>Participate in computer security incident responses relevant to business (or enterprise wide), represent your respective position to the business while conveying their needs to the incident response team.</li> <li>Adhere to, advise, oversee, monitor and enforce enterprise frameworks and methodologies related to technology controls / information security activities.</li> <li>Influence behavior to reduce risk, foster a strong technology risk management culture.</li> <li>Define, develop, implement and manage standards, policies, procedures, and solutions that mitigate risk and maximize security, service availability, efficiency and effectiveness.</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <br/> <div>Preferred Requirements  <ul> <li>At least 3-5 years of previous experience working in hunt teams, threat intelligence, incident response, or security operations</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of security-relevant data, including network protocols, ports and common services, such as TCP/IP network protocols and application layer protocols (e.g. HTTP/S, DNS, FTP, SMTP, Active Directory etc.)</li> <li>A background in Data Science, Statistics, anomaly detection or similar skills would be an asset</li> </ul> Job Requirements  <ul> <li>What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. Here are the minimum requirements for this position:</li> <li>University Degree.</li> <li>Information Security Certification / Accreditation an asset.</li> <li>5-7 years of relevant experience.</li> <li>Firm commitment to staying informed and abreast of emerging issues, industry trends etc.</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of one or more technology controls or security domains, disciplines and practices.</li> <li>Sound to advanced knowledge of business, technology controls, security and risk issues.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to participate in projects of moderate to high complexity.</li> <li>Ability and commitment to serve as a subject matter expert on business-specific, cross-functional and enterprise initiatives.</li> <li>Readiness to participate in projects of moderate to high complexity and provide complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional, business line or enterprise level.</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/> <div><strong>Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.</li> <li>Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others.</li> <li>Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals.</li> <li>Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners.</li> <li>Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency.</li> <li>Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside.</li> </ul> <strong>Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas.</strong> This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you’ve never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.</div>  <br/>Hours <br/> <div>37.5</div> <br/> Inclusiveness <br/> <div>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div> <br/>
Title: Sr Information Security Analyst – Cyber Threat Hunting

Job_Description: <br/><br/> Requisition ID: 25074 <br/><br/> Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Purpose</strong> <br/><br/> Oversees and leads a team of auditors responsible for internal audit activities for the Cyber / Emerging Technology, Infrastructure and Digital Banking portfolios in support of the Corporate Audit in executing its global mandate. This includes developing and implementing an appropriate audit strategy for these risks and portfolios for Latin America in conjunction with the regional Technology Audit teams. Determines whether internal controls, risk management and governance processes are adequately designed, implemented and operating effectively. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> 1. Leads and supports the audit department in performing global Information / Cyber Security, Emerging Technology and Infrastructure Audits. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 2. Performs a Center of Excellence role for global audits in these risks and portfolios working with IT Audit department staff operating in Mexico, Peru, Chile, Colombia, and Central America and the local Chief Audit Executives. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 3. Leads and supports the audit department in performing audits on Digital Banking globally. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 4. Leads and drives a customer focused culture throughout their team to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 5. Manages the Annual Planning and Risk Assessment process by preparing the Plan strategy and providing input into the development, completion and reporting of the Annual Audit Plan, ensuring audit methodology is used, objectives are met, Plan is completed, that appropriate working papers are maintained and conform to IIA and Department standards <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 6. Validates Audit Plans and continuously conducts risk assessments throughout the year to identify other areas of emerging risk for audit coverage consideration and ensures the latest industry standards and regulatory requirements are incorporated to keep the Plan current and robust. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 7. Reviews audit issues to ensure internal control weaknesses and root causes are identified, properly defined, documented and reported; ensures issues are understood by senior management and that corrective action will be taken; prepares and reviews audit reports for presentation to line management.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 8. Maintains effective internal communication across the Audit Department as well as effective lines of communication with auditees and senior management, including appropriate handling of conflicts and issue resolution.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 9. Directs day-to-day activities in a manner consistent with the Bank’s risk culture and the relevant risk appetite statement and limits. Communicates the Bank’s risk culture and risk appetite statement throughout their teams. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 10. Creates an environment in which his/her team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet all obligations to the bank and regulators. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> 11. Builds a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Functional Competencies</strong> <br/><br/> Candidates should have expert knowledge of IT Risk and Audit management (governance, operations, and management) with specific experience working in cyber risk areas and the ability to quickly assimilate emerging technologies and risks and develop audit programs for testing sustainable implementation of controls. <br/><br/> Candidates require strong leadership, communication and strategic influencing capability, supported by well-developed analytical and strategic thinking competencies. <br/><br/> Requires expert IT Risk management experience; systems design, change management, release management, availability and security services including digital banking transformative elements and cloud computing. <br/><br/> Expert knowledge of multiple global businesses including related application systems and procedures. <br/><br/> Expert ability to balance competing or conflicting goals of various departments and stakeholders which requires a mature, diplomatic approach and highly developed negotiation and influencing skills. <br/><br/> Expert communication, facilitation and presentation skills for developing communication strategies for Executive approval through to implementation of strategies and programs. <br/><br/> Highly developed intuitive, forward thinking to create and communicate a strategic vision. <br/><br/> An ability to anticipate future events, trends, problems and opportunities, and perceive patterns as they emerge to influence audit work related to emerging risks. <br/><br/> This is a high profile position requiring a strong commitment, ability to meet tight deadlines, competing demands and priorities, and heavy workload at peak times. <br/><br/> Will potentially need to become fluent in Spanish given the geographic span of the role. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Education / Experience</strong> <br/><br/> MBA or Equivalent <br/><br/> CISA – Designation or CISSP – Designation <br/><br/> 15+ years in financial industry and 15+ years in IT industry <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto <br/><br/> As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
Title: Vice President, Audit, Emerging Risk & Cyber Security Audit

Job_Description: <div>Come drive the transformation of financial services, solve big problems and make a meaningful difference in peoples lives.</div> <div>Upgrade, Inc. is a new consumer credit platform that combines personal loans with tools that help consumers understand, monitor and improve their credit. The company raised $60 million in its first capital raise last year, which remains the largest Series A round ever raised by a Fintech company. While the founding team is very accomplished and the business model has been well established, we are still in the early days of this new platform and there is still an opportunity to have a very significant impact.</div><div>Upgrade has been named a 'Best Place to Work in the Bay Area' by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. The Company was also recently named the #1 Personal Loan option in Q4 2017 by LendingTree customers.</div><div>We are looking for new team members who get excited about creating, designing and implementing new and better solutions to join a team of just over 250 talented and passionate Fintech engineers, product, credit, finance, legal, compliance, design, operations and marketing professionals.</div> <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>We are looking for an Application Security specialist to help expand our Software Assurance program. As part of the cross-funcitonal Information Security Team you might be involved in other activities like compliance or operations but, the main activities related to the Application Security Specialist role includes:</li><li>Evaluation of security technology. methodology, and tools to better the software development life cycle</li><li>Help train developers, and QA personnel to the appropriate level of software security knowledge to perform their responsibilities</li><li>Improving and supporting application security tool services including static analysis and dynamic testing tools</li><li>Supporting incident response and architecture review processes whenever application security expertise is needed</li><li>Managing routine penetration testing services, including both expert consulting and managed services</li><li>Providing manual penetration testing and standards gap analysis services to internal business and technology partners</li><li>Supporting, Improving and maintaining secure development standards and application security framework projects</li><li>Supporting Vendor Management activities to ensure 3rd party software and development meet security standards</li><li>Integrating threat modeling practices into the product development life cycle</li><li>Providing security requirements for test driven design to assess control effectiveness</li><li>Producing metrics reporting the state of application security programs and performance of development teams against requirements</li> </ul>  You are  <ul> <li>Highly motivated and self driven</li><li>Enjoy learning new technologies and applying that to solving problems</li><li>Enjoy collaborating and working in small teams</li><li>Technically strong and hands-on</li><li>Good at multitasking and thrive in fast pace environments</li><li>Methodical, thorough, and solution oriented</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>5-10 years of relevant work experience</li><li>Deep hands-on experience with agile development processes and have experience integrating secure development practices into the model. The ideal candidate has experience writing and testing web applications and web services.</li><li>Have familiarity with a variety of development and testing tools.</li><li>Have expert hands-on experience working with one or more SAST, DAST and IAST tools.</li><li>Candidates must be able to explain vulnerabilities and weaknesses, and discuss effective defensive techniques.</li><li>Experience with cyber security attacks and mitigation methods (red/blue team experience).</li><li>Experience working with web applications and browser security; security assessments and penetration testing; identity and access control; applied cryptography and security protocols; security information and event monitoring and intrusion detection</li><li>Expertise in employing analytics and threat intelligence techniques, Incident response process; Software security</li><li>IT supply-chain risk management and assurance; cloud security operations</li> </ul>  <br/> The good Stuff  <ul> <li>Downtown office location across from the Bell Centre</li><li>Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, & vision</li><li>Kitchen stocked with beverages, snacks & treats</li>  </ul>
Title: Information Security (AppSec)

Job_Description: <strong>The Opportunity -</strong> <strong>Security Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> FreshBooks has a big vision. We launched in 2003 but were just getting started and theres a lot left to do. We're a high performing team working towards a common goal: building a world class online accounting application to help small businesses better manage their finances. Known for extraordinary customer service and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries. <br/><br/> In this newly created position, the <strong>Security Engineer</strong> will be hands-on and responsible for security monitoring, incident handling, security operations processes, threat management, documenting security policies and more. Youll help your fellow engineers write better and more secure code. And youll ensure were always compliant with PCI-DSS and other best security practices. <br/><br/> <strong>We expect you to have:</strong>  <ul> <li>A solid track record of experience in the security field as an Engineer, Developer, Specialist, or similar</li> <li>Strong Cloud Security and Security Architecture experience</li> <li>Strong experience as a Security subject matter expert</li> <li>Strong troubleshooting, reasoning, problem-solving, customer service, and communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>The more of the following you bring, the better:</strong>  <ul> <li>A university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering or a relevant field</li> <li>Specific experience with Google Cloud Platform or similar (AWS, Azure)</li> <li>Experience with microservices and distributed systems</li> <li>Hands-on experience with cloud storage solutions</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of information technology security, trends, leading practices, regulatory and industry standard compliance issues (PCI-DSS and others)</li> <li>Experience performing threat modeling, offensive assessments, penetration testing, exploit development, or vulnerability analysis</li> <li>Working knowledge of common and industry standard cloud-native/cloud-friendly authentication/authorization mechanisms (OAuth, OpenID, SAML etc.) and key management/secret vaulting solutions, including HSM (Thales, Gemalto SafeNet etc.)</li> </ul> <strong>What youll do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be a trusted technical advisor and solve complex Cloud security technical challenges</li> <li>Coach internal teams (i.e. Software Development) on security disciplines and work closely with these teams to ensure that theyre writing secure code and designing secure systems.</li> <li>Enable teams to take ownership of secure code</li> <li>Collaborate with Software Engineering and Architecture teams on security strategy, roadmaps, standards, and governance</li> <li>Mentor the Product Development team ensuring adherence to security engineering best practices</li> <li>Ensure that we maintain PCI-DSS compliance and other certifications</li> <li>Audit and analyze production code for potential security concerns</li> <li>Identify and document information security risks and propose mitigating controls</li> <li>Provide analysis and guidance regarding threats, vulnerabilities, and privacy and security incidents</li> <li>Identify security gaps and recommend & facilitate the mitigation of the gaps in line with industry standards and best practices</li> <li>Build knowledge of and stay current on developments in the cyber threat landscape to adapt investigation techniques and provide recommendations on responding to and remediating related incidents</li> <li>Actively detect, respond to, and remediate security events across our global infrastructure.</li> </ul> <strong>What we offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, health benefits from day 1 and extra days off (office is closed between Christmas and New Years)</li> <li>RRSP matching program and generous parental leave policy</li> <li>Weekly catered lunches, beer, and snacks</li> <li>Team and company offsites, hackoffs, and paid community volunteer days and religious observance days</li> <li>Professional development opportunities and flexible work schedules</li> <li>Office gym with showers and complimentary towel service</li> <li>Secure, indoor bike parking with well-stocked repair bay</li> <li>Ping Pong, Foosball, Massage Chairs, Nintendo Stations and more.</li> <li>Dog friendly office</li> <li>TTC & GO Accessible</li> </ul> Sure, there are perks, but the real reason people are proud to work at FreshBooks is because each person knows their opinion is respected, and they can see the difference they make in the lives of over 10 million small business owners around the world. If you want to accelerate your career, work on projects you're passionate about and have just as much of a life outside the office as insideyou're exactly what we're looking for. <br/><br/> <strong>We value our people...</strong> <br/><br/> We recognize and reward ingenious work. We all have real lives, and respect work lifestyle balance. We all have a voice that is heard throughout the company. We always make time for fun, and have one of the most unique, employee-led cultures out there. Join the FreshBooks choir or a class in the gym, organize a gaming night, teach a dev lunch and learn, or use a paid volunteer day to share your skills with the community. Salaries are competitive and compensation packages include a stake in the company. Interested? Lets get started! <br/><br/> FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com.
Title: Security Engineer

Job_Description: Description<br/><br/><strong>Do you want to use cutting-edge technology to build better financial experiences for all Canadians?</strong><br/><br/>Grow is Canada's leading enterprise fintech provider. We provide SaaS solutions to all sectors of banking in Canada. Our customers include big banks, credit unions, and fintech startups.<br/><br/>One of the tenets of Grow’s engineering efforts is to improve the security of our platform, both for our partners and for our end users. We’re entrusted with sensitive information by some of Canada’s biggest financial institutions, which means security must be interwoven into everything we do. <br/><br/> Our information security specialists and security engineers focus on architecture, framework and process creation, research and analysis, and policy development, while working closely with our engineering and leadership teams to fortify Grow’s platform for the benefit of its partners, and its end users. <br/><br/> We code review all changes, continuously integrate, pay down technical debt, and aim for high automated test coverage. We love microservices and, while we mostly use Java, Google Cloud Platform, JavaScript, and React, new services can be built using whatever tools make sense to get the job done. All engineers are also given “10% time” to work on anything that tickles their fancy. <br/><br/> <strong>What you'll do:</strong> <ul>  <li>Be a subject matter expert to teams across the organization on all things related to information security with a goal to to help architect new secure systems and explain how our current systems are secure;</li> <li>Design frameworks and processes and work with the engineering teams to find areas for improvement in our platform;</li> <li>Exhibit a keen balance of security risk mitigation and product enhancement;</li> <li>Evaluate existing Grow applications to identify risks;</li> <li>Be the first responder if a security event occurs, with a prepared analysis protocol;</li> <li>Be a subject matter expert on emerging attack vectors;</li> <li>Work with the engineering team to design frameworks to prevent current and future attack scenarios;</li> <li>Create and manage training exercises for new hires and existing employees to develop organizational security knowledge;</li> <li>Develop and institute security monitoring and controls, particularly as they pertain to various security certifications, such as SOCII, PCI, ISO, etc.; and</li> <li>Develop a client-facing communication skill set, as you interact with compliance, risk, and security teams from global banks and financial institutions to exemplify Grow’s security practices.</li> </ul>  Requirements<br/><br/><strong>You have:</strong> <ul>  <li>Industry experience in a technical security role;</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree, PhD or equivalent in Computing Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field</li> <li>An interest in a CISO or similar role in the future;</li> <li>An undeniable passion for information, cyber and system security;</li> <li>A way about discovering flaws in applications, and sufficient communication skills to relay to appropriate stakeholders about how to fix said flaws;</li> <li>Good judgment about the relative priority of known bugs and security flaws; and</li> <li>A strong understanding and can empathize with an attacker and anticipate attack vectors, particularly those that are out-of-the-box.</li> </ul>
Title: Security Engineer

Job_Description: <div>Auto req ID 192144BR</div> <div> Job Title Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations</div> <div> Report Location Toronto</div> <div> Country Canada</div> <div> Province/State Ontario</div> <div> City1 Toronto</div> <div> TD Description<br/><br/>Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</div> <div> Department Overview Global Security & Investigations (GSI) is a specialized team dedicated to the security and safety of our employees, customers, third parties, physical assets and information. Using a risk-based approach, the team is responsible to identify, investigate, mitigate and manage risks by developing key strategies, designing comprehensive security and investigative programs, educating businesses within TDBG on security measures and protocols and working collaboratively with internal and external partners.</div> <div> Job Type Regular</div> <div> Job Status Full Time</div> <div> Hours 7.5</div> <div> Business line Other</div> <div> Job Category - Primary Global Security & Investigations</div> <div> Job Category(s) Global Security & Investigations</div> <div> Job Description The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations, supports the protection of organizational assets and human resources across all TD enterprise-wide locations (including remote offices) and by providing advice, planning, and support for GSI Investigations leadership. <br/><br/> The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations:  <ul> <LI>Leads a team of highly skilled Digital Evidence professionals who conduct complex and sensitive investigations, across North America</LI><LI>Applies sound methodologies to collect, preserve, and analyze digital evidence</LI><LI>Stays abreast on the emerging technology threat landscape across the globe</LI><LI>Works with Financial Crimes & Fraud Management Group (FC&FMG), fraud operations groups, IT security (TRM&IS), Legal, Human Resources, and external law enforcement, as necessary, to identify cyber attackers</LI><LI>Researches, evaluates, develops, tests and applies new methodologies for analyzing digital evidence to reduce the risk of exposure to TD Bank</LI><LI>Supports / develops procedures and standards and delivers advice, direction and education to TD management and staff</LI><LI>Serves as an ambassador for GSI within FC&FMG and TD in general</LI></ul></div> <br/> <div> Job Requirements <STRONG><EM>Key Accountabilities</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Manage a cross-border team of highly-skilled Digital Evidence professionals, locally or remotely</LI><LI>Lead Digital Evidence / cybercrime investigations</LI><LI>Focus on operational efficiency to ensure the Digital Evidence team is leveraging tools and processes that reduce redundancy and improve capacity</LI><LI>Stay current on industry trends and emerging threats</LI><LI>Respond to business units and FC&FMG teams to investigate simple or complex, sensitive, or urgent matters, usually within minimal time-frames</LI><LI>Develop and maintain programs for supervision, timeliness, and management of all assigned investigators/investigations</LI><LI>Ensure all reports (Interim and Final Investigative Reports, Briefing Notes, etc.) are properly written and vetted prior to distribution to senior management</LI><LI>Prepare regular written or in-person Digital Evidence updates</LI><LI>Develop and maintain two-way communications with peers within FC&FMG, and Digital Evidence teams in other Financial Institutions</LI><LI>Testify and present evidence, as required</LI><LI>Develop and maintain effective liaison relationships, at senior levels with law enforcement, security agencies, and external security experts</LI><LI>Stand in for the Senior Manager, Forensic Investigations and Digital Evidence, for functions or meetings or as interim relief</LI> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Required Competencies</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Extensive knowledge of investigations and criminal and regulatory legislation, regulation, procedures, and guidelines</LI><LI>Solid understanding of organizational priorities and relationships</LI><LI>Solid understanding of the principles of investigation, including reporting, evidence handling, and court or regulatory proceedings</LI><LI>Solid understanding of governing plans and documents, procedures, and business administration</LI><LI>Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, organization, leadership and planning skills</LI><LI>Proven ability to manage crisis and emergency incidents</LI><LI>Ability to work with businesses from a business perspective and interpret Digital Evidence matters in a way understandable to business and non-technical people</LI><LI>Self-starter, strategic thinker, negotiator and consensus builder, proven ability to satisfactorily manage competing priorities</LI><LI>Expert understanding of network protocols, TCP/IP fundamentals OR</LI><LI>Expert understanding of operating systems (Windows, Linux and OSX)</LI><LI>Expert understanding of intrusion detection systems (e.g. Snort, Suricata) and tools (e.g. tcpdump, Wireshark)</LI><LI>Knowledge of Malware Triage and Reverse Engineering</LI><LI>Knowledge of network based services and client/server applications</LI><LI>Knowledge of enterprise systems and infrastructure</LI><LI>Familiarity with network architecture and security infrastructure placement</LI><LI>Familiarity with security tools such as Anti-Virus, Ironport systems and Data Loss Prevention Tools</LI><LI>Experience with programming/scripting languages</LI><LI>Background in operational information security disciplines (e.g. incident response, security infrastructure management or monitoring services)</LI><LI>Background performing incident response and digital forensics</LI><LI>Experience in config/mgmt of feeds into event aggregation and correlation systems (e.g., Splunk, ArcSight)</LI><LI>Experience with improvement of analyst effectiveness by optimizing signature quality in collaboration with other analysts and developers</LI><LI>Background in systems administration for Windows and/or Unix based environments</LI> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Decision-Making Authority</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Approves procedural level governance</LI><LI>As assigned, approves budget and financial matters as provided in TD’s Delegated Signing Authorities</li> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Key Relationships</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Close working relationship with peers in FC&FMG, TRM&IS, Legal, and HR</LI><LI>Frequent interaction with senior executives in Corporate Office and all Business Groups</LI></ul></div> <br/> <strong><div> Additional Information <STRONG><EM>Education and Experience:</EM></strong>  <ul> <LI>University degree or college diploma from a recognized Institute of Technology or University program in an appropriate specialty such as Computing Science, or a related field</LI><LI>Professional designation in the following designations would be an asset: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), SANS Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) and EnCE (Encase Certified Examiner)</LI><LI>Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with a corporate or government investigative and/or intelligence department within an organization of comparable size and complexity to TD, including at least 5 years’ experience in investigations</LI></ul></div> <br/> <div> Inclusiveness<br/><br/>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div>   <li>*Province/State (Primary) Ontario</li>  <div> City (Primary) Toronto</div>

Job_Description: <div> Find similar career opportunities</div><br/>  <div> Category: <br/>  Cyber Security Consulting</div><br/>  	<div> City: <br/><br/>  Ottawa, Ontario, Canada</div><br/>  <div> Position ID: <br/>  J0318-2137</div><br/>  	<div> Employment Type: <br/><br/>  Full Time</div><br/>  <div> Position Description:<br/><br/>Join us and put your career in IT-security into high-gear! <br/><br/> We currently have an exciting opportunity to join the Managed Security Services (MSS) team as a Senior Security Operations Centre (SOC) Analyst. <br/><br/> The Team: Managed Security Services (MSS) is composed of several teams: our two Ottawa 24x7x365 Security Operations Centres (SOCs), the Deployment and Support teams (5 teams which are each focused on several technologies and services), the solution architects, the project managers, and the client service managers. We are a very collaborative close-knit team in MSS � team spirit and satisfying career growth for our members are a key focus for all of us. <br/><br/> Why us: CGI does consulting, yes, but our team is different. MSS is a dynamic and stable team of over 200 security professionals working together since 2001. We are growing! Come join us and see what it's like to work and learn in the exciting field of IT security with a great group of professionals. MSS team members are supportive and collaborative � you�ll receive the support you need to be successful in your position and to enhance your security skills while furthering your career. <br/><br/> Career growth: This role provides excellent career growth potential since you will be working with leading-edge technologies and methodologies, you will have access to our various training options and there are multiple career growth paths within the MSS Team. If you are serious about honing your skills and career, we�re serious about giving you the opportunities to grow and to learn multiple security technologies and standards or to take on other tasks that are of interest to you beyond what is listed below. <br/><br/> Technical environment: We use top-ranked industry-leading security tools and technologies � incorporating several security technologies for each of our multiple services. MSS has an on-site technology lab which all our members can use for installation trials and proof-of-concepts, training, testing and trouble-shooting. <br/><br/> Our Clients: Many leading big-name clients trust our team and use our many managed security services to protect their business. We are gaining many new clients and the list has been growing globally into Europe and Asia since CGI�s acquisition of Logica.</div><br/>  <div> Your future duties and responsibilities:<br/><br/>The successful candidate will (after a training period, and in collaboration with other SOC Senior Analysts): <br/> �	Provide oversight, coaching, support and quality assurance to the SOC Analyst team members. <br/> �	Assist and mentor the SOC Analysts with monitoring security alerts of potential hacker attacks detected by security systems such as: Intrusion Detection & Prevention Systems (NIDS/NIPS, HIDS/HIPS, WIDS), Log Monitoring, File Integrity Monitoring and SIEM. <br/> �	Assist and mentor the SOC Analysts with determining and classifying the severity of alerts and assess potential impacts. <br/> �	Assist and mentor the SOC Analysts with reporting and investigating potential security incidents. <br/> �	Provide recommendations to clients for containment and eradication of threats. <br/> �	Develop custom signatures in order to detect emerging threats. <br/> �	Ensure that Service Level Agreements are met. <br/> �	Provide assistance in the deployment of new security services/technologies. <br/> �	Provide knowledge-transfer to the Security Analysts on newly deployed services/technologies. <br/> �	Create and/or update security operations processes and procedures. <br/> �	Assist in IT security investigations, exercises and tests. <br/> �	Provide input during audits. <br/> �	Research, consultation with colleagues and training to maintain awareness of trends in new security threats, technologies and regulations. <br/> �	May be requested to act as a backup to the Incident Handler position to coordinate incident handling and escalations to internal support teams to ensure timely delivery of incident resolutions. <br/> �	Be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Corporate and Client Security Incidents. <br/> �	Other related duties as assigned by the supervisor. <br/> �	Since this is a 24x7x365 environment, shift work and/or pager rotation is required.</div><br/>  <div> Required qualifications to be successful in this role:<br/><br/>�	Experience in IT Security. <br/> �	Strong background in TCP/IP networking. <br/> �	Experience with three (3) or more of the following (not necessary to have all): <br/> o	Intrusion Detection or Prevention Systems <br/> o	System log analysis <br/> o	Enterprise Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system(s) <br/> o	TCP/IP packet analysis <br/> o	Linux or UNIX <br/> �	Demonstrated ability for analytical thinking and research (e.g. into technologies, standards or issues). <br/> �	Team player with ability to work autonomously. <br/> �	Ability to speak and communicate effectively with peers, management and clients. <br/> �	Government of Canada Secret Clearance is required (or the ability to obtain one). <br/><br/> <strong>Desirables:</strong> <br/> �	Completion of a post-secondary educational program in IT Security or Computer Sciences from a recognized community college or university. <br/> �	Certification(s) such as: SANS GCIH or SANS GCIA, CCNA, CISSP, ITIL <br/> �	Experience working in an IT Security Operations Centre, incorporating SANS methodology.</div><br/>  <div> What you can expect from us:<br/><br/><strong>Build your career with us.</strong> <br/><br/> It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change�supporting our clients� digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. <br/><br/> At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create. <br/><br/> Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. <br/><br/> Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com. <br/><br/> No unsolicited agency referrals please. <br/><br/> CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Job_Description: <div>Auto req ID 192144BR</div> <div> Job Title Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations</div> <div> Report Location Toronto</div> <div> Country Canada</div> <div> Province/State Ontario</div> <div> City1 Toronto</div> <div> TD Description<br/><br/>Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</div> <div> Department Overview Global Security & Investigations (GSI) is a specialized team dedicated to the security and safety of our employees, customers, third parties, physical assets and information. Using a risk-based approach, the team is responsible to identify, investigate, mitigate and manage risks by developing key strategies, designing comprehensive security and investigative programs, educating businesses within TDBG on security measures and protocols and working collaboratively with internal and external partners.</div> <div> Job Type Regular</div> <div> Job Status Full Time</div> <div> Hours 7.5</div> <div> Business line Other</div> <div> Job Category - Primary Global Security & Investigations</div> <div> Job Category(s) Global Security & Investigations</div> <div> Job Description The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations, supports the protection of organizational assets and human resources across all TD enterprise-wide locations (including remote offices) and by providing advice, planning, and support for GSI Investigations leadership. <br/><br/> The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations:  <ul> <LI>Leads a team of highly skilled Digital Evidence professionals who conduct complex and sensitive investigations, across North America</LI><LI>Applies sound methodologies to collect, preserve, and analyze digital evidence</LI><LI>Stays abreast on the emerging technology threat landscape across the globe</LI><LI>Works with Financial Crimes & Fraud Management Group (FC&FMG), fraud operations groups, IT security (TRM&IS), Legal, Human Resources, and external law enforcement, as necessary, to identify cyber attackers</LI><LI>Researches, evaluates, develops, tests and applies new methodologies for analyzing digital evidence to reduce the risk of exposure to TD Bank</LI><LI>Supports / develops procedures and standards and delivers advice, direction and education to TD management and staff</LI><LI>Serves as an ambassador for GSI within FC&FMG and TD in general</LI></ul></div> <br/> <div> Job Requirements <STRONG><EM>Key Accountabilities</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Manage a cross-border team of highly-skilled Digital Evidence professionals, locally or remotely</LI><LI>Lead Digital Evidence / cybercrime investigations</LI><LI>Focus on operational efficiency to ensure the Digital Evidence team is leveraging tools and processes that reduce redundancy and improve capacity</LI><LI>Stay current on industry trends and emerging threats</LI><LI>Respond to business units and FC&FMG teams to investigate simple or complex, sensitive, or urgent matters, usually within minimal time-frames</LI><LI>Develop and maintain programs for supervision, timeliness, and management of all assigned investigators/investigations</LI><LI>Ensure all reports (Interim and Final Investigative Reports, Briefing Notes, etc.) are properly written and vetted prior to distribution to senior management</LI><LI>Prepare regular written or in-person Digital Evidence updates</LI><LI>Develop and maintain two-way communications with peers within FC&FMG, and Digital Evidence teams in other Financial Institutions</LI><LI>Testify and present evidence, as required</LI><LI>Develop and maintain effective liaison relationships, at senior levels with law enforcement, security agencies, and external security experts</LI><LI>Stand in for the Senior Manager, Forensic Investigations and Digital Evidence, for functions or meetings or as interim relief</LI> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Required Competencies</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Extensive knowledge of investigations and criminal and regulatory legislation, regulation, procedures, and guidelines</LI><LI>Solid understanding of organizational priorities and relationships</LI><LI>Solid understanding of the principles of investigation, including reporting, evidence handling, and court or regulatory proceedings</LI><LI>Solid understanding of governing plans and documents, procedures, and business administration</LI><LI>Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, organization, leadership and planning skills</LI><LI>Proven ability to manage crisis and emergency incidents</LI><LI>Ability to work with businesses from a business perspective and interpret Digital Evidence matters in a way understandable to business and non-technical people</LI><LI>Self-starter, strategic thinker, negotiator and consensus builder, proven ability to satisfactorily manage competing priorities</LI><LI>Expert understanding of network protocols, TCP/IP fundamentals OR</LI><LI>Expert understanding of operating systems (Windows, Linux and OSX)</LI><LI>Expert understanding of intrusion detection systems (e.g. Snort, Suricata) and tools (e.g. tcpdump, Wireshark)</LI><LI>Knowledge of Malware Triage and Reverse Engineering</LI><LI>Knowledge of network based services and client/server applications</LI><LI>Knowledge of enterprise systems and infrastructure</LI><LI>Familiarity with network architecture and security infrastructure placement</LI><LI>Familiarity with security tools such as Anti-Virus, Ironport systems and Data Loss Prevention Tools</LI><LI>Experience with programming/scripting languages</LI><LI>Background in operational information security disciplines (e.g. incident response, security infrastructure management or monitoring services)</LI><LI>Background performing incident response and digital forensics</LI><LI>Experience in config/mgmt of feeds into event aggregation and correlation systems (e.g., Splunk, ArcSight)</LI><LI>Experience with improvement of analyst effectiveness by optimizing signature quality in collaboration with other analysts and developers</LI><LI>Background in systems administration for Windows and/or Unix based environments</LI> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Decision-Making Authority</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Approves procedural level governance</LI><LI>As assigned, approves budget and financial matters as provided in TD’s Delegated Signing Authorities</li> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>Key Relationships</EM></STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Close working relationship with peers in FC&FMG, TRM&IS, Legal, and HR</LI><LI>Frequent interaction with senior executives in Corporate Office and all Business Groups</LI></ul></div> <br/> <strong><div> Additional Information <STRONG><EM>Education and Experience:</EM></strong>  <ul> <LI>University degree or college diploma from a recognized Institute of Technology or University program in an appropriate specialty such as Computing Science, or a related field</LI><LI>Professional designation in the following designations would be an asset: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), SANS Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) and EnCE (Encase Certified Examiner)</LI><LI>Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with a corporate or government investigative and/or intelligence department within an organization of comparable size and complexity to TD, including at least 5 years’ experience in investigations</LI></ul></div> <br/> <div> Inclusiveness<br/><br/>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div>   <li>*Province/State (Primary) Ontario</li>  <div> City (Primary) Toronto</div>
Title: Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations

Job_Description: Description de poste<br/><br/>Every day, our passionate employees connect our customers to the world and everything in it – it’s why we exist at Shaw, and it’s why we strive to be the place where the best people choose to work. Our people reflect the richness of our communities, and our culture is inclusive of each individual’s diverse background and perspective, which makes us a stronger team. <br/><br/> At Shaw we believe a diverse workforce fosters diversity of thought and perspective, and more diversity means more solutions. We invite all qualified individuals to apply. <br/><br/> Career Opportunity: Chief Security Officer (CSO) <br/><br/> Shaw Communications is currently seeking a Chief Security Officer to join their team. This position is based in Calgary, AB and is responsible for Shaw’s entire risk management posture, including cyber and physical security. <br/><br/> <strong>Accountabilities / Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Custody, care and control of all aspects of our customer and enterprise-wide data from threats both externally and internally.</li> <li>Safeguarding of intellectual property and protection of all technology assets.</li> <li>Responsible for physical security including critical communications infrastructure.</li> <li>Provide compliance governance to monitor and track each business units’ compliance to internal security policies, customer and regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Provide ongoing education and awareness to all employees in the proactive prevention of security threats.</li> <li>Oversight for information security risk assessments, incident response and investigation and provide remediation recommendations where required.</li> <li>Maintain relationships with local and federal law enforcement and other related government agencies, including PWGSC, PSPC, CSE and CSIS.</li> <li>Develop strategies to minimize the impact of security incidents by ensuring that all resources are quickly returned to normal operations, while considering improvements needed and lessons learned.</li> <li>Responsible for auditing existing systems, while directing the administration of security policies, activities, and standards.</li> <li>Provide support in relation to customer and regulatory audits including physical, network, application, database and operational security.</li> <li>Participate as a member of the senior leadership team in governance processes of the organization’s long-term security strategy and risk management.</li> <li>Oversight for the development and communication of security strategies to mitigate risk arising from new projects and changes to existing practices</li> <li>Incident Response Planning (IRP), Business Continuity Planning (BCP), Disaster Recovery Planning (DRP), awareness, consultancy and assistance to the business in order to ensure that all business units:</li> </ul>  o	Review their critical processes by conducting a Business Impact Assessment (BIA) <br/> o	Have up-to-date Business Continuity Planning (BCP) documentation. <br/> o	Conduct IRP, BCP, and DRP testing. <br/> o	Understand customer and regulatory compliance requirements as they relate to information security requirements on service providers. <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills, Experience and Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum of 10 years of directly related risk management and security experience in a senior role, with at least 5 years of information security experience.</li> <li>Minimum of 10 years of leadership experience.</li> <li>Experience participating and presenting to board of directors and committees.</li> <li>Certifications in one or more of the following: CPP (Certified Protection Professional), PSP (Physical Security Professional), CSO (Certified Security Officer), CISM (Certified Information Security Manager), CCISO (Certified Chief Information Security Officer), or CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)</li> <li>Experience in large scale, enterprise-wide security intrusion monitoring, detection, and incident remediation activities.</li> <li>Expert knowledge of cyber security trends, technologies, and their applicability to the telecommunications industry.</li> <li>Experience in leading a rick management and security team across a complex enterprise, including partner-lead and cloud-based solutions.</li> <li>In addition to the traditional enterprise risk management and security practice, experience leading a team that has accountability for an extensive customer-base.</li> <li>Experience in adapting a large organization from predominantly internal technology solutions to more partner-lead and cloud-based solutions.</li> <li>Experience providing risk management solutions to an organization that offers anytime, anywhere, any platform access to its people.</li> <li>Ability to be successful in a dynamic, disruptive and transformational organization.</li> <li>Strong understanding of the principles and techniques of security risk analysis.</li> <li>Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.</li> <li>Canadian government security clearance would be beneficial.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> </ul>  If you want to be part of something bigger—part of a dynamic team of people who are aligned, focused, and passionate about working together to care for our customers, then we look forward to meeting you! Join us. <br/><br/> This position requires the successful completion of a criminal, credit background check and upon acceptance, security clearances with the government of Canada and the RCMP. <br/><br/> We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> Shaw Communications, through its third party vendor, collects and stores information applicable to the candidate profile you create when you submit the information asked for below. The use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for Shaw Communications. The information is subject to Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. The information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. Your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year.
Title: Chief Security Officer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Reporting to the Director, Information Technology the incumbent is responsible for ensuring appropriate controls are in place for the security of information assets and hardware relied upon by the college’s staff, students and community. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:</strong></div><div> Duties and Responsibilities  <ul> <LI><strong>Information Technology Security Management and Consultation including:</strong></LI>  <ul> <LI>Acting as the College’s subject matter expert on Georgian’s response to Information Security trends, vulnerabilities and threats</LI><LI>Maintaining policies, procedures, standards and guidelines</LI><LI>Evaluating and recommending new information security technologies and countermeasures against threats to information or privacy</LI><LI>Leading regular security and data privacy reviews, assessments and audits</LI><LI>Developing, maintaining and testing the cyber incident response plan</LI><LI>Assisting with IT application and system development projects including identifying gaps in existing security infrastructure to meet project requirements and provide solutions</LI><LI>Developing vulnerability assessments and penetration testing for the college’s networks and sensitive information systems through qualitative risk analysis and conducting functional and gap analysis</LI><LI>Developing data privacy requirements and safeguards to aid various college-wide programs, projects and initiatives</LI> </ul>  <strong><LI>Administrative Management including:</li>  </strong>  <ul> <LI>Providing leadership and supervision to staff including work priorities / assignments and approval of staff scheduling</LI><LI>Administering human resource management duties (i.e. staff performance reviews, hiring. team building and conflict resolution, etc.)</LI><LI>Conducting first level investigations to resolve disputes involving staff and managing staff through review and evaluation of work-in-progress, development of work plans, skills and professional currency plans</LI><LI>Participating and supervising the preparation and recommendation of detailed budgets with cost estimates and establishes and maintains budgetary control for the security function including procurement</LI> </ul>  <strong><LI>Privacy including:</li>  </strong>  <ul> <LI>Overseeing and directing the privacy function within the college (i.e. freedom of information requests, FIPPA, and PHIPA) ensuring compliance with appropriate legislation</LI> </ul>  <strong><LI>Security Training including:</li>  </strong>  <ul> <LI>Developing and delivering security awareness and training programs</LI></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div> Qualifications  <ul> <LI>Successfully completed a three year postsecondary diploma / degree in a relevant field of study that may include, but is not limited to computer science or information security</LI><LI>Recognized industry certification (i.e. CISSP, CISSLP, GIAC ) or other security certification at a similar level</LI><LI>Nine years of progressive Information Technology experience</LI><LI>Proven experience managing staff and / or leading diverse people through project management</LI><LI>Proven practical experience in the Information Security Architecture field</LI><LI>Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of security architecture best practices, standards and frameworks</LI><LI>Professional communication skills both oral and written with the ability to negotiate through persuasive techniques</LI><LI>Proven experience and detailed technical knowledge in security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols and application security</LI><LI>Knowledge of network and web relate protocols (i.e. TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)</LI><LI>Knowledge and understanding of enterprise computing environments including MS Server 2012, 2016, Linux, distributed applications, networking, VMWare, Hyper-V, DNS, DHCP, Active Directory</LI><LI>Understanding of nextgen Firewall software, IDS, IPS, virus protection and encryption</LI><LI>Experience with vulnerability scanning and mitigation utilizing Nessus or a similar tool</LI><LI>Ability to travel occasionally between campuses and respond to emergency security threats outside normal working hours if required</LI> </ul>  <DIV>This position is open until filled.</DIV></div> <div> Posting Date 5/18/2018</div> <div> Additional Information <DIV>Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.</DIV><DIV>Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.</DIV><DIV>To be considered for this position, please visit our website at www.GeorgianCollege.ca and apply by navigating to About Georgian and then to Career Opportunities.</DIV> </div>
Title: Manager, Information Technology Security

Job_Description: Security & Log Management Tools integrator <br/><br/> ABOUT IT AT CN <br/><br/> CN harnesses the power of information every minute of every day to make better decisions. Almost every aspect of our business relies on technology; this is why CN invests around $100 million every year on IT projects and infrastructure. And with close to 1,000 in-house employees, CN’s IT team is more than a first-class technology shop – they’re railroaders, dedicated to enabling our people to work better and to helping our trains run safely. <br/><br/> WHY YOU WANT THIS JOB <br/><br/> CN is currently recruiting for the Security & Log Management Tools integrator. As an integrator, you will implement and integrate mission critical security systems in, large-scale, geographically diverse environments. <br/><br/> This role is responsible for integrating Operational and Security Log Management solutions required to run a wide variety of Operational and Security related applications. This includes producing blueprint for the solution, implementing the solution and transferring the knowledge to the operation team. This role requires a service oriented mentality, always seeking the right balance between operational and business requirements. <br/><br/> This requires an in-depth knowledge in the implementation (Enhance or Build and Deploy) of the technology platform tasked with meeting both SOC functional and non-functional requirements. <br/><br/> RESPONSIBILITIES <ul>  <li>Production of architecture, design, procurement and deployment deliverables for the following components :</li>  <li>Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)</li> <li>User/Entity Behavior Analytics</li> <li>Cyber Threat Intelligence</li> <li>Vulnerability scanner</li> <li>Security Configuration Scanner</li> <li>Web Application Vulnerability Scanner</li> <li>Incident Response Orchestration</li> <li>Case Management and Ticketing</li> <li>Reporting</li> <li>Forensic Analysis</li> <li>Network Behaviour Anomaly Detection</li> <li>Design and implementation of SIEM content such as use cases, rules, views, reports, alerts, dashboards, etc.</li> <li>Advise on the development of training material for the technology platform used by the SOC.</li> <li>Translate customer requirements into use cases; design and implement as ArcSight content.</li>  <li>Contribute to the technical solution architecture by identifying the existing capabilities available technologies in place versus the need for the acquisition of new technologies</li> <li>Interface with various vendors for acquisition of equipment and software/hardware product selection</li> <li>Translate the technical solution architecture into a detailed infrastructure and technology components design. Ensure the tight integration of all the components.</li> <li>Define infrastructure and technology installation specifications including automation, monitoring, high availability and disaster recovery.</li> <li>Work in collaboration with the project manager to define work breakdown structure, estimate project effort and project schedule</li> <li>Guide the system administrators, software administrators, data centre facility administrator and/or telecom integrators through the proposed technical design and specifications. Address any potential design or support issues with them.</li> <li>Produce test plans to test all infrastructure and technologies identified in the technical design.</li>  <li>Strong Subject Matter expert assisting the project team in problem resolution or workaround</li> <li>Define the stabilization and knowledge transfer plans to the IT Operation team.</li> </ul> REQUIREMENTS <ul>  <li>10+ years working experience in Information Security field.</li> <li>Security operations experience such as incident management, intrusion detection, firewall deployment and security event analysis.</li> <li>5+ years working with SIEM (preferably on Arcsight) and other SOC technologies (Case Management, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Incident Response Orchestrator).</li> <li>Experience with system administration on both Linux and Windows technologies, including the integration of devices such as Windows, AIX, Linux, Firewalls and IPS to a SIEM.</li> <li>Wide range of technical knowledge and in-depth understanding of ArcSight ESM, and has performed the functions of a Senior Analyst, Advanced Content Author or Security SME with respect to SOC technologies.</li> <li>Provide a practical solutions-based approach for the design and implementation of a complete enterprise SIEM deployment; understanding methodologies, terms, concepts, and best practices within the context of the Micro Focus ArcSight product line.</li> <li>Installation, configuration, troubleshooting, customization and optimization of the ArcSight product suite and its dependencies.</li> <li>Strong knowledge in network security operations and familiarity with a variety of endpoint security products.</li> </ul> SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE <ul>  <li>Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field</li> <li>Experience working with vendors to resolve bugs, request enhancements and gain in-depth knowledge of product roadmaps</li> <li>Extensive experience implementing the ArcSight suite of software and appliances in an Enterprise Environment</li> <li>Experience developing ArcSight FlexConnectors</li> <li>Ability to Create / Develop / Performance Test and Deploy Advanced ESM content for Security Use Cases</li> <li>Extensive experience developing automated monitoring of enterprise tools</li> <li>5+ years of experience in a highly controlled IT environment</li> <li>Knowledge of SDLC process is an asset</li> <li>Dynamic and excellent troubleshooting/problem solving skills</li> <li>Able to perform under pressure</li> <li>Ability to influence decision-making</li> <li>Advanced technical writing skills</li> <li>Experience working in complex environments and diverse technologies</li> <li>High level of analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities</li> </ul> <em>CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.</em>
Title: Security & Log Management Tools integrator

Job_Description: <DIV>The Forensics Specialist- TS is responsible for incident handling and incident response for IT security incidents</DIV> <DIV><B>Key Accountabilities</B></DIV> <DIV>Conduct Real-time analysis on identified cyber incidents currently impacting the bank’s operations. Analyze security incidents, triage and remediate security incidents internally and escalate to external incident vendors or MIRT team for further treatment or support if needed. Manage intake of incidents and reports from internal customers. Through internal ticketing system in a timely accurate manner in order to resolve a multitude of information security related situations. The ability to identify and triage and remediate security incidents such as Malware, Phishing and Web Attacks is required. Provide chain of custody when needed.</DIV> <DIV><B>Authorities</B></DIV> <DIV>Accountable to respond to, investigate and remediate cyber threats to the bank. Escalate to internal and external Incident response teams and law enforcement as required.</DIV> <DIV><B>Scope & Impact</B></DIV> <DIV>This job contributes to Technology and Operations through first line management and remediation of electronic threats to BMO’s infrastructure.</DIV> <DIV><B>Cross-Functional Relationships</B></DIV> <DIV>The Forensics Specialist will be responsible for managing information between multiple technical teams, the CSOC, MIRT and external vendors and law enforcement when appropriate.</DIV> <DIV><B>Knowledge & Skills</B></DIV> <DIV>-Excellent written and oral communication skills.</DIV> <DIV>-Organizational and self-directing skills – ability to initiate, coordinate and prioritize responsibilities and follow through on tasks to completion.</DIV> <DIV>-An approach to work that includes initiative, sound judgment, diplomacy and Discretion.</DIV> <DIV>-Ability to work independently on a variety of assignments with minimal supervision.</DIV> <DIV>-Ability to work without supervision with senior managers, supervisors, VIPs, Users and law enforcement</DIV> <DIV>-Advanced knowledge of scripting knowledge, Malware investigation and remediation, IDS support, Firewall support, Network traffic analysis, SIEM support and log review and URL and web traffic inspection </DIV> <DIV>-Expert knowledge of EnCase, Netwitness and other Forensics tools.</DIV> <DIV>-5-8 years experience in forensics.</DIV> <DIV>-Completion of a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar field is required.</DIV>
