<DIV>-Completion of a Masters degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar field is preferred.</DIV> <DIV>-Completion of at least three of the following: GCIA, GPEN, GWAPT, GCIH, GSEC, CCNP, CISSP</DIV> <DIV>-Demonstrate expert knowledge in PKI, Access/Identity Management, secure authentication, change management and incident management.</DIV> <DIV>-Demonstrates expert problem diagnosis and resolution techniques in the IT environment.</DIV> <DIV>-Demonstrates expert knowledge of IT development processes and techniques.</DIV> <P> </P> <P>We’re here to help</P> <P> </P> <P>At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.</P> <P> </P> <P>As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.</P> <P> </P> <P>To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.</P> <P> </P> <P>BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</P>
Title: Security Advisor

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <strong>Change the world at IBM.</strong> There arent many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation. <br/><br/> Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress. <br/><br/> Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available the sky is the limit!   <ul> <li>This position resides in <strong>Fredericton, NB</strong> and is a <strong>4 or 8 (co-op)</strong> month work term commencing <strong>September 2018</strong>. It is <strong>mandatory</strong> that all applicants are enrolled in <strong>full-time</strong> studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.</li> </ul>  <strong>What IBM Offers You?</strong>  <ul> <li>Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology</li><li>Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding</li><li>A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance</li><li>Access to the Future Blue Community - IBMs large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.</li> </ul>  <strong>It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date: Open Until Filled</strong>  <br/><br/> <strong>Security Intelligence Software Developer Coop with Performance Engineering Focus</strong>  <br/><br/> The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. IBM Security Intelligence is the global provider of high-value, cost-effective, security information and event management (SIEM) products. The flagship offering QRadar is currently the industry leader in SIEM. QRadar integrates previously disparate functions including log management, network behavior analytics and security event management into a total security intelligence solution. QRadar provides users with crucial visibility into what is occurring with their networks, data centers, and applications to better protect IT assets and meet regulatory requirements. <br/> At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity theft, fraud, etc. IBM Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts; the successful candidate will be working with QRadar's Release Analytics and Performance Assessment Team (RAPA). <br/><br/> <strong>Main Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>For continuous system behavior analysis, executing Performance Assessment Framework to assess build/appliance benchmark results and recording them in companywide collaboration tool.</li><li>Extending Performance Assessment Framework with new modules to provide better coverage for an evolving product at a high rate.</li><li>Reporting and verifying issues using the collaboration tool and work with other agile teams to close stories/defects.</li><li>Perform initial investigation of pipeline degradations, perform mini experiments to narrow down the issue to component/feature.</li><li>Read the code, read the docs to understand how the system should behave and assess whether it is the case or not.</li><li>Learning about the product to understand the QRadar data pipeline.</li><li>Reviewing customer documentation.</li><li>Work closely with other members of the Agile team and report status on daily scrums to the team.</li>  </ul>  <strong>This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.</strong> <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory</li><li>Having an eye for detail and curiosity on how things work and why things do not work.</li><li>Experience with Linux operating systems.</li><li>Experience with two or more of the following: Java, SQL, Bash, Python, Git.</li><li>Professionalism in verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Ability to manage workload to meet specific deadlines.</li><li>Must work effectively as part of an agile team and be able to exercise independent judgment. within defined guidelines and procedures.</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Experience using Agile methodologies</li><li>Knowledge of the software development process in general.</li><li>Experience in data visualization techniques.</li><li>Experience with developing and maintaining code.</li><li>Enthusiasm in Security Industry and Ethical Hacking</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Security Intelligence Performance - Coop

Job_Description: <strong>The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place.</strong> <br/><br/> Security Engineer will be responsible for providing tier III support for a Managed Service and Security Provider (MSSP). The successful candidate will be an integral member of the security engineering team and will need to be fully cognizant of state-of-the-art network, firewall, and other security technologies, products and solutions as well as industry best practice with regard to the design, implementation and deployment of firewall solutions. <br/><br/> <strong><u>REQUIRED SKILLSET</u></strong>:  <ul>  	<li>Hands-on experience managing firewalls such as Fortigate, Cisco ASA, Linux, Checkpoint, SonicWall or Palo Alto.</li> <li>This person must be able to communicate, and document instructions effectively with Tier 1 and 2 support teams.</li> <li> Excellent customer service skills and written communication are required</li> <li>Hands on experience in security systems, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, authentication systems, log management, content filtering, etc</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years experience in networking, troubleshooting, and analysis tools</li> <li>Expert understanding and working knowledge of TCP/IP, access-control lists, VLANs, VPNs, firewalls, and dynamic routing protocols such as BGP, OSPF and EIGRP</li> <li>Evaluates and recommends solutions for highly complex security systems according to industry best practices to safeguard internal information systems and databases</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and experience working collaboratively in cross-functional teams.</li> <li>On-call Duties</li> </ul> <strong><u>DESIRED SKILLSET:</u> </strong>  <ul>  	<li>Firewall Vender Certification, preferably Fortinet/Cisco/Linux</li> <li>Security Certifications: GIAC, CCNP, FCNSP</li> <li>The ability to define security requirements and subsequently reviews complex systems to determine if they have been designed to comply with established standards</li> <li>The ability to conduct research and inform management of appropriate developments in firewall, IDPS, WCF, VPN, and securing networking technologies/products</li> </ul> <strong><u>REQUIRED EDUCATION:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelors and 5 years or more experience and 9 years of relate experience without degree; Computer Engineering/Networking, or Masters and three (3) years or more experience; PhD and 0 years related experience</li> </ul> NOTE: <em>At this time, BAE Applied Intelligence will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position</em> <br/><br/> Security Clearance is required for this vacancy. If you are not currently Security Cleared, you will need to be eligible for this and willing to go through the process. For more guidance on National Security Vetting please click here. <br/><br/> <strong>About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence:</strong> <br/><br/> We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cyber crime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes. <br/><br/> Our success is down to our people. The changing nature of our business means that we’re constantly looking for the brightest talent to help us fulfil our ambitions. As an experienced professional, we’ll entrust you with responsibility; this means that you’ll have client contact, variety and support from day one. <br/><br/> We'll encourage and support you to develop your skills and reward you as you grow. Whatever your area of expertise, you'll be much more than just a job title; you'll be an integral part of the business where your individual contribution makes a difference every day. Great minds deserve great rewards, so we also offer a very competitive salary and benefits package. <br/><br/> Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. Staying competitive in today’s global marketplace requires an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working. <br/><br/> <strong>Division Overview:</strong> <strong>Commercial Solutions</strong> <br/><br/> BAE Systems has been in the business of protecting some of the world’s most important assets and networks for over 100 years. We apply the same techniques, intelligence and strategy used in defending nations and governments to businesses as well. That’s us – Commercial Solutions - a division of BAE Systems that specializes in providing businesses around the globe with the products and services they need to stay protected in today’s connected world. <br/><br/> We offer a broad portfolio of on premise, managed and cloud-based products and services that are proven to protect our clients against financial crime and persistent cyber attackers. <br/><br/> We aim to be a global industry-leading, cyber and financial crime products business and will do this by leveraging the BAE Systems brand and by delivering higher grade security solutions for our clients. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Help us secure a connected world by being an unseen hero. Apply now and be inspired.</em></strong>
Title: Security Engineering - Raleigh NC

Job_Description: The Security Architect is a senior influential role which is responsible for the technical architecture and design of complex managed security solutions to meet client requirements. The Security Architect may have a role in one or several of the following areas, depending on the architects background and experience and on organizational workloads and requirements. <br/><br/> o Transition / Deployment Projects <br/><br/> o Pre-sales (new or organic growth proposals) <br/><br/> o Vendor selection, service evolution, Proof-of-Concepts <br/><br/> The Security Architect also is expected to <br/><br/> • Provide cyber-security expert knowledge and advice to clients as well as internally to our leadership. <br/><br/> • Lead the MEPS team technical interaction with the client, sometimes with the leads of other CGI teams, to flesh-out client requirements, and provide the technical architecture of the proposed managed security solution. <br/><br/> • Participate in client presentations and meetings, sometimes with the leads of other CGI teams, to discuss CGIs Security services capabilities. <br/><br/> • Lead the technical response to client requests for proposals. <br/><br/> • Collaborate with the Architecture leads of other CGI teams to design the managed security services solution to satisfy the client requirements, while being mindful of operational supportability, deployment and operational costs and risk mitigation for both the client and CGI. <br/><br/> • Produce architectural specifications, and design documents including technical diagrams and bills of materials. <br/><br/> • Technical oversight of deployment projects and mentoring of Managed Endpoint Protection Support team members <br/><br/> • Collaborate with other Solution Architects, Security Advisor and management to grow and evolve CGIs Managed Security Service offerings. <br/><br/> • Maintain awareness of trends in IT security technology and regulatory requirements <br/><br/> • Participate in the evolution and improvement of the teams tools, methodologies, templates, etc. <br/><br/> • Identifying and coaching potential succession candidates <br/><br/> • Examining and test security solution vendors to assess usage of potential new tools and capabilities <br/><br/> Required qualifications to be successful in this role: <br/><br/> Required qualifications: <br/><br/> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent; <br/><br/> Minimum of five to ten years of directly related IT experience with at least half in security. <br/><br/> In-depth experience architecting complex technical solutions. <br/><br/> Strong knowledge of various network and security technologies. <br/><br/> Strong knowledge of networking protocols. <br/><br/> Strong troubleshooting, reasoning and problem solving skills. <br/><br/> Demonstrated leadership and negotiation skills with business and technical groups. <br/><br/> Good business acumen. <br/><br/> Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand complexities and how components connect and relate to each other. <br/><br/> Ability to speak, write and communicate clearly and effectively in fluent English (French also desirable) with both clients and internal organizations. <br/><br/> Knowledge/experience in multiple security technologies such as: Endpoint Security, Firewalls, IDPS, Web Content Filtering, Email filtering (antispam), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Analytics, Vulnerability Management, Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) and Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) solutions <br/><br/> Ability to obtain a Government of Canada security clearance of Level II (Secret). <br/><br/> One or more of the following would be desirable, but not essential: <br/><br/> • Security certifications such as: CISSP, CISM, SANS GIAC such as GCFW, GCIA, GCWN. <br/><br/> • Experience working with one or more enterprise architecture frameworks such as SABSA, TOGAF, ZACKMAN. <br/><br/> • Understanding of information security frameworks/standard such as ISO 27001, NECR CIP, PCI-DSS, NIST-800, etc..
Title: Security Architect

Job_Description: <div>Auto req ID 198776BR </div><div> Job Title Information Security Specialist </div><div> Report Location Toronto </div><div> Country Canada </div><div> Province/State Ontario </div><div> City1 Toronto </div><div> TD Description <p>Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.</p><p>Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com</p> </div><div> Department Overview <p><strong>Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD</strong></p><p>We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.</p><p><strong>TD Information Security</strong> covers the development and management of security strategies, policies and programs to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls. Priorities include: mitigating and managing cyber security threats, ensuring systems availability, aligning with global regulatory risk and compliance requirements, managing systems and network complexity, and partnering with businesses for better technology delivery by providing advice on technology controls. </p><p>There's room to grow in all of it.</p> </div><div> Job Type Regular </div><div> Job Status Full Time </div><div> Hours 37.5 </div><div> Business line Corporate </div><div> Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions </div><div> Job Category(s) Technology Solutions </div><div> Job Description <p>About This Role<br>Reporting to the Senior Manager, Threat Hunting, the Threat Hunting Senior Analyst is responsible for helping the team in the detection, disruption, and the eradication of threat actors from enterprise networks. The Threat Hunting team will use advanced analytics, threat intelligence, and cutting-edge security technologies to participate in threat actor based investigations, create new detection methodologies, and provide subject matter expertise to incident response and monitoring functions. The Threat Hunting Senior Analyst will also directly support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats.<br> <br>Job Description<br>Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:</p><ul><li>Participate in threat hunting operations using threat intelligence, analysis of anomalous log data and results of brainstorming sessions to detect and mitigate threat actors on the network</li><li>Develop advanced methodologies to identify threat actor groups and associated tools, techniques and procedures</li><li>Produce metrics and develop dashboards to identify potential threats, suspicious/anomalous activity, malware, etc.</li><li>Drive the tuning of detection infrastructure with technology teams to identify emerging threats</li><li>Document best practices to enhance analyst playbooks, response procedures, and courses of action</li><li>Support the Cyber Security Operations Center and other internal teams by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity, and potential insider threats</li><li>Provide guidance and/or lead on the development of on-going Information Security risk reporting monitoring key trends and defining metrics to regularly measure control effectiveness</li><li>Proactively review internal processes and activities and identify opportunities for improvement</li><li>Influence behavior to reduce risk and foster a strong information security management culture throughout the enterprise</li><li>Remain informed of emerging issues, industry trends and/or relevant changes to the security landscape</li><li>Guide partners on a broad range of specific Technology Controls and Information Security programs, policies, standards and incidents.</li><li>Conduct risk assessment, required controls definition, control procedure appropriateness, vulnerability assessments and any other relevant areas.</li><li>Lead or contribute to the completion of risk and control design assessments for an assigned business application, business portfolio, and overall enterprise, as well as risk mitigation and remediation plans and remediation strategy.</li><li>Contribute to the definition, development, and oversight of a global security management strategy and framework.</li><li>Ensure technology, processes, and governance are in place to monitor, detect, prevent, and react to both current and emerging technology and security threats against TDBG’s business.</li><li>Develop on-going technology risk reporting, monitoring key trends and defining metrics to regularly measure control effectiveness for own area.</li><li>Adhere to internal policies and procedures, technology control standards, and applicable regulatory guidelines.</li><li>Contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities for improvement.</li><li>Adhere to, advise, oversee, monitor and enforce enterprise frameworks and methodologies that relate to technology controls / information security activities.</li><li>Influence behavior to reduce risk and foster a strong technology risk management culture throughout the enterprise.</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul> </div><div> Job Requirements <p>Job Requirements<br>What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. Here are the minimum requirements for this position:</p><ul><li>University Degree</li><li>Information Security Certification / Accreditation an asset.</li><li>7+ years of relevant experience.</li><li>Expert knowledge of IT security and risk disciplines and practices.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of organization, technology controls, security and risk issues.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to participate in complex, comprehensive or large projects and initiatives.</li><li>Ability to serve as a lead expert resource in technology controls and information security for project teams, the business, organization and outside vendors.</li></ul> <br>Qualifications<br>Preferred Qualifications - Here are the preferred qualifications for this role:<ul><li>At least 5 years of previous experience working in hunt teams, threat intelligence, incident response, or security operations</li><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent program in Information Security, Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar field experience is required; Master's degree preferred</li><li>Expert knowledge of log management, security analytics and event management platforms</li><li>Must be able to define events vs. alerts vs. incidents for the organization, and create incident classification, severity, and priority tables in-line with all threats, risks and vulnerabilities</li><li>Must be able to develop and document intelligence artifacts such advisories, AoA (Anatomy of Attack) and relevant detection and mitigation patterns</li><li>Hands on experience with writing and implementing complex analytics queries, threat visualization dashboards, and large data volume management</li><li>Strong working knowledge of security-relevant data, including network protocols, ports and common services, such as TCP/IP network protocols and application layer protocols (e.g. HTTP/S, DNS, FTP, SMTP, Active Directory etc.)</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills</li><li>Organizational and self-directing skills</li><li>Ability to initiate, coordinate and prioritize responsibilities and follow through on tasks to completion</li><li>Ability to work independently on a variety of assignments with minimal supervision</li><li>Completion of at least one of the following: GCIA, GPEN, GWAPT, GCIH, GSEC, CCNP, CISSP</li><li>A background in Data Science, Statistics, anomaly detection or similar skills would be an asset</li></ul> </div><div> Additional Information <p><strong>Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:</strong></p><ul><li>Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.</li><li>Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others.</li><li>Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals.</li><li>Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners.</li><li>Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency.</li><li>Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside.</li></ul><p><strong>Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas.</strong> This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.</p> </div><div> Inclusiveness <p>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</p> </div><div> **Province/State (Primary) Ontario </div><div> City (Primary) Toronto </div><div> * Additional Cities in Primary State Toronto </div><div> <div></div></div>
Title: Information Security Specialist

Job_Description: FreshBooks has a big vision. We launched in 2003 but were just getting started and theres a lot left to do. We're a high performing team working towards a common goal: building a world class online accounting application to help small businesses better manage their finances. Known for extraordinary customer service and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries. <br/><br/> <strong>The Opportunity - Lead Security Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> In this newly created position, the <strong>Lead Security Engineer</strong> will be hands-on and responsible for security monitoring, incident handling, security operations processes, threat management, documenting security policies and more. In addition to building and leading our Security Engineering team, you and your team will educate the rest of our Product Development organization in best practices for developing secure cloud applications. <br/><br/> <strong>What you'll need:</strong>  <ul> <li>At least five years of experience in the Security field as a Security Engineer, or similar</li> <li>Experience building and leading teams, mentoring and coaching, and steering the growth of team members</li> <li>Strong Cloud Security and Security Architecture experience</li> <li>Strong experience as a Security subject matter expert</li> <li>Strong troubleshooting, reasoning, problem-solving, customer service, and communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>The more of the following you bring, the better:</strong>  <ul> <li>A university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering or a relevant field</li> <li>Specific experience with Google Cloud Platform or similar (AWS, Azure)</li> <li>Experience with microservices and distributed systems</li> <li>Hands-on experience with cloud storage solutions</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of information technology security, trends, leading practices, regulatory and industry standard compliance issues (PCI-DSS and others)</li> <li>Experience performing threat modeling, offensive assessments, penetration testing, exploit development, or vulnerability analysis</li> <li>Working knowledge of common and industry standard cloud-native/cloud-friendly authentication/authorization mechanisms (OAuth, OpenID, SAML etc.) and key management/secret vaulting solutions, including HSM (Thales, Gemalto SafeNet etc.)</li> </ul> <strong>What youll do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Build and lead a Security Engineering team</li> <li>Be a trusted technical advisor and solve complex Cloud security technical challenges</li> <li>Coach internal teams (i.e.Software Development) on security disciplines and work closely with these teams to ensure that theyre writing secure code and designing secure systems.</li> <li>Enable teams to take ownership of secure code</li> <li>Collaborate with Software Engineering and Architecture teams on security strategy, roadmaps, standards, and governance</li> <li>Mentor the Product Development team ensuring adherence to security engineering best practices</li> <li>Ensure Agile and Lean best practices are applied to software development and security architecture design</li> <li>Ensure that we maintain PCI-DSS compliance and other certifications</li> <li>Audit and analyze production code for potential security concerns</li> <li>Identify and document information security risks and propose mitigating controls</li> <li>Provide analysis and guidance regarding threats, vulnerabilities, and privacy and security incidents</li> <li>Identify security gaps and recommend & facilitate the mitigation of the gaps in line with industry standards and best practices</li> <li>Build knowledge of and stay current on developments in the cyber threat landscape to adapt investigation techniques and provide recommendations on responding to and remediating related incidents</li> <li>Actively detect, respond to, and remediate security events across our infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>What we offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, health benefits from day 1 and extra days off (office is closed between Christmas and New Years)</li> <li>RRSP matching program and generous parental leave policy</li> <li>Weekly catered lunches, beer, and snacks</li> <li>Team and company offsites, hackoffs, and paid community volunteer days and religious observance days</li> <li>Professional development opportunities and flexible work schedules</li> <li>Office gym with showers and complimentary towel service</li> <li>Secure, indoor bike parking with well-stocked repair bay</li> <li>Ping Pong, Foosball, Massage Chairs, Nintendo Stations and more.</li> <li>Dog friendly office</li> <li>TTC & GO Accessible</li> </ul> Sure, there are perks, but the real reason people are proud to work at FreshBooks is because each person knows their opinion is respected, and they can see the difference they make in the lives of over 10 million small business owners around the world. If you want to accelerate your career, work on projects you're passionate about and have just as much of a life outside the office as insideyou're exactly what we're looking for. <br/><br/> <strong>We value our people...</strong> <br/><br/> We recognize and reward ingenious work. We all have real lives, and respect work lifestyle balance. We all have a voice that is heard throughout the company. We always make time for fun, and have one of the most unique, employee-led cultures out there. Join the FreshBooks choir or a class in the gym, organize a gaming night, teach a dev lunch and learn, or use a paid volunteer day to share your skills with the community. Salaries are competitive and compensation packages include a stake in the company. Interested? Lets get started! <br/><br/> <em>FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com</em>
Title: Lead Security Engineer

Job_Description: SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.<br/><br/>SOTI’s growth and success is a result of a commitment to innovation through entrepreneurial culture and leadership. Employees are driven to make an impact, offer a unique value and most importantly, be part of a winning team. <br/><br/> As a Security Engineer, you are a technically savvy hands-on person that can keep information safe and eliminate risks across our products and internal systems. Your proven ability as a strong multitasker and your fascination with the latest IT security trends, will keep us one step ahead, ensure consistent security coverage, and eliminate any room for vulnerabilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Provide technical leadership in architecting and deploying full stack security solutions</li><li>Identify attack surfaces and build solutions to harden our products</li><li>Review designs and implementations of general product features to ensure security best practices are followed</li><li>Evangelize secure coding practices across all engineering teams</li><li>Design and develop security testing scenarios, ongoing security testing, and code reviews to improve our security posture</li><li>Serve as a security expert and communicate information security-related concepts to technical and non-technical team members</li><li>Work with cross-functional teams to help define security requirements for new projects and products</li><li>Provide guidance on security policies, procedures, and technologies to achieve and maintain security compliance</li><li>Periodically assess all security monitoring requirements and implement enhancements to meet changing business needs</li><li>Conduct research on emerging products, services, and standards in support of security enhancement and development efforts</li><li>Maintain our security monitoring solutions and make changes when needed to improve visibility and relevancy of alerting</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in cyber security, computer science, or equivalent degree program</li><li>An in-depth understanding of OWASP Top 10 is required</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ experience in the field of application security</li><li>Working knowledge and experience with various cyber security standards and best practices (NIST, ISA, IEC, BSIMM, etc.)</li><li>Strong knowledge of web application design, development and testing techniques</li><li>Strong capacity for debugging web application and mobile device security issues</li><li>Experience in cyber threat and vulnerability analysis and remediation</li><li>Contemporary knowledge of secure coding practices, encryption technologies, ethical hacking and threat modeling</li><li>Experience with Mobile, Web, Java, and .NET, development</li><li>Familiarity with agile development processes and have experience integrating secure development practices</li> </ul> <strong>Desirable Skills</strong> <ul> <li>Information security certifications: GSSP-.NET, GSSP-Java, CISSP, OSCP, CISM, CRISC, CEH, CSSLP, etc. are preferred</li><li>Experience with ISO27001, GDPR / Privacy</li><li>Experience and knowledge of security testing and evaluation and penetration testing methodologies and tools, such as: SonarQube, VeraCode, Fortify SCA, Fortify WebInspect, IBM AppScan, etc.</li><li>Strong ability to explain vulnerabilities and weaknesses in OWASP Top 10, WASC TCv2, and CWE 25 to any audience, and discuss effective defensive techniques</li><li>Experience promoting Continuous Delivery and a DevSecOps pipeline</li> </ul>  If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.
Title: Security Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> 2018 Fall Student - Cyber Security Specialist (Fredericton, NB)</strong> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div><div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Canadian Nuclear Laboratories is bringing together the finest minds to form a diverse, vibrant and dynamic workforce culture energized by the innovative capacity of students, new graduates and mid-career professionals, underpinned by senior world renowned experts. We hire numerous students each semester from colleges and universities to support our research and perform other assignments. If you are looking for interesting and challenging work this summer then keep reading, and if you meet the requirements of this role, apply today. <br/><br/> <strong>Department:</strong> <strong>Applied Physics</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Number of Positions</strong>: <strong>2</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Duration: 4 months</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Discipline: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Science</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Year of study: 2nd, 3rd,and 4th year</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Fredericton, NB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>NOTE:</strong> <br/><br/> All students applying for student positions at CNL must be returning to full-time studies upon completion of their work term. Exceptions will be made for students who require a work term in order to graduate. <br/><br/> Students must submit a resume, cover letter, copy of an up-to-date transcript and three reference letters (two personal reference letters that have known you more than 5 years and are not relatives. And, one professional reference letter from an individual who has supervised your work) by the posting close date of May 27, 2018 to ensure consideration for student employment in the first round of interviews. Positions will remain posted until June 10, 2018 to allow for a second round of candidates/interviews, if required. The employment period generally runs from the beginning of September to the end of December. <br/><br/> This site has no public transportation access. Students must have access to reliable transportation. <br/><br/> <strong>INTRO</strong><br/> <div>Do you want to work on the cutting edge of cyber security research for the protection of Canada’s critical infrastructure? Then, come join CNL’s National Innovation Centre for Cybersecurity (NICC) in Fredericton, NB. <br/><br/> The NICC is moving into brand new office space located in a cyber security business park cluster being set up by Cyber NB (part of Opportunities New Brunswick) on Fredericton’s Knowledge Park Drive. At the heart of the NICC is a state of the art cyber secure test range containing representative hardware used in nuclear power plants and other critical infrastructure that will be used to evaluate and test tools, techniques and best practices for securing critical infrastructure and industrial control systems taking into account the key characteristics that differentiate critical infrastructure and industrial control systems from typical IT and other commercial networks. Results from this research will be used to provide guidance to both regulators and industry on effectively meeting newly revised and released cyber security standards. <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity for a young engineer or computer scientist with an interest in networking and cyber security to gain hands-on experience with cyber security in an industrial control system test facility</div> <br/><strong>DUTIES</strong><br/> <div>- Undertaking research and documenting the results either formally or informally <br/><br/> - Evaluating cyber security products <br/><br/> - Installation, maintenance, and upgrade activities on the cyber secure test bed <br/><br/> - Development of test scripts <br/><br/> - Development of test plans <br/><br/> - Testing <br/><br/> - Configuration management</div> <br/><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong><br/> <div>Currently enrolled at a university of recognized standing in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Science field of study. <br/><br/> - Ability to work well in a team environment <br/><br/> - Demonstrated ability to carry out research or independent study <br/><br/> - Strong communication skills, both written and verbal <br/><br/> - Strong programming ability <br/><br/> - Previous experience with cyber security is an asset <br/><br/> - Experience with industrial control systems including PLCs and SCADA systems is an asset <br/><br/> - Experience with C and C++ programming, particularly in a real-time system environment is an asset <br/><br/> - Experience with MATLAB and SIMULINK is an asset.</div> <br/>CNL has an Employment Equity Program and encourages applications from women, Aboriginal Peoples, visible minorities and persons with disabilities. <br/><br/> #LI-POST</div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>
Title: 2018 Fall Student - Cyber Security Specialist (Fredericton, NB)

Job_Description: <div><strong>Req Id: 181989</strong> <br/><br/> Bell is a truly Canadian company with over 137 years of success. We are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential. <br/><br/> To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees. <br/><br/> If you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team. <br/><br/> Corporate Groups offers best practice services to support the organization, including Finance, Legal & Regulatory, Brand, Corporate Services – including HR, Communications, Real Estate, Security and Procurement & Value Creation. <br/><br/> Bell is currently seeking a candidate for the position of Senior Vulnerability Management Specialist – Information Security Response. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Information Security Response, the candidate is responsible for the development, coordination and performance of security tests as part of the vulnerability assessment and penetration testing program for Corporate Security’s Information Security organization. The specialist will assist with the identification and tracking of remediation of risk issues, advise on mitigation safeguards, processes and security best practices and act as a spokesperson and expert on related subjects. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Duties/Accountabilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Perform security testing of applications, networks and infrastructures, including vulnerability assessments, penetration testing and manual testing techniques</li><li>Strong networking and security background in areas such as routing and switching, firewall management, analysis of logs and incident response</li><li>Ability to produce, review and advise on secure architectures, hardening guides and policies and configurations for incident response and event management</li><li>Analyse security information and artifacts such as scan results, logs, and files in all phases of incident response. Participate and define incident handling methodologies to proactively manage security risk</li><li>Document analysis results, identify security risks, produce reports and present to technical and executive stakeholders. Track vulnerability risks to closure with GRC and participate in on going GRC use case development</li><li>Possesses proven track record and experience delivering cyber security testing services and mitigation recommendations taking constraints into account, and oversee implementation that meet objectives</li><li>High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision</li> </ul> <strong>Critical Qualifications/ Competencies:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in technology-related field, or in computer science with a specialization in telecommunications, or the equivalent</li><li>Seven (7) years’ experience in information security</li><li>In depth knowledge of security testing tools and methodologies, including penetration testing and vulnerability assessment tools, and associated result analysis</li><li>In depth knowledge of networking design, routing and firewall segmentation of networks</li><li>The following certifications are an asset: CISSP, CEH, GPEN, OSCP, Cisco/Fortinet security certifications</li><li>Sound document writing skills</li><li>Good knowledge of common office tools</li><li>Ability to communicate in French is an asset</li><li>Existing Secret clearance or ability to obtain is preferred</li> </ul> <strong>Note:</strong> <ul> <li>The successful candidate must successfully go through extensive background verifications including but not limited to criminal record and reputational checks</li><li>All Security personnel are required to sign a letter of non-disclosure which prevents them from divulging sensitive information that they may be exposed to during their assignment. This policy is strictly enforced.</li> </ul> Bilingualism is an asset (English and French) <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong><u><strong><u>Additional Information:</u></strong></u></strong></u></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position Type:</strong> Management <br/> <strong>Job Location:</strong> Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> 05/25/2018 <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong><u><strong><u>Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.</u></strong></u></strong></u></strong> <br/><br/> Bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Created: Canada, ON, Ottawa</div>
Title: Senior Security Specialist, Vulnerability Management

Job_Description: <div>PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director Risk Management, the Sr Manager Information Security & Risk Management is responsible for Overseeing PointClickCare’s Risk Management program with specific focus on Information Security. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Provide guidance to design, develop, and implement sound risk management controls in accordance with best practice compliance and industry regulations,</li> <li>Build and maintain the PointClickCare information security program,</li> <li>Overseeing the creation, adoption and adherence to Information Security policies and procedures,</li> <li> Liaise with all other departments within PointClickCare to ensure the Risk management program and Information security program meet the needs of the organization and are understood and adhered to across the organization,</li> <li> Partner with the Legal and compliance team, specifically the security officer and privacy officer on all regulatory and legislative responsibilities of the organization (HIPAA, PHIPPA, SOC 1&2, SOX etc)</li> <li>Ensure information security and desired control measures are understood, considered and incorporated into tactical and strategic plans,</li> <li>Responsible for implementing and leveraging a foundational suite of security technologies and processes that enhance threat visibility and protection of PointClickCare’s critical business technology,</li>   <li>Working closely with all teams implementing solutions to enhance the customer experience, deliver solutions to market faster and ensure application security,</li> <li>Liaise between Management and technical disciplines, including acting as the technical security subject matter expert in the provision of input and technical advice on key team, department, and enterprise initiatives,</li> <li>Lead, manage and mentor a team of Security professionals in the implementation and ongoing operations of the Information Security Program,</li> <li>Develop security architecture framework with input from business stakeholders, and consideration for emerging business demands and risks,</li>   <li>Select, design, and oversee the implementation and operation of a foundational suite of security and risk management technologies and processes to protect PointClickCare against cyber and information threats,</li> <li>Oversee, interpret, prioritize, and respond to cyber and security threats to the privacy, confidentiality, integrity and availability of critical infrastructure, technologies and information relied upon for essential services</li>   <li>Undertake security assessments to ensure PointClickCare is protected from threat of cyber-attack, unauthorized use, access, disclosure, modification or destruction of information</li>   <li>Conduct forensic investigations into alleged inappropriate use of business technology assets</li>   <li>Provide analysis and assessment on discoveries of the forensic investigations including highly confidential data relating to the breach, activities, patterns of use, and duration</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>A minimum of 10 years’ experience in assessing broad risk, cyber and information security control practices, monitoring, articulating, treating and responding to advanced cyber and information security threats</li>   <li>Experience delivering security and compliance programs within an organization who internally build maintain and support a SaaS platform as well as third party vendor integrations to the platform.</li> <li>A minimum of 5 years’ experience building and managing a team of security specialists</li> <li>An Information Security certification is desirable, such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified in the Governance of Enterprise IT (CGEIT), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), or SANS GIAC is an asset</li>   <li>Completion of a degree or diploma in Computer Engineering, Computing Science, Business, Project Management, Risk, Security or other related disciplines</li>   <li>Experience in evaluation, selection, design, configuration, implementation, support, maintenance and monitoring of a foundational suite of information security technologies and processes</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years directly related experience in planning, designing and implementing and operating complex information solution or project architectures, including leading teams and in technical security, risk, and business expertise and identifying sources of threat intelligence</li>   <li>Demonstrated ability to identify and articulate risk mitigation measures and establish protective technical measures</li>   <li>Keep abreast and being well versed on financial / healthcare industry regulation demands within different regions,</li> <li>Strong documentation and presentation skills both written and verbal</li>   <li>Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to innovate, identify needs and take initiative</li>   <li>Demonstrate strong time management and prioritization skills, including ability to support strategic direction and policies</li>  </ul> Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose. <br/><br/> For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn <br/><br/> <em>It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.</em></div>  <br/>
Title: Sr. Manager, Information Security & Risk Management

Job_Description: <strong>FUNCTION:</strong> <br/><br/> The Senior Security Analyst is responsible for assessing security risks and facilitates the remediation of security vulnerabilities across the Enterprise. The successful candidate will report to the Manager of IT Security and will act as a trusted cyber security advisor. <br/><br/> <strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate and engage with internal teams to assess security risk within all IT systems.</li> <li>Perform vulnerability assessments using various security testing tools.</li> <li>Proactively monitor and correlate publically announced vulnerabilities to potential threats to Alberta Blue Cross IT systems.</li> <li>Provide guidance on the appropriate level of assessments that should be undertaken for each project.</li> <li>Communicate effectively with various IT and business teams.</li> <li>Provide guidance required by staff and customers in implementing secure technical solutions.</li> <li>Assist with compliance assessments for Alberta Blue Cross systems and our third party system providers.</li> <li>Mentor and coach team members in partnership with the Manager of the team, with an end goal of retaining a work force of the highest quality for both the team and the company.</li> <li>Encourage and enforce quality control for all standard operating procedures used by the team.</li> <li>Identify opportunities to reduce security risk along with options to remediate or mitigate risk.</li> <li>Assist in the development of policies, procedures and standards that meet internal and external regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Keep abreast with security-related technologies.</li> <li>Lead the development of security training programs.</li> <li>Participate in the planning and execution of simulation exercises, such as phishing tests etc.</li> <li>Promote awareness of industry events and regulatory changes as they relate to cyber security.</li> <li>Collaborate with experts from various IT domains to lead security and forensics analysis.</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree or diploma in a computer science oriented program.</li> <li>Minimum five years of experience in a security analyst role.</li> <li>Industry certifications, including CISSP and CCSP are considered an asset.</li> <li>Strong background in computing, with balanced experience in both application and infrastructure.</li> <li>Must have a clear understanding of cyber threats that face all organizations today, with demonstrated experience in Threat & Vulnerability Management.</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in managing security operations across various technology platforms and user information stores.</li> <li>Strong security incident management and problem solving skills.</li> <li>Demonstrated proficiency in written communication.</li> <li>Demonstrated planning and organization skills.</li> <li>Demonstrated strategic thinking abilities (e.g. vision and innovation).</li> <li>Highly adaptable to operate in a rapidly changing environment.</li> <li>Strong presentation skills, being able to present highly technical security-related material to various levels of audiences within the organization.</li> <li>Experience in delivering a well-integrated security monitoring practice, which reinforces the concept of defense-in-depth.</li> </ul> Alberta Blue Cross offers a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in a challenging team-oriented environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please apply online at www.ab.bluecross.ca.
Title: Senior Security Analyst Information Technology

Job_Description: Atomic Energy of Canada Limited (AECL) is a federal Crown corporation responsible for managing Canada's radioactive waste liabilities and enabling nuclear science and technology. <br/><br/> We deliver our mandate through a contractual arrangement with Canadian National Energy Alliance (CNEA) for the management and operation of Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) under a Government-owned, Contractor-operated (GoCo) model. Under the GoCo model, AECL leverages its facilities, assets and intellectual property by bringing to bear private-sector rigour in the operation of the nuclear laboratories through the contract with CNEA. Details related to the work of CNL and the services it provides to AECL, industry and academia can be found on the CNL website. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Senior Director, Plant Operations and Chief Security Officer, the Security Program Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of the AECL Corporate Security Plan as well as the oversight of all Contractor Security related activities at Canadian Nuclear Laboratories Sites and other AECL owned properties. The Security Program Manager will have regular on-site presence at AECL and CNL sites. The Manager provides strategic advice in developing performance incentives, developing and monitoring performance metrics, and assessing the performance of the AECL Security Program. <br/><br/> The location of this position will be in Chalk River, Ontario. <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Managing the effective implementation of the AECL Corporate Security Plan – policy and procedure writing, review and revisions, multi-year security program improvement action plan execution, monitoring performance metrics and reporting requirements, employee security training and awareness activities,</li><li>Developing and maintaining AECL policies and procedures that are appropriately aligned with Treasury Board Secretariat (TBS) Security Policies and standards as applicable to a Crown corporation, and adopting requirements and /or best practices from lead government agencies (CNSC, RCMP, PSPC-CISD, CSIS, CSE, etc.), and good industry practice, as related to all aspects of security management,</li><li>Developing and maintaining effective working relationships by participating in security industry forums, working groups, and other relevant national security entities to influence and stay abreast of emergent security matters, trends, risk mitigation strategies, and security technologies,</li><li>Maintaining an operational awareness of AECL’s activities by establishing a strong field presence at important evolutions; including properties at Chalk River, Whiteshell, Port Hope, and Ottawa,</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Conducting oversight activities of cyber, physical, and operational security performance of CNL (observations, validation, audit-type functions), consistent with the GoCo Contract and Agreement requirements including Personnel Security Screening, CNL Security Improvement activities (policy and procedures, capital investment, Threat Risk Assessment (TRA) activities, physical security controls, and cyber security), and CNSC license requirements for security program management,</li><li>Developing and recommending risk mitigation strategies to AECL’s CSO and executives when security risks are identified,</li><li>Providing expertise to third party associated partners in “nuclear technologies” that require both oversight and subject matter expert guidance in advancing their nuclear technologies,</li><li>Leading activities for AECL regarding threat risk assessments, administrative security investigations, support for emergency and crisis management, and employee security awareness,</li><li>Managing highly sensitive, confidential or risk related matters for the purpose of protecting personnel, physical assets and AECL and/or CNL information,</li><li>Maintaining oversight of the CNL’s operational activities and regulatory performance by routine inspections and physical presence,</li> <li>Developing performance incentives for CNL security related operations in order to realize efficiency adjustments to security stance that match CNL ongoing operational and nuclear risks,</li> <li>Acting as deputy CSO, performing duties as CSO when required.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills, Experience and Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> The following qualifications are considered to be required: <ul> <li>Post-secondary education in a security related field and 5+ years related experience or 10+ years of relevant experience in a related field (Physical Security, Personnel Security, Threat Risk Assessment, Emergency Management/Business Continuity, Cyber Security, or Security training),</li><li>Must have, or be able to retain, a Top Secret security clearance,</li><li>Experience in planning, developing, implementing and managing security programs, projects or services,</li><li>Experience in the provision of strategic advice to senior management on security issues,</li><li>Experience in handling highly sensitive, confidential or risk related matters,</li><li>Experience in one or more specific areas across the full security spectrum; physical, cyber, personnel screening and aftercare, fraud/espionage, and insider threats,</li><li>Experience in working, collaborating, building relationships, negotiating and maintaining partnerships and networks with stakeholders such as federal government departments and agencies, other levels of government and private sector organizations.</li> </ul> The following qualifications would be considered an asset: <br/><br/> • Experience in high hazard, highly-regulatory environments such as the nuclear industry, <br/><br/> • Experience in comparable Departmental Security Officer (DSO) functions, <br/><br/> • Experience in conducting administrative security investigations, resolution of doubt investigations, review for cause investigations, or similarly related activities <br/><br/> • Working knowledge of the Policy on Government Security and its related Directives and Standards <br/><br/> While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> AECL is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to promoting a culturally diverse workplace. <br/><br/> Énergie atomique du Canada Limitée (« EACL ») est une société d’État fédérale responsable de la gestion des passifs liés aux déchets radioactifs du Canada et du soutien de la science et de la technologie nucléaires. <br/><br/> Nous nous acquittons de notre mandat en vertu d’un accord contractuel à long terme conclu avec l’Alliance nationale pour l’énergie du Canada (« ANEC ») visant la gestion et l’exploitation des Laboratoires Nucléaires Canadiens (« LNC ») selon un modèle d’organisme gouvernemental exploité par un entrepreneur (« OGEE »). Selon ce modèle, EACL tire parti de ses installations, de ses actifs et de sa propriété intellectuelle en appliquant la rigueur du secteur privé à l’exploitation des laboratoires nucléaires dans le cadre du contrat conclu avec l’ANEC. Les renseignements relatifs aux travaux des LNC et aux services qu’ils fournissent à EACL, à l’industrie et aux universités sont accessibles sur le site Web des LNC. <br/><br/> Relevant du directeur principal de la Conduite des opérations et chef de la sécurité, le gestionnaire du programme de sécurité est responsable de la gestion de tous les aspects du Plan de sécurité d’entreprise d’EACL ainsi que de la surveillance de toutes les activités liées à la sécurité assurée par l’entrepreneur aux Laboratoires Nucléaires Canadiens et dans les autres propriétés appartenant à EACL. Le gestionnaire du programme de sécurité sera régulièrement présent sur place aux sites d’EACL et des LNC. Il fournira des conseils stratégiques sur la mise au point d’incitatifs de rendement, l’élaboration et la surveillance de mesures de rendement et l’évaluation du rendement du programme de sécurité d’EACL. <br/><br/> Ce poste est localisé à Chalk River, en Ontario. <br/><br/> <strong>Principales responsabilités :</strong> <ul> <li>Gestion de la mise en œuvre efficace du Plan de sécurité d’entreprise d’EACL – rédaction de politiques et de procédures, examens et révisions, exécution du plan d’action pluriannuel d’amélioration du programme de sécurité, surveillance des mesures de rendement et des exigences en matière de communication de l’information, formation des employés en matière de sécurité et activités de sensibilisation;</li><li>Élaboration et maintien de politiques et de procédures pour EACL qui s’alignent de façon appropriée sur les politiques et les normes promulguées par le Secrétariat du Conseil du Trésor en matière de sécurité s’appliquant à une société d’État, et adoption des exigences ou des pratiques exemplaires des organismes gouvernementaux responsables (notamment la CCSN, la GRC, la DSIC des SPAC, le SCRS, le CST), ainsi que des bonnes pratiques de l’industrie, en ce qui a trait à tous les aspects de la gestion de la sécurité;</li><li>Établissement et maintien de relations de travail efficaces en participant à des forums du secteur de la sécurité, à des groupes de travail et à d’autres activités de sécurité nationale pertinentes afin d’exercer une influence et de se tenir au courant des questions de sécurité émergentes, des tendances, des stratégies d’atténuation des risques et des technologies liés à la sécurité;</li><li>Maintien d’une connaissance approfondie des activités d’exploitation d’EACL en établissant une forte présence sur le terrain lors de changements importants, y compris aux propriétés de Chalk River, Whiteshell, Port Hope et Ottawa;</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Surveillance du rendement en matière de sécurité cybernétique, physique et opérationnelle des LNC (observations, validation, fonctions de type vérification), conformément aux exigences du contrat et des accords de l’OGEE, y compris le filtrage de sécurité du personnel, les activités d’amélioration de la sécurité des LNC (politiques et procédures, investissements en immobilisations, activités d’évaluation de la menace et des risques, contrôles de sécurité physique et cybersécurité), et aux exigences en matière de permis de la CCSN pour la gestion du programme de sécurité;</li><li>Élaboration de stratégies d’atténuation des risques et recommandation auprès du chef du Service de sécurité et aux dirigeants d’EACL lorsque des risques de sécurité sont identifiés;</li><li>Partage de son expérience en « technologies nucléaires » avec des partenaires tiers associés qui nécessitent à la fois une supervision et des conseils d’experts en la matière pour faire progresser leurs technologies nucléaires;</li><li>Direction des activités d’EACL concernant l’évaluation des menaces et des risques, les enquêtes administratives en matière de sécurité, le soutien à la gestion des situations d’urgence et des crises et la sensibilisation des employés à la sécurité;</li><li>Gestion des questions très sensibles, confidentielles ou liées au risque dans le but de protéger le personnel, les biens matériels et les informations d’EACL et des LNC;</li><li>Maintien de la surveillance des activités opérationnelles et de la performance réglementaire des LNC par des inspections de routine et la présence physique;</li> <li>Mise au point de mesures incitatives fondées sur le rendement pour les opérations liées à la sécurité des LNC afin de réaliser des ajustements visant l’efficacité en matière de sécurité qui correspondent aux risques opérationnels et nucléaires permanents des LNC;</li> <li>Exercice du rôle de chef de la sécurité adjoint et des fonctions du chef de la sécurité, au besoin.</li> </ul> <strong>Compétences, expérience et qualifications requises :</strong> <br/><br/> Les qualifications suivantes sont requises : <ul> <li>Études postsecondaires dans un domaine lié à la sécurité et au moins 5 ans d’expérience pertinente, ou au moins 10 ans d’expérience pertinente dans un domaine connexe (sécurité physique, sécurité du personnel, évaluation des menaces et des risques, gestion des situations d’urgence et continuité des activités, cybersécurité ou formation en sécurité);</li><li>Détention ou capacité de conservation d’un niveau d’habilitation de sécurité très secret;</li><li>Expérience en planification, élaboration, mise en œuvre et gestion de programmes, de projets ou de services de sécurité;</li><li>Expérience dans la prestation de conseils stratégiques à la haute direction sur les questions de sécurité;</li><li>Expérience dans le traitement de questions très sensibles, confidentielles ou liées aux risques;</li><li>Expérience dans un ou plusieurs domaines spécifiques touchant à l’ensemble des questions de sécurité : la sécurité physique ou cybernétique, le filtrage et le suivi du personnel, la fraude et l’espionnage, et les menaces d’initiés;</li><li>Expérience de travail, de collaboration, d’établissement de relations, de négociation et de maintien de partenariats et de réseaux avec des parties prenantes comme les ministères et organismes du gouvernement fédéral, les autres ordres de gouvernement et les organisations du secteur privé.</li> </ul> Les qualifications suivantes seraient un atout : <ul> <li>Expérience dans des environnements à risque élevé et très réglementés telle l’industrie nucléaire;</li> <li>Expérience dans des fonctions comparables à celles d’un agent de sécurité ministériel;</li> <li>Expérience dans la conduite d’enquêtes administratives en matière de sécurité, de résolution des doutes, de révision pour motif valable ou d’activités similaires;</li><li>Connaissance pratique de la politique sur la sécurité du gouvernement et de ses directives et normes connexes.</li> </ul> Bien que nous considérions avec grand intérêt toutes les candidatures, seuls les candidats qui seront retenus seront convoqués en entrevue. <br/><br/> EACL est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et s’est engagé à favoriser la diversité culturelle de la main-d’œuvre.
Title: Security Program Manager

Job_Description: <div> <div> Job ID:  <br/>  J1116-0517</div>  <br/><div> Division:  <br/>  Technologies</div>  <br/><div> City / Province: <br/><br/> Toronto, Ontario</div>  <br/><div> Job Type:  <br/>  Permanent Full Time</div>  <br/><div> Posted (dd/mm/yyyy):  <br/>  16/11/2016</div>  </div>  <br/><div> The Director, Information Security Operations and Programs is a senior leadership role accountable for the design, implementation and operation of the Security Operations Center (SOC), an organizational structure with the mandate of providing day-to-day security services to all member organizations of TMX Group Ltd. (TMX), globally. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all informational assets of TMX Group Ltd. (TMX) are protected against security threats in accordance with Tier 1 corporate policies and regulatory requirements. <br/>  <br/> Reporting to the VP Information Security and Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), the Director provides strategic leadership, direct and indirect management to staff, guidance and security operations oversight to TMX Business Units, technology vendors and clients. The Director ensures that Information Security policies, practices and controls are consistently implemented and effective across all organizations and departments involved in the corporate business value chain for the planning and delivery of TMX business products and services. <br/>  <br/> The Director’s role has both strategic planning and tactical accountabilities. The strategic outlook has a two to five year time horizon, and is focused on planning and delivering significant enterprise-level programs that provide qualitative and quantitative uplift to the security posture of TMX, as guided by corporate strategies and business objectives, and produces deliverables that are included in the strategic business plans of the TMX member organizations. <br/>  <br/> The tactical and operational accountabilities have shorter time-horizons and are focused on providing Business-As-Usual (BAU) security services to all TMX businesses, in support of their risk management and regulatory compliance objectives. The Director, has responsibility for ensuring that both the short- and the long-range operation of the department is effective and efficient. <br/>  <br/> The Director has several direct and indirect reports, and is responsible for the ongoing recruitment, performance evaluation, coaching, development and mentoring, for a team of highly specialized security professionals.</div>  <br/><div> Key Accountabilities:   <ul> <li>Accountable for the functional design, implementation and oversight of the Security Operations Center (SOC) in support of corporate risk management policies and regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Establishes effective relationships and processes with all IT and business areas of TMX, and establishes clear roles and responsibilities for information security practices and controls.</li> <li>Provide oversight to the delivery of all enterprise operational security services, including the collection of cyber threat intelligence, security vulnerability management, perpetual scanning (VA), logging and monitoring, Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), event correlation, operational metrics and reporting, cryptographic services, management of remote access and tokens, security audits and remediation, access control, and specialized security services, as needed, to TMX organizations.</li> <li>Develop operational processes and procedures that demonstrate high quality and cost effectiveness in the delivery of security services.</li> <li>Develop and tracks Board-level security metrics under the direction of the CISO, communicating the security posture of individual TMX businesses, status of regulatory compliance with regard to data protection and cyber-security readiness, and opportunities to strengthen the security posture.</li> <li>Maintain current knowledge of security solutions, anticipate and plan for product end-of-life and replacement.</li> <li>Responsible for preparing and managing annual operating and project budgets ensuring uninterrupted delivery of security services.</li> <li>Develop, in partnership with multiple IT and security, a technology roadmap that meets the evolving data protection needs of TMX and integrates in future investment plans of the enterprise.</li> <li>Lead major security initiatives that protect TMX business units from security threats, and ensure continuous improvement of the TMX security posture. This includes strategy formulation, identification of business and resource requirements, investment planning, program management, executive buy-in, and deployment oversight.</li> <li>Elicit feedback from clients on products and services in order to monitor and improve service quality levels and to maintain security risks within the approved risk appetite of the corporation.</li> <li>Interact effectively and persuasively with key stakeholders, both internally and externally as part of the larger financial industry and critical infrastructure of Canada.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <strong><div> Must Have Skills:</strong> <br/> <strong> CRITICAL SKILLS</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong project management, problem solving and analytical abilities.</li> <li>Exceptional and proven leadership capabilities – communication, influence, negotiation, conflict resolution, people management, relationship management (internally/externally), and multitasking.</li> <li>Advanced level of critical thinking and sound judgement.</li> <li>Strong strategic enterprise wide vision and planning skills.</li> <li>Proven ability to successfully partner and consult with stakeholders to identify business challenges and to develop effective strategies and alternatives to mitigate them.</li> <li>Ability to effectively lead change management initiatives.</li> <li>Strong conceptual skills; ability to deal with ambiguity; creativity; lateral thinker.</li> <li>Strong service management and service delivery orientation.</li> <li>Possesses expert written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to present complex information in a manner suitable for technical and non-technical audiences.</li> <li>Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail.</li> <li>Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.</li> <li>Strong team orientation and building skills, and ability to foster a collaborative environment.</li> <li>Accountable for the design, implementation and oversight of the corporate Information Security Program, as required by corporate policies and regulatory requirements.</li> </ul>  <strong>COMPETENCIES</strong> <br/>  <br/> Corporate Values <br/><br/> Demonstrates that one’s business and professional behaviors are guided by principles, values and ethics. Works in a way that is recognizably governed by corporate values and corporate Code of Conduct. <br/> Articulates what is right and wrong at work and demonstrates values-driven behavior.   <ul> <li>Customer Focus – Our customers provide the revenue that pays for the operation of the company. Understanding and meeting our customers’ needs and expectations drives everything we do.</li> <li>Partnership – Our partners are our employees, our customers, our vendors and other stakeholders. We seek out those who will be strong partners. We believe strong partnerships help us achieve our goals and objectives.
