As a team, we are TMX’s strength.</li> <li>Integrity</li> <li>Personal integrity means acting with respect, being accountable and trustworthy</li> <li>Professional integrity means our systems and services are reliable, secure and complete</li> <li>Corporate integrity means TMX is trusted, efficient and transparent.</li> <li>Continuous Improvement – We value continuous improvement, innovative solutions and adaptability to change.</li> </ul>  Business Competencies <br/>  <br/> Proficiency Level   <ul> <li>Strategic Planning 5</li> <li>Communication 5</li> <li>Decision Making 5</li> <li>Delegation 4</li> <li>Negotiation 4</li> <li>Managing Change 4</li> <li>Organizational Awareness 4</li> <li>Diversity 3</li> <li>Coaching 4</li> <li>Financial Management 4</li> <li>Understanding the Business 3</li> <li>Business Acumen 4</li> <li>Strategic Thinking 5</li> <li>Leadership 4</li> <li>Customer Relations 3</li> <li>Responsibility Driven 4</li> <li>Creative Thinking 4</li> <li>Inspiring 4</li> <li>Quality Management 4</li> <li>Conflict Management 3</li> <li>Career Planning 3</li> <li>Performance Management 4</li> <li>Problem Solving 4</li> <li>Initiative 4</li> <li>Facilitating Meetings 3</li> </ul>  Technical Competencies <br/>  <br/> Proficiency Level   <ul> <li>Optimizing 3</li> <li>Security Operations Best Practices 4</li> <li>Process Improvement 3</li> <li>IT Procurement/Asset Management 3</li> <li>Product Knowledge 3</li> <li>Security Information and Application Protection 5</li> <li>IT Security Policy Standards 5</li> <li>IT Security Monitoring Techniques 5</li> <li>Security Incident Management 5</li> <li>Security Threat & Risk Assessments (TRA) 5</li> <li>IT Security Resource Management 5</li> </ul>  Education and Experience   <ul> <li>A University graduate, with a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, Engineering or other related field</li> <li>Minimum 15 years of IT experience, with at least 10 years in a senior management capacity</li> <li>A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) designation or equivalent.</div></li> <br/><br/> </ul>  <strong><div> Skills:</strong> <br/> <ul> <li>Intrusion Tools</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div>
Title: Director, Information Security Operations and Programs

Job_Description: <div><div><em>As the third largest City in British Columbia, Burnaby covers an area of 98.6 km2 and is also the geographical centre of Metro Vancouver. With this size also comes a great responsibility to the citizens and City staff to continue to make Burnaby the best place to live, learn, work and play.</em> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Deputy Director – IT Infrastructure, the Senior Infrastructure Security Analyst is the senior technical role responsible for implementing, deploying, leading, developing, and supporting IT security solutions at the City. The incumbent also supervises the work of a small group of infrastructure security staff and directs the work of project staff; is responsible for securing City systems, information, and related infrastructure, including the configuration and deployment of security software and hardware and troubleshooting related systems; evaluates, acquires, and implements security-specific and business technology; acts as project leader for matters related to infrastructure hardening, certification, and accreditation of IT systems; creates and maintains project-related documents; oversees the functional and operational configuration and administrative tasks related to the hardening of IT infrastructure systems, desktops, operating systems, servers, network equipment, security equipment, and other City systems; serves as the infrastructure security subject matter expert; develops, recommends, and implements changes to security policies and practices; works to advance cooperation across organizations and between cyber security operational partners; aids the integration of partner cyber teams by providing guidance, resources, and collaboration to develop best practices and facilitate organizational support for achieving objectives in integrated cyber actions; performs related work as required. <br/><br/> The role requires the ability to: architect and implement complex technical solutions; plan, assign and supervise the work of a small group of subordinates; act as project lead, engage and communicate with a variety of audiences, both technical and non-technical; explain complex concepts, systems and technical topics to others who may have minimal technical knowledge using oral, written and visual presentations; establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts; monitor the security of the City’s computer networks, to investigate and resolve problems and to implement remedial actions; apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (related to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation); conduct vulnerability scans and recognize vulnerabilities in security systems; assess security controls based on cybersecurity principles and tenets (e.g., CIS CSC, NIST SP 800-53, Cybersecurity Framework, PCI, etc.) <br/><br/> Qualifications include a degree in Computer Science and five years of related experience in information security including experience with hardening systems and performing audits, security, vulnerability, penetration tests, assessments, and evaluations; or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. This role requires thorough knowledge of infrastructure security concepts, practices, and techniques. The role also requires strong analytical, organizational, and time management skills. Experience with PCI DSS is an asset. Technical experience with firewalls, intrusion prevention and detection systems, SEIM systems, network segmentation is preferred; as is completion of CISSP and/or CCSP certification. <br/><br/> <strong>The closing date for this competition has been extended to Friday May 25, 2018.</strong>  <strong> New applications are welcome!</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Copies of relevant professional certificates, degrees or tickets will be required at the time of the interview.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Please contact Human Resources at <strong>604-294-7303</strong> if you do not receive a confirmation email within one hour of submitting your application online.</em> <br/><br/> <em>If you would like to include a cover letter along with your application, please ensure to include it in the text area for a cover letter section of the application.</em></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Senior Infrastructure Security Analyst

Job_Description: <strong>What is the Opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Risk & Security Consultant, you will provide Information Security expertise within RBC and act as a key risk advisor to internal business and technology clients. In this role, you will offer advisory support for initiatives involving our infrastructure and enterprise applications to ensure risk mitigation controls are properly designed and documented. You will be the primary Risk & Security Services contact for projects involving new technology initiatives and enhancements to existing systems as well as interacting with all levels of the organization as a subject matter expert to ensure consistent and effective security risk planning. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Provide consulting services to project teams and their business units to assist in their security design in order to ensure alignment with RBC standards. Review any identified security issues and recommend the appropriate controls to mitigate these risks.</li><li>Develop and manage relationships with senior management executives and key decision makers with respect to security and risk related topics. Educate key organizational stakeholders and senior executive management on cyber security matters and impacts to the organization.</li><li>Drive Security Risk Assessment initiatives using RBC Risk Management methodologies and tools.</li><li>Assist and participate in Issue Management processes for capturing issues and/or risks into the Issue Management system.</li><li>Support in assessing the security posture of RBC 3rd party engagements and outsourcing initiatives including the review of supplier security policies, logical and physical application controls, and onsite inspections if required.</li><li>Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close.</li><li>Resolve complex conflicts/issues and escalate as appropriate.</li><li>Participate in risk and security awareness raising and educational opportunities.</li><li>Provide expertise, feedback and mentoring to build the capability of more junior staff.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Must-have</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years experience in Information Security/Risk Management</li><li>Expert knowledge of Information Security practices; Security Policies and Standards</li><li>General knowledge: Access control; Application Development Security; Application security best practices (secure coding/testing); Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery; Information Security Governance and Risk Management; Network security; Cryptography; Mobile; Cloud; Compliance, audit, and privacy policies and regulations</li><li>Industry recognized qualifications/certifications in Information Security and/or Risk Management (CISSP and/or CRISC)</li></ul></li> </ul>   <ul> <li><strong>Nice-to-have</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of OWASP, SANS, NIST, ISO 27001, ISF or other security-related practices</li><li>Other industry recognized qualifications/certifications (CISA / CCSK / CSSLP / SABSA) an asset</li><li>Previous Banking/Financial Industry experience</li><li>General knowledge of RBC Technology Security Standards & Practices</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li><li>A world-class training program in financial services</li><li>Flexible work/life balance options</li><li>Opportunities to do challenging work</li><li>Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities</li> <li>Opportunities to building close relationships with clients</li><li>Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies</li> </ul> <strong>SFSC</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 330 Front Street West <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-03-09 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 158869 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!
Title: Senior Risk & Security Consultant

Job_Description: The Security Analyst, Information Technology, supports the development and implementation of the corporate cyber strategy. The incumbent acts as the subject-matter expert for information technology (IT) security and leads initiatives related to IT security and cyber strategy. In addition, the incumbent researches and develops solutions to protect systems and applications that support cyber security goals.The Security Analyst, Information Technology, supports the development and implementation of the corporate cyber strategy. The incumbent acts as the subject-matter expert for information technology (IT) security and leads initiatives related to IT security and cyber strategy. In addition, the incumbent researches and develops solutions to protect systems and applications that support cyber security goals. <br/><br/> Experienced cyber professional with experience in the identification, analysis and mitigation of compromised conditions; a strong understanding of secure application design and network security; an applied understanding of IT security industry practices, trends and solutions; and a demonstrated passion for process. Additionally, the right candidate will have: Security or computer related university degree with a minimum of 6 years IT SECURITY. Demonstrated job experience and in-depth technical knowledge and skills in cyber and related disciplines. Ideal candidates may hold accredited verification in more than one of the following disciplines: CASP, CPP, SSCP, CISSP CISA, CISM, CCE, CHIH, or others. <br/><br/> Candidates must be eligible to obtain a SECRET level security clearance issued by the Canadian Federal Government <br/><br/> For further details and consideration, please apply on-line or send your resume to jobs@thesourcestaffing.com
Title: Sr. IT Security Analyst (re-post)

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity thief, fraud etc. IBM Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts; and we are looking for Software Developers to come make a difference. <br/><br/> <strong>Why join IBM Security?</strong>  <ul> <li>Work for one of the most advanced cyber security companies in the world and one of the world's most trusted brands</li><li>Use the most modern software development tools to work on the leading edge of software development, building micro services based cloud-first infrastructure</li><li>Work with a globally distributed and international team, with a culture centered on success</li><li>Competitive compensation and benefit packages</li><li>A world of opportunity for career growth</li> </ul>  <strong>What are your responsibilities?</strong> <br/><br/> · As a security cloud platform developer, you will be expected to demonstrate solid conceptual and technical skills as you develop, implement, and eventually help to run core infrastructure components to back IBM Securitys cloud portfolio of products <br/> · You will work with product owners to implement new components, and new features in existing components <br/> · You will help your team find and resolve technical debt using agile development practices <br/> · You will help your team support and run your services in production in a DevOps oriented fashion <br/> · You will work with other products and teams in the IBM Security division to help them utilize and develop against the platform components you build <br/><br/> <em><strong>This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <strong>FCHS*18</strong> <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>English Fluent (verbal and written)</li><li>3+ years of professional experience developing in Java</li><li>3+ years of experience in one or more of the following: Ruby / Python / Go</li><li>Experience in agile software development methodologies</li><li>Experience developing microservices based platforms based on RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience developing in a service-oriented Cloud environment</li><li>Willingness to take ownership of your code you build it, you run it</li><li>Ability to work with other geographically dispersed teams</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Experience working on extremely highly scalable platforms is a plus</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following technologies is a plus: Apache Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Apache Spark, Hadoop, Elastic Search, Node JS</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/> This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position. <br/><br/>
Title: IBM Security Cloud Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Worker Sub-Type:</strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/><strong><strong><strong> Job Description:</strong></strong></strong> <br/><br/> As a member of Cyber Security team, the Principal Information Security Architect will be responsible for ensuring that BlackBerry systems are designed and implemented securely. The primary focus will be reviewing architecture and design from a security and compliance standpoint ensuring deployments meet or exceed best practices for information systems security and control. Additional responsibilities include supporting BlackBerry internal technology teams, identifying and resolving security issues, performing infrastructure, O/S and code reviews to ensure secure practices are followed, and participation in project teams. Expert level experience in the following is an asset: Linux, Windows, routing and switching, encryption, cloud, virtual infrastructures, authentication methodologies, encryption, SSL, VPN, PKI, and threat risk assessments. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>: <ul> <li>Ensuring that BlackBerry systems are designed and implemented securely</li><li>Reviewing architecture and design from a security and compliance standpoint ensuring deployments meet or exceed best practices for information systems security and control</li><li>Supporting BlackBerry internal technology teams</li><li>Reviewing and completing detailed risk assessments on new technologies and solutions</li><li>Developing annual threat analysis and developing security roadmaps</li><li>Providing leadership and guidance through our incident response process</li><li>Identifying and working with cross functional organizations towards resolving security issues</li><li>Performing infrastructure, O/S and code reviews</li><li>Participation in project teams of varying scope and complexity</li><li>Provide mentoring and cross training</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications and Experience</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent relevant and recent experience is required</li><li>10+ years proven technical Information Security experience in a high tech environment</li><li>In depth experience in security policy development and risk analysis concepts</li><li>Extended experience performing Information Security risk assessments.</li><li>Experience producing and reviewing system architecture, design documentation and security strategy</li><li>Researches emerging trends/best practices and determines implications of proposed solutions on meeting business unit strategy.</li><li>Provides leadership, direction and guidance for Requirements Gathering and Scope definition for the projects.</li><li>Expert consultant on security engineering technologies and supporting processes for strategic projects.</li><li>Provides leadership in the assessment and evaluation of new and emerging security technologies and capabilities.</li><li>Conducts assessment on new Security Technology and Project requirements</li><li>Demonstrated experience presenting complex concepts, successfully to senior leaders</li><li>Expert level of experience relating to security regulations and relevant compliance frameworks (eg: ISO, SOC2, FISMA, NIST, G-cloud, FEDRAMP, HIPPA)</li><li>Expert level experience with physical security concepts, best practices and relevant controls</li><li>Expert level knowledge of encryption methodologies and technologies</li><li>Experience with SaaS/PaaS/IaaS cloud services, their integrations, authentication methodologies eg: SSO, SAML</li><li>CISSP, CRISC, CISA, or CISM required</li> </ul> <strong>We are seeking an individual with the following skills and assets:</strong> <ul> <li>You should have strong interpersonal skills, be self-motivated and proactive and enjoy working on a wide range of projects that require experience in marketing communications and training from a security perspective</li><li>Be outgoing, enthusiastic, and comfortable working with small and large teams</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Professional with experience on consulting, designing and delivering large projects/programs</li><li>IT Architecture Methodologies – ITIL, TOGAF</li><li>Design and deployment of Enterprise Security technologies and solutions e.g. Firewalls, IDS/IPS, SIEM, Malware detection & analytics, Vulnerability scanning Data Loss Prevention Services such as rule expansion, endpoint protection and data protection.</li><li>Experience in any of the following areas would be highly desired; (Data Leakage Prevention (DLP), Mobile Security, Mobile Threat Management, Endpoint Forensics, Vulnerability Scanning)</li><li>Experience dealing with today’s security threats, including advanced persistent threats, cloud, virtual networking, and BYOD</li><li>Togaf, CCSE, CCSP, CCNP, CCIE, MCSE or other designation desirable</li> </ul> <strong>Job Family Group Name:</strong><br/><br/>Information Technology<br/><br/><strong>Scheduled Weekly Hours:</strong><br/><br/>40
Title: Principal Security Architect

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Vaughan, Ontario, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Vaughan </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p> </p><p>Position overview:</p><p> </p><p>Reporting to the SOC Engineering manager, the Managed Security Solutions Specialist is self-motivated, energetic, driven for success and results oriented. Your knowledge of technical controls, service management, professional services and the firm will help you to support delivery and execution of managed security services offered by Deloitte. The Specialist will also be a key player and part of a team providing world-class security operations capabilities for our clients and a capability aligned with our strategic direction and that helps the firm better deliver on new and existing engagements. Our network of Cyber Intelligence Centres in Canada are located in Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver. We are recruiting in each of our Toronto Operations Centre. Occasional travel to local clients may be required and there are also opportunities for travel nationally and globally if the candidate is interested. The Specialist will participate in an after-hours 24x7 On-Call rotation as required. Ability to obtain Government of Canada "Secret" security clearance is required.</p><p> </p><p>Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Service Design, Transition, and Operation of the Deloitte Cyber Intelligence Center’s Managed Security Solutions offering. As a multi-tenant provider, our customer platforms include, but are not limited to:<ul><li>Firewall</li><li>Network IDS/IPS</li><li>Network Access Control (NAC)</li><li>Web Proxy</li><li>Endpoint Security</li><li>Email Security</li></ul></li><li>Operations</li><li>Support the client as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for steady-state managed solutions</li><li>Fulfill service requests for the range of supported technologies:<ul><li>Intake, plan, and deliver client deliverables such as configuration changes, information requests, and/or technical expertise</li></ul></li><li>Incident Response:<ul><li>Identify, investigate and resolve service outage or degradation of a managed security solution, and if required, engage and support the client and service providers</li></ul></li><li>Maintain current knowledge database through technical documentation and knowledge transfer sessions</li><li>Tune, maintain, and report upon system/network event monitoring Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity thief, fraud etc. IBM® Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts, so come make a difference & build a career <br/><br/> What is your job? <br/><br/> As a Data Analyst on the QRadar Software Development Team, you will be responsible for:  <ul> <li>Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports</li><li>Developing and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality</li><li>Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems</li><li>Identifying, analysing, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets</li><li>Filtering and cleaning data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems</li><li>Working with management to prioritize business and information needs</li><li>Locating and define new process improvement opportunities</li><li>Determining the meaning of data and explain how various teams and leaders can leverage it to improve and streamline their processes.</li><li>Performing testing and validation of data sets.</li> </ul>  The successful candidate will have the following:  <ul> <li>Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques</li><li>Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Cognos etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), source code tools (RTC etc)</li><li>Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)</li><li>Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings</li><li>Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team <br/> Strong attention to detail</li>  </ul>  <em><strong>This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>English Fluent (verbal and written)</li><li>Min 3-5 years Data mining experience</li><li>4+ years in a data analyst role</li><li>Strong leadership, collaboration, and project management skills.</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Title:</strong> Senior Information Security Consultant</div><br/>  <div><strong>Location:</strong> Toronto, ON</div>  <br/><strong><div>The Company:</div>  <br/></strong> <br/> <div> <div>FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 6,300 customers across 67 countries, including more than 40 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.</div></div>  <br/><strong><div>The Role:</div>  <br/></strong> <br/> <div>Mandiant Security Consulting Services ensures the long-term success of our clients by providing talented, passionate, and specialized security monitoring, threat intelligence, and incident management consulting expertise. We are looking for motivated and experienced consultants with great customer service skills to help customers assess, design, and build their own advanced threat detection capability and help to continually improve our own program methodology. The successful candidate will possess strong consulting skills, be adept in leading multiple projects under tight deadlines, and possess in-depth experience in security event monitoring, cyber threat intelligence, and/or computer incident response.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Provide guidance on building and/or maturing information security programs, detecting and responding to computer security incidents, and implementation of tools and technologies used for enterprise security</li> <li>Evaluate client needs, coordinate design for a solution, and clearly communicate the value proposition of complex and highly technical subjects</li> <li>Implement and/or assess existing security controls</li> <li>Provide expert level knowledge of tools and technologies used for enterprise security</li> <li>Interface with clients to address concerns, issues or escalations; track and drive to closure any issues that impact the service and its value to clients</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Requirements:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Provide expert experience building information security programs to include hands-on implementation and/or assessment of security controls</li> <li>Provide expert in-depth knowledge in collecting, analyzing, and escalating security events; responding to computer security incidents, and/or collecting, analyzing, and disseminating cyber threat intelligence</li> <li>Interaction with C-level executives</li>   <li>Quickly master, simplify, and communicate the value proposition of complex subjects to clients</li> <li>Use formal project management skills in planning, tracking, and reporting on project progress</li> <li>Evaluate customer needs, coordinate design for a solution, and clearly communicate solutions</li> <li>Codify customer needs across accounts and use them to drive Mandiant Strategic Solutions methodology</li> <li>Experience with the critical tools used in security event analysis, incident response, computer forensics, malware analysis, or other areas of security operations.</li>   <li>Thorough understanding of cyber security operations, event monitoring, and SIEM tools</li> <li>Fundamental understanding of network protocols</li> <li>Familiarity with Unix and Windows operating systems and administrative tools</li> <li>Understanding of security controls for common platforms and devices, including Windows, Unix, Linux, and network equipment</li> <li>Bachelors degree in a technical discipline (or equivalent work experience)</li> <li>Minimum of five years in IT</li> <li>Minimum of three years in information security</li> <li>Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Additional Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Ability to travel up to 50%</li> <li>Provide expert level knowledge of tools and technologies used for enterprise security</li> <li>Proven ability and understanding of the components that comprise a successful information security program</li> </ul>  <div>FireEye is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.</div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>#LI-AO1</strong></div></div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Video:</strong> </div></div> <br/>

Job_Description: <br/><br/> Requisition ID: 28118 <br/><br/> Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. <br/><br/> <strong>Purpose:</strong> <br/><br/> As part of the company’s Cyber Security Services (CSS) department, the position of Security Analyst Senior will work to protect the company’s assets and networks globally through the Security Operation Center (SOC) while also being a technical leader within the SOC. This individual will report directly to the Sr. Manager of the SOC and will work as part of the Proactive investigation (Hunt) team, Searching the environment for anomalies/IOCs that would indicate a potential compromise.  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Accountabilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a subject matter expert, this role will be expected to achieve the company’s information security objectives of confidentiality, integrity and availability (CIA) of information, as well as the delivery of company services through: <br/><br/> • Monitoring the environment through the Qradar SIEM solution to identify anomalies and IOCs that would indicate a critical vulnerabaility in a process/system, or an active threat. <br/><br/> • Security monitoring of the company’s internet resources, ensuring the appropriateness of resource settings, configuration and usage as well as protection from any network data leakage. <br/><br/> • Malware analysis to enrich the company’s threat intelligence program. <br/><br/> • Custom signature creation for malware/Intrusion detection, including but not limited to the following tools: Snort, Suricata, Qradar SIEM correlation rules, yara rules <br/><br/> • Works well within a team and individually on projects and tasks. <br/><br/> • Communicates effectively and professionally to a wide range target audience. <br/><br/> • Effectively breaks down technology knowledge & communicates to non-technical people. <br/><br/> • Monitors internet usage, user activity and other threats to the organization. <br/><br/> • Helps facilitate the company’s global security monitoring and threat intelligence programs. <br/><br/> • Provides subject matter expertise to CSS management on emerging threats and and findings uncovered during investigations. <br/><br/> • Escalates any incidents to I.R (incident response) for remediation <br/><br/> • Analyze threat telemetry from network/endpoint logging devices, providing remediation and recommendations where required. <br/><br/> • Provides in-depth malware analysis and provides findings to internal SOC teams. <br/><br/> • Responds as required in the event of a CERT / CSIRT. <br/><br/> • Takes part in CSS initiatives as directed to contribute to the strategic direction for security related technologies or other controls that need to be put in place to reduce the threat levels to the company. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> • Subject matter expert in one or more of the following: <br/><br/> o HIPs agent management/configuration <br/><br/> o LDAP/Kerberos authentication <br/><br/> o Mobile device operating systems (Android/Apple IOS) <br/><br/> o Software / web development security <br/><br/> o Database security <br/><br/> o Security Incident Response <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Skills:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will be expected to conduct investigations into anomalous traffic in the environment, focusing on endpoint logs. This analysis aims to identify threats and mal-intent towards the organization by means of intrusion detection while also producing reports, root cause analysis (where applicable) and security tuning recommendations from the findings. As a technical leader, the business will rely heavily on your technical expertise to make product, policy or procedure changes to enhance the company’s security. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> • This position involves after hours on call support work for problem resolution. <br/><br/> • This position could interact with company declared CERT, CSIRT deployments for security incidents. <br/><br/> • As a senior analyst, this position may call upon the individual to provide consulting services to management on their technical expertise. <br/><br/> The following qualifications are considered an asset should the individual have them: <br/><br/> • Working knowledge of major programming languages (python, objective C, C#, SQL, AQL, others). <br/><br/> • Ability to deal with highly technical issues and extremely complex diverse systems. <br/><br/> • Ability to implement policy changes to IPS platforms. <br/><br/> • Knowledge of the company’s security strategy, associated policies, platform specific standards and control objectives as they relate. <br/><br/> • Experience with any of the following technical fields: operating systems administration, vulnerability management, malware analysis, databases and web services / web applications. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Education:</strong> <br/><br/> University degree or College Diploma in any of the following: <br/><br/> o Information technology, information security, computer science, or equivalent <br/><br/> The following accreditations are considered an asset should the individual have them: <br/><br/> • GSEC, CompTIA Security+ <br/><br/> • ITIL <br/><br/> • Any additional security specific certification (CEH, OSCP, certs from GIAC or SANS, etc.) <br/><br/> • University degree or college diploma or (2) years equivalent security industry-related experience required <br/><br/> • Certifications in security preferred (eg. CISSP, GCIA, GCIH, GREM, GCFA) but not required <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Scarborough <br/><br/> As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>Information Security and IT Risk Consulting <br/><br/> Messa is a Cyber Security Services supplier to the Government of Canada (Federal and Provincial). Our team requires CISSP Certified Experts to support our clients projects. Our services combine strategy, governance, technical and risk management expertise and fall broadly within the following client issues;   <ul> <li>Strategy & Governance</li> <li>Resilience, Incident Management & Crisis Management</li> <li>Identity & Access Management</li> <li>Security Architecture & Solution Implementations</li> <li>Securing Emerging Technologies, Supply Chain & Business Models</li> <li>Threat Intelligence & Vulnerability Management</li> <li>Privacy & Information Protection</li> <li>Risk & Regulatory</li> </ul>  The primary responsibilities will include;   <ul> <li>Establish credibility and relationships with prospective cyber security clients by demonstrating technical and industry knowledge and identify opportunities for assistance.</li> <li>Lead the end to end delivery (including project economics) of multiple security projects comprising of multiple resources and teams and ensure the quality of deliverables and clients are satisfied with the work.</li> <li>Support business development activities including sales, proposals, and building and maintaining sustainable client relationships.</li> </ul>  If you are interested in being considered for our project please email resumes to <u>info@messa.com</u> or call 613-721-8185</div> </div></div></div></div><div><div></div></div>
Title: Sr. Security Analyst

Job_Description: Incident Responses Analyst  Position Summary:  As an Incident Response Analyst at Equifax, you will provide incident response and analytic capabilities to an enterprise wide cybersecurity program. The Incident Response Analyst will possess technical knowledge and experience performing incident response, threat hunting, network and system monitoring, malware analysis, and has performed cyber incident related digital forensics. The position will include a robust assortment of security projects that support the Global Security team.  Additional responsibilities of the Incident Response Analyst include: Provide tiered technical resolution for security incidents and SOC service requests with an emphasis on Tier 3 and greater Conduct host and network analysis, forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations Recognize and collect attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations Build scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance incident investigation processes Effectively communicate investigative findings and strategy to stakeholders including technical staff, executive leadership, and legal counsel Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans in response to incidents Perform analysis of complex datasets to produce relevant intelligence products Support internal investigations and identify security gaps and strategies Leverages ability to identify new attack TTPs and recommend mitigation techniques Will use disparate data sources and evidence to detect and decipher abnormalities in various log formats, with a primary focus on the internal threat landscape Ability to follow established processes and to improve as needed  Required skills of the Incident Response Analyst include: 5+ years' general information security experience 3+ years' experience in a Security Incident Response role Knowledge of tools used for network security (DLP, NIPS, HIPS, AV, Firewalls, etc.) Mastery of *nix and Windows operating system functionality Proficient in the use of the varied and diverse log analysis and forensic tools Thorough understanding of network protocols Strong research, analytic, writing and briefing skills Ability to effectively manage multiple, concurrent activities, while understanding and managing priorities, dependencies and risk Expert capabilities to research, create, develop and deliver professional briefings, multimedia presentations, and written reports to both operational and senior leadership levels Ability to work independently, as well as mentoring other team members Ability to work or be on-call during off hours Demonstrated flexibility, initiative, judgment and discretion English language proficiency Willingness to learn new tools and processes and proven track record of learning new technologies, methodologies, and skills Organizational, time management, customer service and problem-solving skills  Education: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) required Post-graduate degree preferred Certifications such as GIAC (GCIA, GCIH, GSEC, GCFA, GCFE, etc.), CISSP, CEH or related certification(s) desired  What exactly does Equifax do?  Equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. The company organizes, assimilates and analyses data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers.  Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our people makes a difference in our business. Equifax offers a performance-driven culture that rewards results and encourages growth and development. Many expect us to be a serious workforce, and we are - we're serious about continuing to grow our business, serious about working together as one team, and serious about continuously building a strong, engaged workplace that embraces integrity and change as much as it does fun, camaraderie and philanthropy.  Some noteworthy achievements for the company include: Named to the Top 100 American Banker FinTech Forward list (2015-2016); named a Top Technology Provider on the FinTech 100 list (2004-2016); named an InformationWeek Elite 100 Winner (2014-2015); named a Top Workplace by Atlanta Journal Constitution (2013-2017); named one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies (2011-2015); named one of Forbes' World's 100 Most Innovative Companies (2015-2017). For more information, visit www.equifax.com .  Primary Location: CAN-Toronto-5700 Yonge  CAN-Anjou, CAN-Toronto-33-Bloor  Function: Function - Security Governance and Compliance  Schedule: Full time
Title: Incident Response Analyst

Job_Description: About Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) is a division of BMO that combines Information Security, Information Management and Technology Risk into a comprehensive department. GITRM’s mandate is to provide sound governance and guidance on information and technology risk, as well as to provide critical services central to protecting the Bank against cyber threats. GITRM (Business) PMO is accountable to execute on these critical services and solutions while operating securely in an increasingly connected global environment. Description: The PMO Analyst is a Best Practice and Process Expert - training, project oversight, quality assurance and methodology development. Will also be a Knowledge Management Coordinator - project records, standards, methods, and lessons learned must be stored in our project database. The PMO Analyst will control documents, facilitate communication between the project office and stakeholders and collect data to meet reporting requirements. Key Accountabilities: Maintaining the PMO sharepoint site, library and archives and any associated online project knowledge management system capability, to ensure information is always accurate and current. Govern clarity PM data accuracy. Run monthly PM Data Governance and KRI dashboard reports. Track and Follow-up on any non-conformances. Run monthly spotfire dashboard reports for each of the portfolio review meetings with the appropriate leaders and their teams. Manage, Track and Follow-up on Action Items from these meetings Preparing project performance analyses for PMO and senior management review Maintain and Coordinate the PM Intake process, including the “capacity vs demand” reports Coordinates and schedules training classes to advance the skills and capabilities of project managers and educate employees about EPMO changes. Create PDU forms and track inventory Maintain, Coordinate and Deliver on-boarding, off-boarding and training to new PMs Coordinating scheduled routines such as monthly project audits, forecasts, time-sheet approvals Assist with the day-to-day operations of the PMO Provide information to PMO management to enable PM assignment and handle updates/ announcements, as required Develop specific views for Clarity Supplier report as necessary Research the various Spotfire visualizations for useful resourcing and forecasting views for PMO Management Upgrade and enhance PMO Database, ensuring audit, risk and compliance standards are met Manage and control documents, such as form templates, meeting minutes, reports, plans and schedules. Maintain PMO vacation and training calendars Qualifications Skills: Basic knowledge of Project Management concepts and practices needed to develop/maintain processes and create templates to support project management Experience in change leadership and change management Solid knowledge and expertise in the use of program management methodologies and tools (e.g. Clarity, MS Project, SharePoint repositories, TIBCO Spotfire, Software Development Life Cycle, etc.) Strong communication skills Influencing skills We’re here to help  At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Job  Project Management Primary Location  Canada-Ontario-Scarborough Organisation  GITRM-X000060 Schedule  full-time Job Posting  05/14/18 Unposting Date  Ongoing
Title: PMO Analyst (GITRM, Cybersecurity)

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.  Technology Risk Management and Information Security (TRMIS) is a group of technology, security and risk professionals in Canada, the U.S. and the U.K., focused on managing a comprehensive program to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls.  The Cyber Threat Management Team is responsible for protecting the Bank, customers and employees by mitigating and identifying technology threats to TD. Development of effective risk management programs help ensure TD’s best-in-class cyber security approach.  What We Stand For The TRMIS program is continuously evolving to mitigate risks to the bank, including introducing new initiatives and improved defense. With a layered approach to protect customers, employees and the bank from cyber threats, TD manages, challenges and reviews technology controls for all business applications.   Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 9-5  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions  Job Category(s) Technology Solutions  Job Description Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform: Highly motivated, team-oriented, self-learner, responsible, and focused on exceeding expectations Strong organizational skills to facilitate management and tracking of large numbers of findings, requirements and changes, and activities Sense of urgency, resourcefulness and enthusiasm in adopting and implementing identified technical solutions Ability to apply accurate logic and common sense in data and problem analysis Ability to protect confidential information and act with a high level of integrity Knowledge in current and emerging technologies in the space of Information Security, particularly with Vulnerability and Configuration Management Demonstrates understanding of the processes necessary to execute an enterprise-wide control function Ability to understand requirements and execute processes related to configuring and operating solutions in compliance with corporate security standards High level of confidence and assertiveness in high-pressure situations Ability to build strong relationships with individual technical Subject Matter Experts from all areas of Technology Ability to quickly analyze large amounts of information and provide necessary feedback and synopsis to team leads or technical managers Excellent written and oral communications skills and ability to articulate and present information to all levels of technical staff and stakeholders  Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:  One to three years' work experience in information security, cyber security, data protection or a related field Minimum of a two-year degree in information protection, computer forensics, computer information systems, computer science, or information systems management 1+ years of experience in performing vulnerability management for all enterprise platforms Knowledge of risk-based vulnerability prioritization, reporting, and developing remediation steps Knowledge of developing and reviewing processes and run books for vulnerability identification, configuration violations identification, analysis, remediation, and reporting Experience with identifying and troubleshooting problems Experience with configuration & change management operational processes Must have solid understanding of Network and Security infrastructure, topology including firewalls, routers, wireless access points, DNS, DHCP, and Group Policy Knowledge of securing virtual, physical and cloud environments Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Qualys, HPSA, HPNA, IBM Guardium or equivalent vulnerability assessment tools Professional IT security certification such as CISSP, SANS Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), CompTIA Security+, CEH, GSEC and/or CISM is preferred An understanding of regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, FFIEC, SOX, HIPAA, ISO 2700x, NIST standards  Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing: Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside. Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  **Province/State (Primary) Ontario  City (Primary) Scarborough
