Title: Technical Advisor, IT Security

Job_Description: Job Description The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity thief, fraud etc. IBM® Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts, so come make a difference & build a career  What is your job?  As a Data Analyst on the QRadar Software Development Team, you will be responsible for: Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports Developing and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems Identifying, analysing, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and “cleaning” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems Working with management to prioritize business and information needs Locating and define new process improvement opportunities Determining the meaning of data and explain how various teams and leaders can leverage it to improve and streamline their processes. Performing testing and validation of data sets. The successful candidate will have the following:  Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Cognos etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), source code tools (RTC etc) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team Strong attention to detail  This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  English Fluent (verbal and written) Min 3-5 years’ Data mining experience 4+ years in a data analyst role Strong leadership, collaboration, and project management skills.  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
Title: Data Analyst - Security Intelligence

Job_Description: About Us BDO. Because relationships matter.  There are many world-class accounting firms. Far fewer that offer a culture so rich in professional opportunity, personal fulfillment, and long-term growth. At BDO, we understand that exceptional service to our clients begins – and ends – with exceptional regard for our people. Because at its core, our business is not about numbers or spreadsheets, dollars or pence, but about people working with, for, and in service of others. In short, because relationships matter. Job Description (EN) Position Description  BDO is seeking a leader for its national Cybersecurity Practice.  The Cybersecurity helps businesses develop, assess and implement Information Systems strategies, architectures and mechanisms. Candidates must have relevant experience in IT security operations and / or management consulting. The chosen collaborator will ensure the development of the partnerships, expertise and Cybersecurity Advisory Services at BDO. He or she will be involved in advisory mandates for clients of all sizes in a variety of industries such as financial institutions, retail, public services, transportation, etc.  Candidates will have excellent written and spoken communication abilities, proven leadership qualities and exceptional capacity to understand our clients’ needs. We are looking for team oriented people with strong professional ethics. Our very broad range of clients allows us to offer stimulating and interesting jobs.  The position can be fulfilled in the following locations: Montréal, Québec City, Ottawa or Toronto.  Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities Develop new cybersecurity service offers with our cybersecurity allied firms; Combine cybersecurity resources and expertise at national level and establish relations with partners of the different Canadian geographical areas; Supervise /manage the execution of cybersecurity mandates (in collaboration with our cybersecurity allied firms), including: Evaluate IT security postures and architectures; Develop IT security improvement programs; Assess security configurations for firewalls, databases, servers, work stations; Develop IT strategies and recovery plans in the event of a disaster; Manage the performance of penetration tests or “red teaming” at web application level, on infrastructures, networks (internal/external), physical security, wireless technologies; Intervene in IT internal audit mandates as a cybersecurity expert; Develop methods and processes for security development in business solutions; Review and write up security policies, guidelines, standards and procedures; Recruit a team of cybersecurity strategists across the country to develop and deliver cybersecurity services. Education and Professional Skills/Knowledge A minimum of 8 to 10 years of experience in IT security for a consulting firm or in an IT management position; Bachelors or Masters in computer science or Information System Security; Knowledge of main best practices frameworks and references: OWASP, OSSTMM, etc.; Experience or specialization in information systems security an asset; Hold CISSP, CEH, SANS GIAC certification or equivalent an asset; Knowledge of ISO27000, Cobit, ITIL standards and frameworks an asset; Bilingual French and English - written and spoken - is essential; Excellent analytical capacity; Dynamic and self-directed; Curiosity and well-informed of later trends; Excellent written and spoken communication qualities is essential; Will be required to travel. "One firm engaged in making a difference through building strong relationships with our people, our clients and our communities." Our Vision  At BDO we create opportunities for our employees while providing an exciting environment promoting work and experience diversity. Our employees may participate at many work aspects and communicate with our partners, which accessible to our staff and clients, reinforcing our common vision of One BDO for all. #LI-MM1
Title: Manager, Cyber Security

Job_Description: Our client within the professional services industry is looking for a Senior Analyst, Cyber Security for a PERMANENT opportunity. The client is located in Downtown Toronto close to Union Station. The successful candidate will be expected to communicate and provide feedback on IT Security operations and strategic planning, delivering on IT project initiatives while ensuring appropriate project milestones and objectives are being met. The successful candidate will assist with resolving complex issues for day to day operations as required.  Roles and Responsibilities  Work closely with business managers, external auditors, technical team members, architects and other senior team members to understand the Firm’s requirements related to information systems security and regulatory compliance, and to map those requirements to security initiatives and projects  Develop, oversee and implement the Firm’s information security policies, standards and guidelines  Oversee the continuous monitoring and protection of the IT infrastructure, IT systems and Firm information  Ensure unauthorized intrusions, access and tampering are prevented and that any such security incidents are quickly remediated  Evaluate suspected security breaches and recommend corrective actions (including incidents involving outside vendors)  Serve as the Firm’s focal point for security incident response planning and execution and lead the Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT)  Assist with and participate in the execution of Internal/External Audits, Risk Assessments and Risk Management and develop appropriate criteria needed to assess the level of compliance of new/existing applications and/or technology infrastructure with firm-wide security standards  Support the design, implementation, operation and maintenance of the Information Security Management System based on the ISO 27000 series standards, including certification against ISO 27001  Form a “center of excellence” for information security management, offering internal advice and practical assistance on information security risk and control matters throughout the organization; promote the effective management of information security risks  Assist the Infrastructure and Application Architects in the review of applications and/or technology environments during the design and/or development process to (a) assure compliance with Firm security policies and directions and (b) assist in the overall integration process within the Firm’s technology environment  Research, develop, recommend and deploy the most effective and appropriate security technology tools to minimize information security threats  Provide leadership, mentoring, guidance and advice to other network and security team members as required  Perform research, evaluate, review and make recommendations for new technologies or for changes to existing technologies to enhance the Firm’s security posture  Qualifications and Experience  Experience in establishing, implementing, operating, monitoring, reviewing, maintaining and improving an Information Security Management System based on the ISO 27001 standards  Knowledge of L4-L7 protocols such as SSL, HTTP, DNS, SMTP and IPSec  Intermediate to expert knowledge with IDS/IPS solutions  Strong understanding of firewall technologies such as Palo Alto or Cisco  Strong understanding of endpoint protection technologies such as McAfee ePO and Carbon Black  Understanding of information management and data classification  Intermediate to expert virus protection and content filtering knowledge  Knowledge of encryption techniques and PKI infrastructure  Penetration Testing / Risk Assessment / Audit and Compliance knowledge  Audits and security accreditation process experience  Experience in ISO compliance  Understanding of incident investigations processes and reporting  Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent  A minimum of 5 years full-time work experience in information systems security management  Information Systems Security qualifications such as CISSP, CISA, or CISM  In-depth experience in: vulnerability testing and penetration testing; developing information systems security practices as a people problem versus a technical problem; standards-based architecture with an understanding of how to get there, including compliance monitoring and enforceability; knowledge of network systems and security protocols; knowledge of security software programs and implementation; knowledge of best practices in developing security procedures and infrastructure.
Title: Senior Analyst, Cyber Security

Job_Description: Job Description Change the world at IBM. There aren’t many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation.  Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress.  Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available – the sky is the limit!   This position resides in Fredericton, NB and is a 4 or 8 (co-op) month work term commencing September 2018 . It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.  What IBM Offers You?  Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance Access to the Future Blue Community - IBM’s large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events. It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs  Closing Date: Open Until Filled  Security Intelligence Software Developer Coop with Performance Engineering Focus  The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. IBM Security Intelligence is the global provider of high-value, cost-effective, security information and event management (SIEM) products. The flagship offering QRadar is currently the industry leader in SIEM. QRadar integrates previously disparate functions including log management, network behavior analytics and security event management into a total security intelligence solution. QRadar provides users with crucial visibility into what is occurring with their networks, data centers, and applications to better protect IT assets and meet regulatory requirements. At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity theft, fraud, etc. IBM Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts; the successful candidate will be working with QRadar's Release Analytics and Performance Assessment Team (RAPA).  Main Responsibilities: For continuous system behavior analysis, executing Performance Assessment Framework to assess build/appliance benchmark results and recording them in companywide collaboration tool. Extending Performance Assessment Framework with new modules to provide better coverage for an evolving product at a high rate. Reporting and verifying issues using the collaboration tool and work with other agile teams to close stories/defects. Perform initial investigation of pipeline degradations, perform mini experiments to narrow down the issue to component/feature. Read the code, read the docs to understand how the system should behave and assess whether it is the case or not. Learning about the product to understand the QRadar data pipeline. Reviewing customer documentation. Work closely with other members of the Agile team and report status on daily scrums to the team. This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory Having an eye for detail and curiosity on how things work and why things do not work. Experience with Linux operating systems. Experience with two or more of the following: Java, SQL, Bash, Python, Git. Professionalism in verbal and written communication skills. Ability to manage workload to meet specific deadlines. Must work effectively as part of an agile team and be able to exercise independent judgment. within defined guidelines and procedures.  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Experience using Agile methodologies Knowledge of the software development process in general. Experience in data visualization techniques. Experience with developing and maintaining code. Enthusiasm in Security Industry and Ethical Hacking  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
Title: Security Intelligence Performance - Coop (Fredericton, NB)

Job_Description: A mutually rewarding experience. Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability. Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.  About Mars, Incorporated Mars is a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love. With almost $35 billion in sales, the company is a global business that produces some of the world’s best-loved brands: M&M’s®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5™, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BEN’S®, MARS DRINKS and COCOAVIA®. Mars also provides veterinary health services that include BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® and Pet Partners™. Headquartered in McLean, VA, Mars operates in more than 80 countries. The Mars Five Principles – Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom – inspire its more than 100,000 Associates to create value for all its partners and deliver growth they are proud of every day.  Mars Canada is a subsidiary of the US family-owned business known as Mars, Incorporated, one of the leading global manufacturers of branded products. Established in the late 1940's, our three segments – Petcare, Mars Wrigley Confectionary and Food help Canadians celebrate life everyday through food experiences. We are an organization that is guided by our Five Principles: Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom. It is putting these principles into action that allows us to make a difference to people and the planet, through our performance.  Mars Petcare (Royal Canin) is looking for Factory Information Technology Coordinator in Guelph, ON.  The Factory IT Coordinator will ensure the health, connectivity and modernization of the factory IT systems. An integrated architecture requires security, (virus updates), operating system patches (Windows updates) and audits (threat assessments) to maintain system health. Reliable connectivity within the network structure is required for a factory to produce. Responsibilities will include software, hardware, factory network architecture, and server environments. The position provides the technical leadership for approved changes. The individual will take an engineered approach to all project/change phases (discovery, data gathering, phase-in, validation and testing, and release).  The job is performed both in an office environment and factory floor. Knowledge of factory systems is fundamental for success. Improvement projects will be generated from above, at position level, and from factory floor. The candidate is expected to be curious, drive for results, collaborate in a team environment, execute technical tasking independently, communicate with plant leadership and keep remote stakeholders informed.  Key Responsibilities: Owner of Factory IT Cybersecurity Deploy remediation solutions to mitigate current risk and maintain Cyber Security Standard Insure appropriate actions are done properly: backup/patching/antivirus and system updates Inventory, control and purchasing of IT infrastructure components and manage lifecycle. Prepare “crisis tool kit” and procedures for Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Planning Delivery of IT Solutions related Services Ensure that key users of for all critical factory operations are in place Work closely with associates of the site in order to understand and to characterize issues that might occur regarding the factory IT systems and applications in use. Has a strong technical background, is responsible for issue resolution, continuous improvement for factory IT infrastructure and solutions with the relevant internal/external partners. Raise and track tickets in the global ticketing system in order to track KPIs and provide dashboards to local and global factory teams Delivery of IT Solutions related Projects Is the owner of the factory IT Infrastructure and factory IT master plan. Is responsible for implementation, coordination and budget of factory IT projects. Business Engagement and communication Is the key contact and provides communication of factory IT infrastructure solutions and services to Production, Maintenance, Central Engineering and the Mars IS Business Partner. Liaise with and escalate critical issues to the Central Support and Security Teams as needed. Is responsible for effective use of factory IT infrastructure services including providing training, documentation and raising awareness of available IT tools and services. Seen as an expert in IT, demonstrating clear understanding of problems and opportunities for business change. Proactive in bringing forward new solutions and technology.  Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree In lieu of degree, 5 additional years’ experience required 3 years’ experience working in a factory/manufacturing environment, experience interfacing with and troubleshooting networks, switches, software, scanners, wireless computers, printers, label makers, CCTV and time clocks Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills   The ability to work on a team and be the liaison between the factory and corporate IT Experience with: Continuous improvement projects Control system specifications and device selections Capturing and transferring knowledge Managing small to mid-sized projects  Preferred Qualifications: Advanced Degree 4+ years’ experience working in a factory/manufacturing environment, experience interfacing with and troubleshooting networks, switches, software, scanners, wireless computers, printers, label makers, CCTV and time clocks  Company paid relocation is not available for this role.  A criminal records check will be required for this position. Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.  Accommodation is available to support job applicants with accessibility needs in all parts of the hiring process as required under Royal Canin's Accommodation and Accessibility Policies when applying for a position at Royal Canin Canada, as well as during the interview process. Please let us know if you have accessibility requirements. For more information and to address any questions about that policy please contact us at: AODA@royalcanin.com
Title: Factory Information Technology Coordinator - Guelph, ON

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Global Security & Investigations (GSI) is a specialized team dedicated to the security and safety of our employees, customers, third parties, physical assets and information. Using a risk-based approach, the team is responsible to identify, investigate, mitigate and manage risks by developing key strategies, designing comprehensive security and investigative programs, educating businesses within TDBG on security measures and protocols and working collaboratively with internal and external partners.  Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 7.5  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Global Security & Investigations  Job Category(s) Global Security & Investigations  Job Description The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations, supports the protection of organizational assets and human resources across all TD enterprise-wide locations (including remote offices) and by providing advice, planning, and support for GSI Investigations leadership.  The Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations: Leads a team of highly skilled Digital Evidence professionals who conduct complex and sensitive investigations, across North America Applies sound methodologies to collect, preserve, and analyze digital evidence Stays abreast on the emerging technology threat landscape across the globe Works with Financial Crimes & Fraud Management Group (FC&FMG), fraud operations groups, IT security (TRM&IS), Legal, Human Resources, and external law enforcement, as necessary, to identify cyber attackers Researches, evaluates, develops, tests and applies new methodologies for analyzing digital evidence to reduce the risk of exposure to TD Bank Supports / develops procedures and standards and delivers advice, direction and education to TD management and staff Serves as an ambassador for GSI within FC&FMG and TD in general  Job Requirements Key Accountabilities Manage a cross-border team of highly-skilled Digital Evidence professionals, locally or remotely Lead Digital Evidence / cybercrime investigations Focus on operational efficiency to ensure the Digital Evidence team is leveraging tools and processes that reduce redundancy and improve capacity Stay current on industry trends and emerging threats Respond to business units and FC&FMG teams to investigate simple or complex, sensitive, or urgent matters, usually within minimal time-frames Develop and maintain programs for supervision, timeliness, and management of all assigned investigators/investigations Ensure all reports (Interim and Final Investigative Reports, Briefing Notes, etc.) are properly written and vetted prior to distribution to senior management Prepare regular written or in-person Digital Evidence updates Develop and maintain two-way communications with peers within FC&FMG, and Digital Evidence teams in other Financial Institutions Testify and present evidence, as required Develop and maintain effective liaison relationships, at senior levels with law enforcement, security agencies, and external security experts Stand in for the Senior Manager, Forensic Investigations and Digital Evidence, for functions or meetings or as interim relief  Required Competencies Extensive knowledge of investigations and criminal and regulatory legislation, regulation, procedures, and guidelines Solid understanding of organizational priorities and relationships Solid understanding of the principles of investigation, including reporting, evidence handling, and court or regulatory proceedings Solid understanding of governing plans and documents, procedures, and business administration Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, organization, leadership and planning skills Proven ability to manage crisis and emergency incidents Ability to work with businesses from a business perspective and interpret Digital Evidence matters in a way understandable to business and non-technical people Self-starter, strategic thinker, negotiator and consensus builder, proven ability to satisfactorily manage competing priorities Expert understanding of network protocols, TCP/IP fundamentals OR Expert understanding of operating systems (Windows, Linux and OSX) Expert understanding of intrusion detection systems (e.g. Snort, Suricata) and tools (e.g. tcpdump, Wireshark) Knowledge of Malware Triage and Reverse Engineering Knowledge of network based services and client/server applications Knowledge of enterprise systems and infrastructure Familiarity with network architecture and security infrastructure placement Familiarity with security tools such as Anti-Virus, Ironport systems and Data Loss Prevention Tools Experience with programming/scripting languages Background in operational information security disciplines (e.g. incident response, security infrastructure management or monitoring services) Background performing incident response and digital forensics Experience in config/mgmt of feeds into event aggregation and correlation systems (e.g., Splunk, ArcSight) Experience with improvement of analyst effectiveness by optimizing signature quality in collaboration with other analysts and developers Background in systems administration for Windows and/or Unix based environments  Decision-Making Authority Approves procedural level governance As assigned, approves budget and financial matters as provided in TD’s Delegated Signing Authorities  Key Relationships Close working relationship with peers in FC&FMG, TRM&IS, Legal, and HR Frequent interaction with senior executives in Corporate Office and all Business Groups  Additional Information Education and Experience:  University degree or college diploma from a recognized Institute of Technology or University program in an appropriate specialty such as Computing Science, or a related field Professional designation in the following designations would be an asset: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), SANS Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) and EnCE (Encase Certified Examiner) Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with a corporate or government investigative and/or intelligence department within an organization of comparable size and complexity to TD, including at least 5 years’ experience in investigations  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  **Province/State (Primary) Ontario  City (Primary) Toronto
Title: Manager, Digital Evidence & Cyber Investigations

Job_Description: EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.  We currently have a career opportunity for a Manager in our Cybersecurity advisory team to participate in multiple client engagement teams and related activities. As a member, you'll deliver and lead cybersecurity and IT risk client engagements as well as internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish internal and external relationships. You'll also identify potential business opportunities for EY within existing engagements, and escalate these as appropriate. Similarly, you'll anticipate and identify risks within engagements and raise any issues with senior members of the team. In line with EY's commitment to quality, you'll confirm that work is of high quality and is reviewed by the next-level reviewer. Responsibilities: Client Responsibilities Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business. Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to assimilate to new knowledge. Possess good business acumen. Remain current on new developments in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge. Demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems. Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations. People Responsibilities Contribute to people-related initiatives, including development, coaching, recruiting, training and retaining staff Maintain an educational program to continually develop personal skills of staff Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures Qualifications  Desired qualifications include: Undergraduate or masters’ degree preferably in one of the following areas: Information Security, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, and other related majors Knowledge and 5-7 years of hands-on experience with key components of cybersecurity incl. network & infrastructure security, access and identity management, threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, security governance, risk and compliance, security architecture, data protection, privacy, security awareness and others. Expert knowledge and 4-5 years of practical experience with common frameworks, standards and methodologies used in cybersecurity field Practical experience with conducting risk assessments and testing of controls Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of data analytics methods Possession of at least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISA CISM Familiarity with or knowledge of cybersecurity in Industrial Control Systems and Operational Technology Demonstrated leadership abilities Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills  Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50-70%. EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
Title: Manager – Cyber Security

Job_Description: ARE YOU A SECURITY PROFESSIONAL WITH EXPERIENCE SHAPING CORPORATE IT SECURITY STRATEGY AND PLANNING? Our large enterprise client is hiring an IT Cybersecurity Manager on a full-time basis. IT Cybersecurity Manager This position is an exciting role for the right candidate with strong technical know-how and leadership qualities who is eager to work on security planning, testing in an Advisor capacity. This position presents opportunities to advise on IT cybersecurity /risk strategy for a very large corporation. About the Opportunity Perform IT security architecture reviews and provide feedback on proposed designs Serve as a subject matter expert providing advisory services related to IT security architecture strategy as well as security requirements implementation both locally and at the global level Utilize a forward-looking posture to defend against cybersecurity vulnerabilities and provide testing/planning advice Recommend critical IT security tools and drive their capability and functionality improvements along with their associated processes Collaborate with the IT teams to ensure current tools support the overall IT security strategy Support the planning, development and implementation of critical projects by enhancing defense-in-depth security architecture strategies Implement company-specific policies and procedures in accordance with the company’s global information security and privacy policies About You Minimum of 5 years of previous hands-on experience in IT security Bachelor’s degree in a related field (such as information technology or management) or equivalent experience Strong understanding of network architecture and IT security best practices Experience with Cybersecurity Strategy & Governance, Cyber threat intelligence operations, Security Architecture, Data Protection & Information Security, Third Party Risk Management, Regulatory compliance, Infrastructure Security, Vulnerability assessments & Penetration testing, Secure Software Development Lifecycle, End point protection, Logging and Monitoring, Incident Response, and Disaster Recovery Strong experience with incident response, vulnerability management, remediation plans, etc. Accreditation such as CISSP, CISM, CEH, OSCP and/or OSCE is preferred Experience developing and implementing company-wide IT Security policies Deep understanding of Regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, FFIEC, SOX, HIPAA, ISO 2700x, and NIST. standards Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively and tactfully with both business-oriented executives and technology-oriented colleagues Ability to negotiate compromise among business partners with competing priorities Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously that involve key stakeholders across a global and complex organization Pay Range $100,000-$125,000/year How to Apply Click the “Apply Now” button and follow the instructions to submit your resume. Please note that we only accept documents in MS Word or Rich Text formats. When referencing this job, quote #20726. You must currently reside within the Greater Toronto Area and be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity. A recruiter will be in touch with you if your profile meets our client’s requirements for this role. About Lannick Lannick is the premier professional recruitment and staffing firm in the Greater Toronto Area. Founded in 1985, Lannick provides best-in-class finance, accounting and technology professionals at all roles and levels through its three divisions: Lannick Finance & Accounting, Pro Count Staffing and Lannick Technology. Lannick places more than 1,000 candidates annually and is a preferred vendor for Canada’s most successful organizations. Learn more at www.lannick.com. Better jobs. Better people. Better fit.
Title: IT Cybersecurity Manager

Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.  We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.
Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager

Job_Description: About Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) is a division of BMO that combines Information Security, Information Management and Technology Risk into a comprehensive department. GITRM’s mandate is to provide sound governance and guidance on information and technology risk, as well as to provide critical services central to protecting the Bank against cyber threats. GITRM (Business) PMO is accountable to execute on these critical services and solutions while operating securely in an increasingly connected global environment. Description: The PMO Analyst is a Best Practice and Process Expert - training, project oversight, quality assurance and methodology development. Will also be a Knowledge Management Coordinator - project records, standards, methods, and lessons learned must be stored in our project database. The PMO Analyst will control documents, facilitate communication between the project office and stakeholders and collect data to meet reporting requirements. Key Accountabilities: Maintaining the PMO sharepoint site, library and archives and any associated online project knowledge management system capability, to ensure information is always accurate and current. Govern clarity PM data accuracy. Run monthly PM Data Governance and KRI dashboard reports. Track and Follow-up on any non-conformances. Run monthly spotfire dashboard reports for each of the portfolio review meetings with the appropriate leaders and their teams. Manage, Track and Follow-up on Action Items from these meetings Preparing project performance analyses for PMO and senior management review Maintain and Coordinate the PM Intake process, including the “capacity vs demand” reports Coordinates and schedules training classes to advance the skills and capabilities of project managers and educate employees about EPMO changes. Create PDU forms and track inventory Maintain, Coordinate and Deliver on-boarding, off-boarding and training to new PMs Coordinating scheduled routines such as monthly project audits, forecasts, time-sheet approvals Assist with the day-to-day operations of the PMO Provide information to PMO management to enable PM assignment and handle updates/ announcements, as required Develop specific views for Clarity Supplier report as necessary Research the various Spotfire visualizations for useful resourcing and forecasting views for PMO Management Upgrade and enhance PMO Database, ensuring audit, risk and compliance standards are met Manage and control documents, such as form templates, meeting minutes, reports, plans and schedules. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.  Technology Risk Management and Information Security (TRMIS) is a group of technology, security and risk professionals in Canada, the U.S. and the U.K., focused on managing a comprehensive program to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls.  The Cyber Threat Management Team is responsible for protecting the Bank, customers and employees by mitigating and identifying technology threats to TD. Development of effective risk management programs help ensure TD’s best-in-class cyber security approach.  What We Stand For The TRMIS program is continuously evolving to mitigate risks to the bank, including introducing new initiatives and improved defense. With a layered approach to protect customers, employees and the bank from cyber threats, TD manages, challenges and reviews technology controls for all business applications.   Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 9-5  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions  Job Category(s) Technology Solutions  Job Description Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform: Highly motivated, team-oriented, self-learner, responsible, and focused on exceeding expectations Strong organizational skills to facilitate management and tracking of large numbers of findings, requirements and changes, and activities Sense of urgency, resourcefulness and enthusiasm in adopting and implementing identified technical solutions Ability to apply accurate logic and common sense in data and problem analysis Ability to protect confidential information and act with a high level of integrity Knowledge in current and emerging technologies in the space of Information Security, particularly with Vulnerability and Configuration Management Demonstrates understanding of the processes necessary to execute an enterprise-wide control function Ability to understand requirements and execute processes related to configuring and operating solutions in compliance with corporate security standards High level of confidence and assertiveness in high-pressure situations Ability to build strong relationships with individual technical Subject Matter Experts from all areas of Technology Ability to quickly analyze large amounts of information and provide necessary feedback and synopsis to team leads or technical managers Excellent written and oral communications skills and ability to articulate and present information to all levels of technical staff and stakeholders  Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:  One to three years' work experience in information security, cyber security, data protection or a related field Minimum of a two-year degree in information protection, computer forensics, computer information systems, computer science, or information systems management 1+ years of experience in performing vulnerability management for all enterprise platforms Knowledge of risk-based vulnerability prioritization, reporting, and developing remediation steps Knowledge of developing and reviewing processes and run books for vulnerability identification, configuration violations identification, analysis, remediation, and reporting Experience with identifying and troubleshooting problems Experience with configuration & change management operational processes Must have solid understanding of Network and Security infrastructure, topology including firewalls, routers, wireless access points, DNS, DHCP, and Group Policy Knowledge of securing virtual, physical and cloud environments Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Qualys, HPSA, HPNA, IBM Guardium or equivalent vulnerability assessment tools Professional IT security certification such as CISSP, SANS Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), CompTIA Security+, CEH, GSEC and/or CISM is preferred An understanding of regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, FFIEC, SOX, HIPAA, ISO 2700x, NIST standards  Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing: Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside. Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  **Province/State (Primary) Ontario  City (Primary) Scarborough

Job_Description: Our Client, a major bank, is looking to add a Junior Business Analyst to support our client's Risk and Security department. This is a 5-month contract to start. Location – downtown Toronto, ON. As the Junior Business Analyst, your responsibilities will include but not be limited to: Support communication between the program and business partners Deliver, monitor, follow-up on user access information, analysis and proofs provided to business partners Provide regular updates on status of program and business partners of progress across multiple web applications Use analytics tools for analyzing large volumes of data Identify problematic areas and recommend changes to tools or practices to resolve ongoing issues noted Candidates to meet consideration will possess the following skills: Previous experience (1-3 years) as business analyst or experience in an audit capacity with banking/financial services industry Experience in Risk and Cyber security within banking environment will be considered as a very strong asset Must have experience communicating with multiple lines of business, including senior level and managers Expert knowledge in Excel (VBA and pivot tables), MS Access and PowerPoint Degree in Computer Science/IT/Business Administration, etc. Please send your resume in MS Word format to yulia@ifgpr.com today!
Title: Junior Business Analyst

Job_Description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.  Technology  The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.  Enterprise Technology & Risk (ETR) is comprised of five primary areas   Core Infrastructure (CI) manages the infrastructure technology solutions to support the Firm’s daily operations, enable our businesses to expand to new markets, offer new client products, and comply with evolving regulations.- End User Technology (EUT) delivers core communication, collaboration and productivity tools across the Firm, including desktop and mobile devices, remote computing solutions, and multimedia services. - Quality Assurance & Production Management (QAPM) provides production management, quality assurance, and end user services for Institutional Securities and Support Services. QAPM also manages the Enterprise Command Center, Enterprise Systems Management, and Technology Disaster Recovery services.- Technology & Information Risk (TIR) delivers first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology. TIR oversees programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to our clients, address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape, and meet regulatory expectations. - Technology Business Development (TechBD) manages the Firm’s strategic relationships with external technology companies.  Position Description: Morgan Stanley is looking for a talented individual to join a team of information security experts responsible for protecting Firm, client, and employee sensitive/confidential data. The Data Leakage team is responsible for implementing and managing the detection technologies and rulesets used to identify and prevent information security and insider threat incidents, supporting all Firm Business Units. In this role you will be responsible for understanding, developing and implementing enterprise wide Information Protection strategies that balance security and business requirements while protecting our brands, reputation, operating environment, and intellectual property. The Team coordinates with Cyber, Technology, Business Units, Legal, and Corporate Security to gather business requirements, assess risk, ensure adherence to local regulations, and assess resource availability across the teams impacted by the implementation of controls in the environment. This is a technical role and the selected candidate will be located in Montreal, working with a global team of IT Security professionals.  Responsibilities:  Determine and implement appropriate data leakage controls and policies, as well as the placement of such, to satisfy business and regulatory and audit requirements- Compile and validate statistical data to be used to determine the viability of implementing specific data leakage controls in the production environment- Assist in the ongoing review of data leakage controls, policies, and processes- Proactively assess safeguards across the tool suite to identify potential risks and perform trend analysis- Work with Incident Response teams to identify and enhance data leakage controls in response to incidents- Utilize Symantec DLP to generate and maintain email, endpoint and web monitoring policy- Support the administration and maintenance of existing data leakage controls and policies in response to changes in local regulation, organizational structure, or business needs  Skills Required:  5-7 years of experience in a similar role- Bachelor Degree in a related field- Experience in Incident Management, Information Security, and familiarity with data privacy matters- Ability to handle sensitive situations with discretion and maintain confidentiality- Very strong verbal and written English communications skills- Familiarity with sensitive data types/identifiers, classifications, etc.- Ability to understand drivers and priorities, with regard to business and regulatory requirements- Demonstrated analysis and problem-solving skills- Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPoint  Skills Desired:  Hands-on experience with data analytics tools such as Splunk or Qlikview- Flexible, highly driven, self-motivated, and able to collaborate effectively with multiple teams across the Firm and external vendors- Strategic thinker who is able to balance short and long term deliverables- Ability to work independently in a self-directed manner- Ability to multi-task with attention to detail  Knowledge of French and English are required.  Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.
Title: Insider Threat Data Analyst 3108000

Job_Description: The Opportunity - Security Engineer  FreshBooks has a big vision. We launched in 2003 but we’re just getting started and there’s a lot left to do. We're a high performing team working towards a common goal: building a world class online accounting application to help small businesses better manage their finances. Known for extraordinary customer service and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries.  In this newly created position, the Security Engineer will be hands-on and responsible for security monitoring, incident handling, security operations processes, threat management, documenting security policies and more. You’ll help your fellow engineers write better and more secure code. And you’ll ensure we’re always compliant with PCI-DSS and other best security practices.  We expect you to have:  A solid track record of experience in the security field as an Engineer, Developer, Specialist, or similar Strong Cloud Security and Security Architecture experience Strong experience as a Security subject matter expert Strong troubleshooting, reasoning, problem-solving, customer service, and communication skills  The more of the following you bring, the better:  A university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering or a relevant field Specific experience with Google Cloud Platform or similar (AWS, Azure) Experience with microservices and distributed systems Hands-on experience with cloud storage solutions Demonstrated knowledge of information technology security, trends, leading practices, regulatory and industry standard compliance issues (PCI-DSS and others) Experience performing threat modeling, offensive assessments, penetration testing, exploit development, or vulnerability analysis Working knowledge of common and industry standard cloud-native/cloud-friendly authentication/authorization mechanisms (OAuth, OpenID, SAML etc.) and key management/secret vaulting solutions, including HSM (Thales, Gemalto SafeNet etc.)  What you’ll do:  Be a trusted technical advisor and solve complex Cloud security technical challenges Coach internal teams (i.e. Software Development) on security disciplines and work closely with these teams to ensure that they’re writing secure code and designing secure systems. Enable teams to take ownership of secure code Collaborate with Software Engineering and Architecture teams on security strategy, roadmaps, standards, and governance Mentor the Product Development team ensuring adherence to security engineering best practices Ensure that we maintain PCI-DSS compliance and other certifications Audit and analyze production code for potential security concerns Identify and document information security risks and propose mitigating controls Provide analysis and guidance regarding threats, vulnerabilities, and privacy and security incidents Identify security gaps and recommend & facilitate the mitigation of the gaps in line with industry standards and best practices Build knowledge of and stay current on developments in the cyber threat landscape to adapt investigation techniques and provide recommendations on responding to and remediating related incidents Actively detect, respond to, and remediate security events across our global infrastructure.  What we offer:  Competitive salary, health benefits from day 1 and extra days off (office is closed between Christmas and New Year’s) RRSP matching program and generous parental leave policy Weekly catered lunches, beer, and snacks Team and company offsites, hackoffs, and paid community volunteer days and religious observance days Professional development opportunities and flexible work schedules Office gym with showers and complimentary towel service Secure, indoor bike parking with well-stocked repair bay Ping Pong, Foosball, Massage Chairs, Nintendo Stations and more. Dog friendly office TTC & GO Accessible  Sure, there are perks, but the real reason people are proud to work at FreshBooks is because each person knows their opinion is respected, and they can see the difference they make in the lives of over 10 million small business owners around the world. If you want to accelerate your career, work on projects you're passionate about and have just as much of a life outside the office as inside—you're exactly what we're looking for.  We value our people...  We recognize and reward ingenious work. We all have real lives, and respect work lifestyle balance. We all have a voice that is heard throughout the company. We always make time for fun, and have one of the most unique, employee-led cultures out there. Join the FreshBooks choir or a class in the gym, organize a gaming night, teach a dev lunch and learn, or use a paid volunteer day to share your skills with the community. Salaries are competitive and compensation packages include a stake in the company. Interested? Let’s get started!  FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com.
Title: Security Engineer

Job_Description: National Defence - Assistant Deputy Minister (Science & Technology)  Suffield (Alberta), Ottawa (Ontario), Valcartier (Québec)  CS-01 - Information Technologies, CS-02 - Information Technologies, CS-03 - Information Technologies, DS-03 - Research, DS-04 - Research, EN-ENG-03 - Engineering, EN-ENG-04 - Engineering  $53,611 to $113,652 (Rates of pay are under review - Click on the link "Rates of Pay" below for more information) Defence Research and Development Canada - Website LinkedIn Twitter The salary rate is determined by the group and level of the position to fill (DS, CS, EN-ENG) Rates of Pay Closing date: N/A Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad. Apply online Important messages When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. This means that the qualifications, operational requirements and conditions of employment MAY vary depending on the positions to be filled.  As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications of this advertisement may be contacted for further assessment. Applicants selected for the next step will be informed of the additional qualifications for the position to be filled. The Government of Canada is committed to building a skilled workforce that is representative of Canada's diversity, which includes the recruitment of Canadian Veterans and releasing Canadian Armed Forces personnel: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/gc-jobs/canadian-armed-forces-members-veterans.html Work environment Do you want to join a dedicated team of experts that contribute to the defence, safety and security of Canadians?  Whether you’re conducting research, developing a new technology or working to improve the organization – your efforts at Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) will contribute to innovations that increase the safety and effectiveness of the Canadian Armed Forces as well as the defence, public safety and security of Canada and its international allies.  You can be certain that the work you do at DRDC matters. Join our team to make an impact. Intent of the process The purpose of this inventory is to identify potential candidates to fill positions on a term or indeterminate basis within Defense Research and Development Canada in Ottawa (Ontario), Valcartier (Québec) or Suffield (Alberta).  This inventory could be used to fill positions with various tenures, security clearance requirements or linguistic requirements. Positions to be filled: Number to be determined Information you must provide Your résumé.  A covering letter in 1,500 words (maximum) "Your cover letter will be read in conjunction with your curriculum vitae to determine if you meet the education and experience requirements of this inventory. Make sure to include all relevant information in your application to assess the depth and breadth of your experience in the field mentioned since the selection committee may restrict its assessment to those documents."  You must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. Other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. Some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. It is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. Failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.  In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications) EDUCATION  Information Technology (CS): Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or another specialty relevant to the position to be staffed.Research (DS): Graduation with a master's degree with specialization from a recognized post-secondary institution with specialization in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or some other specialty relevant to the position.DS positions also require acceptable experience related to the position to be filled.Engineering (EN-ENG): Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary in electrical engineering, aeronautical engineering, systems engineering, computer engineering or some other engineering specialty relevant to the duties of the position. Degree equivalency EXPERIENCE *  Experience ** in one or many of those fields of expertise:Radar Electronic WarfareNavigation Electronic WarfareCyber Security and/or Cyber OperationsSignals WarfareRadar SensingRadar ExploitationSpace systemsIntelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) SystemsProject managementScience and Technology Project ManagementProgrammingProgramming algorithmsInformation Systems and/or Software developmentNetwork and/or systems administrationOptronic systems developmentWeapon and force protection systemsNuclear physicsParticle physicsMedical physicsRadiochemistryRadiation detectionRadiation transportNuclear engineering The resume and the covering letter will be used as a source of information for a first screening of candidates. Make sure to include all relevant information in your application with respect to the above mentioned experiences. ** These qualifications will be assessed based on the breadth and depth required for the position to staff. If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications) EDUCATION  Graduation with a master's or doctoral degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with specialization in engineering, chemistry, physics, computer sciences, mathematics or some other specialty relevant to the position. Degree equivalency OCCUPATIONAL CERTIFICATION  Engineering (EN-ENG): Eligibility for certification as a professional engineer in Canada with specialization in an engineering specialty relevant to the position.Engineering (EN-ENG): Certification of a recognized organization in project management such as Project Management Institute (PMI). The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job) Various language requirements Information on language requirements COMPETENCIES  Research managementTeamworkPartneringInitiativeCreativityCommunication The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job) EXPERIENCE  Experience working in the Canadian Armed Forces or the Department of National Defence;Experience working in a Science and Technology environment;Experience in publishing in scientific literature. The resume and the covering letter will be used as a source of information for a first screening of candidates. Make sure to include all relevant information in your application with respect to the above mentioned experiences. ** These qualifications will be assessed based on the breadth and depth required for the position to staff. COMPETENCY  Continuous professional learning ORGANIZATIONAL NEED:  Increase Employment Equity representation through the recruitment of Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, women and visible minorities Other information The client organization will accept applications on-line only.An interview, a test or a reference checks may be done.You must provide proof of your education credentials.Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.If you need an accommodation during this process, please let us know as soon as possible so that appropriate action can be taken.A random and/or top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process. The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.  The Public Service of Canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the Public Service Commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. Preference Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order.  Information on the preference to veterans
