Advanced knowledge of Active Directory with Group Policies Advanced understanding of Microsoft Office product suiteStrong automation/scripting skills. Broad range of application, network, desktop, and mobile device knowledge is highly desirable Experience with Public Key Infrastructure certificate managementAbility to convey complex technical information in a clear and concise manner Ability to work independently or in a team, set priorities and meet deadlines on multiple simultaneous projects and tasks Strong organization skills, excellent documentation skills. Excellent analytical and diagnostic problem solving skills with the ability of providing solutions to problems that are identified.
Title: VMware Horizon Consultant

Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.  We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.
Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.  Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 9-5 Monday to Friday  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions  Job Category(s) Technology Solutions  Job Description Job Description Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of the qualities we are looking for: Highly motivated, team-oriented, self-learner, responsible, and focused on exceeding expectations Strong organizational skills to facilitate management and tracking of large numbers of findings, requirements and changes, and activities Sense of urgency, resourcefulness and enthusiasm in adopting and implementing identified technical solutions Ability to apply accurate logic and common sense in data and problem analysis Ability to protect confidential information and act with a high level of integrity Knowledge in current and emerging technologies in the space of Information Security, particularly within Security Compliance and DLP Demonstrates understanding of the processes necessary to execute an enterprise-wide control function Ability to understand requirements and execute processes related to security compliance monitoring with corporate security standards High level of confidence and assertiveness in high-pressure situations Ability to build strong relationships with individual technical Subject Matter Experts from all areas of Technology Ability to quickly analyze large amounts of information and provide necessary feedback and synopsis to team leads or technical managers Excellent written and oral communications skills and ability to articulate and present information to all levels of technical staff and stakeholders  Job Requirements Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: One to three years' work experience in information security, cyber security, data protection or a related field Minimum of a two-year diploma in information technology, computer information systems, or information systems management 1+ years of experience in executing a set of processes for monitoring the effectiveness of security controls for the organization Operating processes to validate interpretation of security events from various sources to determine compliance against internal policies and regulatory standards Knowledge of understanding and reviewing processes and procedures related to security logging and monitoring, DLP, analysis, remediation, and reporting Experience with change management operational processes Must have working knowledge of various server operating platforms such as Windows, Linux, etc. Should have a basic understanding of various infrastructure components such as firewalls, routers, switches, servers, etc. Experience with one or more of the following technologies: HPNA, IBM Guardium, RSA Security Analytics, McAfee DLP or equivalent tools is desirable Professional IT security certification such as CompTIA Security+, SSCP, etc. are preferred An understanding of regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, SOX, ISO 2700x, NIST standards  Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing: Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside. Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  **Province/State (Primary) Ontario  City (Primary) Scarborough
Title: Information Security Analyst Compliance Reporting

Job_Description: Incident Responses Analyst  Position Summary:  As an Incident Response Analyst at Equifax, you will provide incident response and analytic capabilities to an enterprise wide cybersecurity program. The Incident Response Analyst will possess technical knowledge and experience performing incident response, threat hunting, network and system monitoring, malware analysis, and has performed cyber incident related digital forensics. The position will include a robust assortment of security projects that support the Global Security team.  Additional responsibilities of the Incident Response Analyst include: Provide tiered technical resolution for security incidents and SOC service requests with an emphasis on Tier 3 and greater Conduct host and network analysis, forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations Recognize and collect attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations Build scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance incident investigation processes Effectively communicate investigative findings and strategy to stakeholders including technical staff, executive leadership, and legal counsel Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans in response to incidents Perform analysis of complex datasets to produce relevant intelligence products Support internal investigations and identify security gaps and strategies Leverages ability to identify new attack TTPs and recommend mitigation techniques Will use disparate data sources and evidence to detect and decipher abnormalities in various log formats, with a primary focus on the internal threat landscape Ability to follow established processes and to improve as needed  Required skills of the Incident Response Analyst include: 5+ years' general information security experience 3+ years' experience in a Security Incident Response role Knowledge of tools used for network security (DLP, NIPS, HIPS, AV, Firewalls, etc.) Mastery of *nix and Windows operating system functionality Proficient in the use of the varied and diverse log analysis and forensic tools Thorough understanding of network protocols Strong research, analytic, writing and briefing skills Ability to effectively manage multiple, concurrent activities, while understanding and managing priorities, dependencies and risk Expert capabilities to research, create, develop and deliver professional briefings, multimedia presentations, and written reports to both operational and senior leadership levels Ability to work independently, as well as mentoring other team members Ability to work or be on-call during off hours Demonstrated flexibility, initiative, judgment and discretion English language proficiency Willingness to learn new tools and processes and proven track record of learning new technologies, methodologies, and skills Organizational, time management, customer service and problem-solving skills  Education: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) required Post-graduate degree preferred Certifications such as GIAC (GCIA, GCIH, GSEC, GCFA, GCFE, etc.), CISSP, CEH or related certification(s) desired  What exactly does Equifax do?  Equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. The company organizes, assimilates and analyses data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers.  Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our people makes a difference in our business. Equifax offers a performance-driven culture that rewards results and encourages growth and development. Many expect us to be a serious workforce, and we are - we're serious about continuing to grow our business, serious about working together as one team, and serious about continuously building a strong, engaged workplace that embraces integrity and change as much as it does fun, camaraderie and philanthropy.  Some noteworthy achievements for the company include: Named to the Top 100 American Banker FinTech Forward list (2015-2016); named a Top Technology Provider on the FinTech 100 list (2004-2016); named an InformationWeek Elite 100 Winner (2014-2015); named a Top Workplace by Atlanta Journal Constitution (2013-2017); named one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies (2011-2015); named one of Forbes' World's 100 Most Innovative Companies (2015-2017). For more information, visit www.equifax.com .  Primary Location: CAN-Toronto-5700 Yonge  CAN-Anjou, CAN-Toronto-33-Bloor  Function: Function - Security Governance and Compliance  Schedule: Full time

Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com. Job_Description: The Corporate General Counsel will have an integrated role, working across the company to provide legal expertise, risk management and regulatory governance. As the Counsel looks to increase and maintain the company’s reputation, s/he will ensure compliance, legal conformity and diminished probability of exposure. Success in this role will be determined by a direct and tangible impact on steering business success while guaranteeing the company follows strict guidelines and protocols. Our client is looking for an entrepreneurial, inquisitive and analytical Lawyer to join the team as a critical member in meeting negotiations, setting best practices and crafting the legal requirements to meet our strategic business goals. Expectations of this role are to build out the legal function from creating a legal framework to drafting/creating documents, refining existing documents and policies to negotiating on behalf of our client with all stakeholders to protect our client’s interests and reduce exposure. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Provide accurate and timely legal counsel to management on a variety of topics such as but not limited to contract law, IP, non-competition, trademarks, board governance, cyber security, privacy law etc.; Draft, review, and negotiate on behalf of our client with external stakeholders on a variety of topics. Develop policies to administer the company’s corporate legal affairs and bridge gaps in existing policies; Devise risk management and effective regulatory compliance strategies; Interpret and ensure compliance with privacy legislation, alerting the Executive team and management of regulatory changes or new legislation; Communicate legal risks to business partners related to negotiated provisions in contracts; Create programs to ensure management executes on Service Level agreements and delivery obligations to customers; Research and evaluate different risk factors regarding business decisions and operations; Research unique legal issues impacting the organization by identifying applicable statutes, judicial decisions, and codes; Review Statement of Works (SOWs), and assist in reviewing and writing RFI / RFPs; Provide advice and participate in Due Diligence in joint ventures, strategic partnership deals, and mergers and/or acquisitions; Explain legal language and advise executives on business terms of various deals; Provide advice and guidance on advertising and marketing materials to ensure compliance with legal requirements; Provide advice and guidance on Human Resources issues and requirements in Canada, the USA and globally.  Requirements:  Law degree from an accredited Canadian or American law school; Minimum 5 years’ experience at a top tier firm or in-house experience; Called to the bar in a Province of Canada; Member in good standing to practice law; At least 4 years’ prior experience as in-house legal counsel on creating, drafting legal contracts, terms and conditions, SOWs, MSAs etc to protect the legal interests and reducing the liability for organizations related to such matters as anti-competition, intellectual property, privacy law, corporate law, employment law, CASL and general contract matters; Knowledge of regulatory policies across multiple jurisdictions to assess potential business impact and opportunities; Ability to provide training to management/executives and its affiliates on substantive legal topics; Deep experience in business law, familiarity with regulatory reporting within a technology field Expert knowledge of corporate and contract law, and exposure to IT/IP law; Must be proficient in drafting and solidifying agreements, contracts and other legal documents; Strong negotiator and has led/facilitated multiple commercial negotiations; Boundless professionalism and a capacity to multitask and manage time effectively using prioritization; Conduct work with integrity and responsibility; High degree of professional ethics and integrity; Ability to work well on your own but enjoy participating in a dynamic and fast-paced team environment; Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work across the organization and lead cross- functional teams; Strong communication skills to communicate complex and/or controversial topics and concepts to a wide and diverse audience both internally and externally; Exceptional organizational abilities, prioritization techniques; Innovative and resourceful with a strong sense of corporate awareness.
Title: General Legal Counsel

Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Vaughan, Ontario, Canada All Available Locations: Vaughan  External Posting Description  Position overview: Reporting to the SOC Engineering manager, the Managed Security Solutions Specialist is self-motivated, energetic, driven for success and results oriented. Your knowledge of technical controls, service management, professional services and the firm will help you to support delivery and execution of managed security services offered by Deloitte. The Specialist will also be a key player and part of a team providing world-class security operations capabilities for our clients and a capability aligned with our strategic direction and that helps the firm better deliver on new and existing engagements. Our network of Cyber Intelligence Centres in Canada are located in Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver. We are recruiting in each of our Toronto Operations Centre. Occasional travel to local clients may be required and there are also opportunities for travel nationally and globally if the candidate is interested. The Specialist will participate in an after-hours 24x7 On-Call rotation as required. Ability to obtain Government of Canada "Secret" security clearance is required.  Responsibilities: Service Design, Transition, and Operation of the Deloitte Cyber Intelligence Center’s Managed Security Solutions offering. As a multi-tenant provider, our customer platforms include, but are not limited to: Firewall Network IDS/IPS Network Access Control (NAC) Web Proxy Endpoint Security Email Security Operations Support the client as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for steady-state managed solutions Fulfill service requests for the range of supported technologies: Intake, plan, and deliver client deliverables such as configuration changes, information requests, and/or technical expertise  Incident Response: Identify, investigate and resolve service outage or degradation of a managed security solution, and if required, engage and support the client and service providers Maintain current knowledge database through technical documentation and knowledge transfer sessions Tune, maintain, and report upon system/network event monitoring platforms  Lifecycle management: Plan, schedule and execute version updates to managed security solutions Identify versions of solutions approaching end of life and plan replacement solution Service offering growth Collaborate with other SOC functional teams to transition service design changes of client environments into operations Assist with capacity management process Research and evaluate technical solutions Driving business requirements into technical requirements Support RFP process Identify incident trends, investigate and diagnose problems, propose and lead the implementation of technical and functional environment improvements Identify sales opportunities with the objective of maturing client security posture  Professional Attributes: Excellent written and oral communication skills including both technical and business writing, documentation and presentation skills Strong project management skills Strong analytical and Job_Description: SUBNET Solutions Inc. is a global software solutions provider for electrical utilities. SUBNET focuses on Making Power Grids More Intelligent®. Founded in 1992, SUBNET is an industry leader providing intelligent solutions that securely connect real time electrical utility field information with utility business systems to enable Smart Grid solutions. Over 200 utilities worldwide rely on SUBNET software to safely manage and monitor thousands of substations. SUBNET is a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and a Cisco Developer Network Connected Energy Partner. SUBNET is growing and is looking for a career driven professional for our Chief Cyber Security Architect position. The location of this position is negotiable. Job Summary:  The Chief Cyber Security Architect is a strategic member of the Business Development Team and provides the cyber security oversight required for driving both business direction and new product development. The Chief Cyber Security Architect stays engaged within the industry to understand latest cyber security trends and technologies. They are the liaison between the industry and the internal SUBNET teams for this information. The Chief Cyber Security Architect reviews engineering proposals to ensure they follow sound cyber security practices. SUBNET takes a pro-active approach to Cyber Security. We want to make an impact, not just follow the lead. The Chief Cyber Security Architect reports to the Chief Operating Officer. Responsibilities:  This position is responsible for: Maintaining a high level of expertise in industry trends and technologies related to cyber security. Authoring industry-specific whitepapers and case studies. Presenting authored works at tradeshows and conferences. Leading special projects or investigations that have high cyber security visibility. Assessing customer issues. Determining solution gaps to problems and providing proposals of solutions. Contributing to product specifications, requirements, and literature. Qualifications:  The ideal candidate will have the following: Degree/Diploma in Electrical, Computer or Software Engineering, or Computing Sciences from an accredited college or university. At least five years of work experience in the field of Cyber Security, SCADA, automation, and system integration. Able to work and travel to the United States on business. Willing to travel internationally. Expert knowledge of cyber security trends, technologies, and their applicability to the utility industry. Experience with SCADA communications, automation, and system integration. Experience with Microsoft desktop, embedded, and network environments. Excellent organization, time management, and interpersonal skills. Understanding of business environments and terminologies. Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions. Detail-oriented with a strong customer service focus. Advanced problem solving skills and the ability to work with innovative solutions. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent presentation skills. The following is considered as asset: Proficient in additional languages. Professional Engineer license. More than one language spoken or written considered a terrific asset. Compensation & Benefits: Compensation: Negotiable, Full-time Salaried Benefits: Full benefits including disability, life insurance, medical, dental and vision for employees and their families. Flex days in addition to vacation. Education reimbursement program. Employee Personal Spending Account. Employee/Employer Matching GRSP Program. How to Apply: By email: jobs@SUBNET.com
Title: Chief Cyber Security Architect

Job_Description: Position Title: Mandiant Consulting Intern - Strategic Security Advisor – Co-Op Location: Toronto, Canada  The Company: FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 5,600 customers across 67 countries, including more than 40 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.  The Role: Mandiant Security Consulting Services ensures the long-term success of our clients by providing talented, passionate, and specialized cybersecurity management consulting expertise. We are looking for motivated consultants with strong customer service skills to help our clients assess, design and build their own advanced threat detection capability and help to continually improve our own program methodology. The successful candidate will possess strong consulting skills and in-depth experience in security event monitoring, cyber threat intelligence, and/or computer incident response.  Responsibilities: Provide guidance on building and/or maturing information security programs, detecting and responding to computer security incidents, and implementation of tools and technologies used for enterprise security Evaluate client needs, coordinate design for a solution, and clearly communicate the value proposition of complex and highly technical subjects Implement and/or assess existing security controls Provide expert level knowledge of tools and technologies used for enterprise security Interface with clients to address concerns, issues or escalations; track and drive to closure any issues that impact the service and its value to clients Recognize and codify attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations Build internal scripts, tools and methodologies to enhance our capabilities Requirements: Ability to effectively interface with clients and manage expectations Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner Understanding of security controls for common platforms and devices, including Windows, Unix, Linux, and network equipment Some experience with the critical tools used in security event analysis, incident response, computer forensics, malware analysis, or other areas of security operations. Good understanding of cyber security operations, event monitoring, and SIEM tools Fundamental understanding of network protocols Familiarity with Unix and Windows operating systems and administrative tools Proven ability and understanding of the components that comprise a successful information security program Experience with programming/scripting languages such as Python Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship  FireEye is an Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Understanding that every client’s security journey is unique, we focus on bringing an individualized and tailored advisory approach to our clientele. Through the development and cultivation of trusted advisor relationships, our goal to help clients understand, define and mature their security programs by leveraging our experience and expertise. In addition, the Office of the CISO also harnesses the team’s collective depth and breadth to give back to the information security community through thought leadership and networking opportunities. Ideal candidates for this role will have functioned as a security leader (CISO, VP or Director of Security) or executive security consultant and possess an executive mindset with a firm grasp of the technical components surrounding the information security and risk management landscape. Candidates should also have excellent presenter skills with the ability to convey complex information security concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences and the capacity to influence and help security executives through the maturation of their organization’s security posture. This is a remote position. Qualifications  Executive Advisory Operate as trusted advisor to increase Optiv’s presence at the security executive level for marquee and enterprise accounts Assist client security executives in the planning, creation and execution of their security strategies Liaison between the client and Optiv Sales and Services delivery organizations Initiate and engage other Optiv subject matter experts in support of client’s needs and questions Services Engagement Provide billable executive sponsorship and delivery for various client-facing projects: Security strategy assessments Risk management or compliance initiatives Programmatic security operations (primarily plan and build phases) Collaborate with Practice thought leaders on the development of new services/offerings Sales and Marketing Alignment Align with Sales team strategies and support them in closing and exceeding their sales quotas Drive services revenue and sales quota achievement through client-facing business development activities Describe Services offerings in detail, understand pricing models, reference accounts, past engagements and demonstrate offering differentiators and value. Identify pre-engagement requirements (goals, budgeting, timing, etc.), assist with technical scoping, project pricing and proposal development Lead internal and client-facing account management strategy and planning sessions and formal proposal presentations Leverage personal network to increase exposure for Optiv and help drive additional opportunities and revenue Assist sales teams in understanding CISO personas, current issues/trends and how to better position and sell security solutions at security executive levels Provide customer feedback and observations to sales, marketing, and product groups Community Engagement Create and publish thought leadership content (magazine articles, blogs, presentations, etc.) in support of security executive interests, missions and other relevant topics Host customer/prospect roundtable events in region Speak at and attend security conferences Perform other duties and projects as assigned REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience Minimum of 7 years of experience: Functioning as an information security or risk management executive or thought leader in a large enterprise environment -OR- Functioning as a high-performing consultant focused on security strategy advisory to the security executive suite Passion about security and building relationships Strong knowledge of security strategy and risk management Strong knowledge of cyber threat landscape and hacker tactics Experience conducting research on security topics Excellent verbal and written communication and ability to conduct presentations to technical and non-technical groups MUST HAVE: Valid Driver’s License Ability to work greater than 40 hours per week as needed Ability to travel at least 50 percent within assigned region High School Diploma or Equivalent Experience DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS Prior experience in a security executive role (CISO, VP, Director, etc.) Vertical specific expertise as it relates to information security, risk management or compliance Prior recognition as a published writer in the Information Security space Demonstrated sales skills and achievement of quota driven results Job_Description: KeySource Thomas Thor has been engaged by Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) to fill the Cyber Security Scientist position at their Fredericton location in the Canadian province of New Brunswick (NB). The Cyber Security Scientist will contribute to CNL’s cyber security research team. CNL is Canada’s premier nuclear science and technology organization, serving Canada as an enabler of business innovation and technology transfer. While viewed as a world leader in developing peaceful and innovative applications from nuclear technology through its expertise in physics, metallurgy, chemistry, biology, and engineering, CNL is committed to ensuring that Canadians and the world receive energy, health, and environmental benefits from nuclear science and technology.Role DescriptionCNL’s cyber security research team conducts leading edge research in cyber security of instrumentation and control systems in the nuclear industry. Digital security concerns and evolving standards and regulations are driving demand for safe and secure solutions by both business and industrial consumers. Unlike IT systems, industrial control systems are often bound by strict regulatory requirements and rigorous change controls that introduce complexities, risks and cost that are substantially higher for any modernization or modification and therefore requires specialists in Instrumentation & Control (I&C;) systems with cyber security expertise.ResponsibilitiesCNL is looking for a Senior Cyber Security Research Scientist/Engineer to perform the following duties:Take a lead role in building complex software systems. Supervise large groups of engineering and technical staff in highly technical applications, with responsibility for motivating and guiding the team and their technical output.Identify new opportunities as a result of investigations and lead R&D; activities to exploit new and existing prospects. Organize, manage, propose, and lead projects and experiments that address people, process and security risks in the cyber domain.Manage the development of a cyber-test facility comprising simulated process control, segmented networks modelling different security zones, and various cyber and physical security products.Propose new cyber security techniques and technologies and design, develop, test and validate these new capabilities with the goal of developing practical and innovative cyber security solutions for industrial control applications.Provide leadership for developing and applying engineering rigor, defining and following standards, and provide insight in such areas.Provide presentations to stakeholders and contribute to internal reports, presentations, and technical refereed journal publications.Other duties as required.QualificationsUndergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Applied Mathematics from a university of recognized standing, or membership in an engineering or scientificprofessional organization authorized by statute to establish qualification for membership in that organization. Higher education (MSc, and/or PhD) is an asset.Have 15+ years of experience in I&C; systems technology, or information security/cyber security technology. It is recognized that supporting IT systems versus OT systems involve different skill sets and that candidates will likely be more experienced in one area than another. Experience in both disciplines is an asset, or a demonstrated ability to learn quickly, have strong self-motivation and enthusiasm for the work, attention to detail and good organization skills.Proven leadership experience leading engineering and technical staff.Strong technical problem-solving skills, ability to make recommendations on technical issues, and prepare work plans with minimal supervision.Expert knowledge and/or experience with cyber security technologies (e.g., intrusion detection systems, forensic analysis tools, next generation firewalls, application control, whitelisting, AV, encryption, automated auditing, analytics), and advanced persistence threats, zero-day exploits, malware attack vectors and threat intelligence.History of working carefully and accurately, with passionate commitment to quality and meeting customer expectationsExtensive practical knowledge and hands-on experience with computer programming and hardware. Expertise of particular interest include:Programming/scripting languages (e.g., C, C++, C#, Java, Python, Perl)Computing technologies (e.g., VMWare, Hyper-V HyperVisors, SIEMs, switch and firewall configurations),Operating Systems (e.g., QNX, Linux, Windows, Windows Server) and Kernel-level programming,Communications Protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP, SSL), andInstrumentation and Control expertise (e.g., PLC’s, DCS, MODBUS, Profibus, OPC) is desired.Ability to think abstractly and deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems and various types of clients and customers.Ability to handle software and hardware problems; devise new approaches, apply existing criteria in new manners, and draw complex conclusions.Can very effectively articulate novel ideas, concepts, and proposals for new projects and ongoing work.Experience and willingness to mentor junior developers and engineers.Contact Information: KeySource Thomas Thor has been exclusively retained to conduct this search. All information exchanged and related to this role is considered proprietary and will be managed through:Ruth SteelSenior Nuclear ConsultantJob Type: Full-timeExperience:I&C; systems technology or cyber security technology: 10 yearsEducation:Doctorate
Title: Cyber Security Scientist

Job_Description: The Technical Content Developer reports in to the BeyondTrust University team, and will be responsible for creating technical courseware with hands-on Lab exercises on BeyondTrust Security products, for delivery via Self-Paced, Virtual and Instructor Led Training.  What is Required?   Design and develop course content including but not limited to measurable learning objectives, scenarios, simulations, audio scripts, performance evaluations, reference glossaries, and knowledge assessments Utilize ADDIE, Kirkpatrick and other recognized models to rapidly design, develop and publish engaging course content and learning activities for ILT, Self-Paced and virtual modalities with continuous evaluation/improvement cycles Adapt instructional materials created for one delivery format to another format (usually from face-to-face to eLearning and virtual) Demonstrate technical aptitude and experience via education delivery Ability to deliver instructor-led (classroom and remote) synchronous training ranging from foundational administrative tasks and concepts to advanced implementation topics Become conversant at a technical level with BeyondTrust products and become a subject matter expert, including achieving and maintaining certification on all BeyondTrust products. Keep current on new products, industry trends, and customers training needs. Collaborate with peers and the Product Development to develop and maintain courseware to meet customer requirements. Collaborate on cloud-based lab environment design and maintenance Work with engineers and product managers to understand how the product features are designed and implemented  What is Required?   Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Learning and Development, Communication, or related field Working knowledge of the ADDIE or FKA instructional design methodologies. Experience in an instructional design or technical writer role. Experience designing and developing ILT/eLearning materials (Note: A work sample will be requested as part of the hiring process) Possess the knowledge of or skills needed to setup the classroom environment for training purposes. Experience explaining complex topics to a range of learner levels - novice to advanced. Experience using multiple learning methods and linking appropriate methods with learners and outcomes. Experience developing test questions for certification/accreditation programs would be a plus. Familiarity with adult learning theories. 3-5 years’ experience in developing Technical Training. Good understanding of Windows, Networking and Security technologies. Mac & Unix a plus. Excellent written and verbal presentation skills are required. Passion for technology with hands-on experience in IT infrastructure and network management technologies Demonstrated self-motivation and self-discipline to work effectively in a high-paced environment  What isn’t required but would be AWESOME?   Experience in the cyber security space Ability to write scripts and simple programs The words “home lab” are a conversation starter for you You run your own Linux servers in your home lab You run your home lab on ESX
Title: Training Content Developer

Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager, Infrastructure and Support, this position provides technical support for a 800 person Network and Telephony infrastructure. Working with IT support teams, the position provides technical leadership and consulting across the organization, assists with strategic decision making and project planning. MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES: Support VoIP infrastructure and its associated software, including Microsoft Skype for Business, voice mail, call centers, and interactive voice response. Assist Server Administrator in managing the organizations servers and Microsoft Exchange infrastructure. Where necessary, plan for management or phasing out of legacy telephony systems and other associated technologies. Install, upgrade, manage, support, and troubleshoot Skype for Business and Telax contact center. Install, upgrade, manage, support, and troubleshoot applications used to support Skype Unified Communications products including management applications. Installs/moves/deletes/changes/troubleshoots end-user's telephones and mailboxes for contact center according to agency/department guidelines. Manages, acquires and deploys corporate smartphones, MiFi, and other telecommunication devices in accordance with the organizations policy. Monitors the usage of all telecommunication devices and maintains plans accordingly Install, upgrade, manage, support, and troubleshoot third party gateways used for SIP and Megalink integration. Integrate systems with Skype Unified Communication products, Telax, paging systems, Polycom audio and video conferencing systems and associated gateways. Troubleshoot network issues impacting the operation and performance of telecommunication systems Create and modify Telax Contact Center for multiple telephone systems Integrate IP telephony systems with enterprise LANs and other Internet-based services and protocols. Provide leadership for implementing new VoIP products or services, as well as defining technical resources required to manage them. Collaborate with service desk to resolve trouble tickets and mitigate end-user issues with VoIP hardware and/or applications. Assist with the installation planning and maintenance of network cabling. Comply with cyber security best practices and perform telephony audits as necessary. Train and mentor technicians, operations and service desk personnel. Monitor and identify capacity and performance issues for VoIP traffic to ensure continued, uninterrupted operation of telephony systems. Conduct testing and develop disaster recovery plans to detect faults, minimize malfunctions, and back up systems. Develop and document procedures for the delivery of telecommunication services. Create and maintain as-built documents and diagrams Coordinate billing and service contracts with local exchange carriers and WAN service providers. Timely processing of monthly telecommunication\network service invoices and resolve billing discrepancies. Maintain work areas to support a clean and safe environment Manages mobile device systems such as Airwatch MDM and Blackberry MDM. Prepares and reviews system documentation for accuracy and updates as well as develops training materials to assist staff and for branch trainers' conducting user training. Conducts classroom training, if necessary. Assists management and committees in developing voice and office automation communications policy/guidelines. QUALIFICATIONS: Education and Experience A University or Technical School degree/diploma in Computer Science or Information Systems, Electronics or a related discipline. Microsoft Telecom Certification (Skype/Lync) or Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) 3+ years of working experience in the telecommunications/phone systems in Skype or Lync 5+ years of Microsoft Active Directory Previous experience working with VoIP systems or similar preferred Experience with Microsoft Lync room systems or Polycom video conferencing systems preferred Experience integrating Skype for Business or Lync Assets: Experience working with Telax contact center solutions, an asset
Title: Telephony/ Systems Administrator

Job_Description: Why join Irdeto? We are on a mission! A mission to secure the world’s digital platforms. Why? Because a secure platform allows our clients to produce and deliver great content. In return, you can enjoy the latest blockbuster movies and your favorite live events at all times. It doesn’t stop at the media industry. Our security technology is securing connected cars, applications and devices and mobile payments, just to name a few. We are innovative, international and part of Naspers, one of the largest technology investors in the world. Cybersecurity Services Market Unit The mission of the cybersecurity services team is to secure the most valuable media assets and devices. We do so by building, delivering and supporting products and managed services to our global customer base of leading media companies like Hollywood studios, broadcasters and sports rights owners. We have the most advanced security consulting and anti-piracy teams in the industry. With access to the latest tools, subject-matter experts and technology, we are a market driven, and innovative team that values creativity, hard work and the delivery of quality results for our customers. You, the Software Developer in Tracemark Cloud Services, will be joining our Cyber Security Market Unit, to help with creating and maintaining products that provide services surrounding watermarked video content. What you will spend your days doing: Working with a tight-knit team in defining product architecture along with designing, implementing and maintaining new features Developing and deploying products in various cloud environments Working in an agile fashion Videoconferencing, so you can see your globally dispersed team. You will work in cross functional teams that include professional services and technical operations as part of end to end product delivery and troubleshooting  Experience you bring: Hands-on experience with cloud environments: AWS, Google Cloud and/or Azure Hands-on experience with video technologies: Adaptive Video Delivery (such as HLS, DASH), Media Containers Formats (such as MP4, TS) Video Codecs (such as FFmpeg) Knowledge of video workflows is also a plus Experience developing with C/C++, Node.JS and/or Python Familiarity with continuous integration processes  Things are nice to have: Experience with React, Mocha, Jmeter, Git, GitlabCI/Jenkins, CI, CD, YAML, Docker, Kubernetes Understanding and having worked in agile/scrum Experience with Ansible or CloudFormation Experience with AWS hosted services, including SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience in networking and network security – routing, firewalls, load balancing, DNS  Required Education and Experience: Minimum 5 years experience in a software development role. Bachelor’s degree of Computer Science or related technical degree or equivalent experience Ability to work in a fast changing, highly dynamic, geographically dispersed environment  Not a perfect match for the role? Experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable and passion goes a long way when we are looking at fit. Diversity is what makes Irdeto great. If your experience is close to what we are looking for, we highly encourage you to apply.  What do we offer you? At Irdeto, we know that it is the people who make our company a success. We encourage personal and professional growth and success among our globally diverse workforce by offering: Competitive remuneration and benefits Career and personal development opportunities Flexible working spaces in state of the art offices A focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness Working for a truly global company with offices in 15+ countries With nearly 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, Irdeto is a solid company to join. We are looking for people who are energetic, dynamic and driven to be part of our community. Irdeto welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Welcome to Irdeto!
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: CGI Global Technology Operations Canada offers and delivers security and infrastructure services to leading clients.  As a Security Architect, you will work multiple infrastructure security technologies ranging from antivirus protection, data loss prevention, full disk encryption, vulnerability management, etc.. You will contribute to further development of our clients security posture and compliance. We are looking for a team player, good time-management and organizational skills and ability to work independently with limited supervision to help us build and expand the offering and evolution of our security services.   You will work in the Managed Endpoint Protection Services team, leading the service and solution evolution along with the director and manager of a very dynamic team. Youll be able to work with many different technologies and will be looked up to provide guidance and recommendations on what the team should do and create new offerings and solutions/services. Your future duties and responsibilities: The Security Architect is a senior influential role which is responsible for the technical architecture and design of complex managed security solutions to meet client requirements. The Security Architect may have a role in one or several of the following areas, depending on the architect's background and experience and on organizational workloads and requirements. o Transition / Deployment Projects o Pre-sales (new or organic growth proposals) o Vendor selection, service evolution, Proof-of-Concepts The Security Architect also is expected to  Provide cyber-security expert knowledge and advice to clients as well as internally to our leadership.  Lead the MEPS team technical interaction with the client, sometimes with the leads of other CGI teams, to flesh-out client requirements, and provide the technical architecture of the proposed managed security solution.  Participate in client presentations and meetings, sometimes with the leads of other CGI teams, to discuss CGI's Security services capabilities.  Lead the technical response to client requests for proposals.  Collaborate with the Architecture leads of other CGI teams to design the managed security services solution to satisfy the client requirements, while being mindful of operational supportability, deployment and operational costs and risk mitigation for both the client and CGI.  Produce architectural specifications, and design documents including technical diagrams and bills of materials.  Technical oversight of deployment projects and mentoring of Managed Endpoint Protection Support team members  Collaborate with other Solution Architects, Security Advisor and management to grow and evolve CGI's Managed Security Service offerings.  Maintain awareness of trends in IT security technology and regulatory requirements  Participate in the evolution and improvement of the team's tools, methodologies, templates, etc.  Identifying and coaching potential succession candidates  Examining and test security solution vendors to assess usage of potential new tools and capabilities Required qualifications to be successful in this role: Required qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent; Minimum of five to ten years of directly related IT experience with at least half in security. In-depth experience architecting complex technical solutions. Strong knowledge of various network and security technologies. Strong knowledge of networking protocols. Strong troubleshooting, reasoning and problem solving skills. Demonstrated leadership and negotiation skills with business and technical groups. Good business acumen. Strong analytical skills and the ability to understand complexities and how components connect and relate to each other. Ability to speak, write and communicate clearly and effectively in fluent English (French also desirable) with both clients and internal organizations. Knowledge/experience in multiple security technologies such as: Endpoint Security, Firewalls, IDPS, Web Content Filtering, Email filtering (antispam), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Analytics, Vulnerability Management, Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) and Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) solutions Ability to obtain a Government of Canada security clearance of Level II (Secret). One or more of the following would be desirable, but not essential:  Security certifications such as: CISSP, CISM, SANS GIAC such as GCFW, GCIA, GCWN.  Experience working with one or more enterprise architecture frameworks such as SABSA, TOGAF, ZACKMAN.  Understanding of information security frameworks/standard such as ISO 27001, NECR CIP, PCI-DSS, NIST-800, etc.. What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
Title: Security Architect

Job_Description: EY's people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work. We currently have a career opportunity for a Senior Manager in our Cybersecurity advisory team to participate in multiple client engagement teams and related activities. As a member, you'll deliver and lead cybersecurity and IT risk client engagements as well as internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish internal and external relationships. You'll also identify potential business opportunities for EY within existing engagements, and escalate these as appropriate. Similarly, you'll anticipate and identify risks within engagements and raise any issues with senior members of the team. In line with EY's commitment to quality, you'll confirm that work is of high quality and is reviewed by the next-level reviewer. Responsibilities:  Client Responsibilities Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business. Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to assimilate to new knowledge. Possess good business acumen. Remain current on new developments in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge. Demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems. Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations. People Responsibilities Contribute to people-related initiatives, including development, coaching, recruiting, training and retaining staff Maintain an educational program to continually develop personal skills of staff Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures Qualifications   Desired qualifications include:  Undergraduate or masters’ degree preferably in one of the following areas: Information Security, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, and other related majors Knowledge and 10 years of hands-on experience with key components of cybersecurity incl. network & infrastructure security, access and identity management, threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, security governance, risk and compliance, security architecture, data protection, privacy, security awareness and others. Expert knowledge and 8 - 10 years of practical experience with common frameworks, standards and methodologies used in cybersecurity field Practical experience with conducting risk assessments and testing of controls Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of data analytics methods Possession of at least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISA CISM Familiarity with or knowledge of cybersecurity in Industrial Control Systems and Operational Technology Demonstrated leadership abilities Excellent interpersonal, written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills  Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50-70%.  EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
Title: Senior Manager – Cyber Security
