Job_Description: At DarkMatter, we are building an organisation of specialists to provide the ultimate integrated cyber security protection available. Whatever the scope, scale or sensitivity of our clients’ work, we'll assess their risks, resolve their vulnerabilities and always keep them ahead of the threat, offering them the best possible products and solutions.  In this role, you will:  Own the security architecture for all Secure Comms applications Identify appropriate security requirements, develop practical security solutions and implement security guidelines Understand current as well as emerging security threats and design security architecture to mitigate threats where possible Provide inputs for security hardening at the infrastructure, application and network levels Write and review security architecture documents Advising on technology choices by analysing risk and business cases, industry best practices and prior experience Monitor industry security updates, technologies and best practices to improve security management  To bring your dream to life, you’ll need: Required Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent  10+ years of relevant experience  Desired skills:  Extensive experience in the coordination of program and project leaders to identify requirements for security architecture Must be able to identify strategies for addressing requirements Extensive experience with analysis of security requirements against budget, schedule and performance Extensive experience in creating and conveying to team members the vision of the security architecture for a program or project Extensive software development experience and thorough knowledge of a variety of programming languages including Objective-C, Swift, Java and C/C++ Extensive security domain knowledge in mobile security, especially iOS, Android, secure elements and smart cards Extensive security domain knowledge in large enterprise backend systems and web applications Expert on cryptographic primitives, protocols and key management Thrive in a collaborative environment and can clearly communicate while confidently driving security architecture across many projects and teams Laser-focused on the smallest details  Working in Abu Dhabi  At DarkMatter, we’re turning our biggest ideas into reality in the fastest moving and most dynamic city on the planet. Working here, you’ll lead technical innovation in the region while taking advantage of all Abu Dhabi has to offer. From first class healthcare and education, to superior living accommodations and cultural attractions, you’ll find your ideal career and more in this global crossroads. The UAE is one of the safest and most secure areas in the world. And with its location between Europe, Africa and Asia, you’ll expand your worldview in just a short flight. But you won’t have to venture far from the city to experience its diversity. You’ll find people of over 50 nationalities working in the DarkMatter Group. Join us and see that while far away from the concrete tech jungle, Abu Dhabi is an oasis where your latest innovations will thrive and grow.
Title: Applications Architect

Job_Description: As a member of CGIs global security team, the candidate will play an integral role in defining and assessing the organization's security strategy, architecture and practices.  The candidate will work within a multi-disciplinary Enterprise Security Architecture team to support business units and corporate functions to assess, develop and implement solutions that are aligned with CGI security policies, strategy and requirements.  We are seeking a strategic, innovative, thought leader to join our global team. This role may be based in either Montreal, Toronto or Ottawa. Your future duties and responsibilities:  Provide guidance on security architecture, practices & solutions to help business units to build & deliver solutions that meet CGI security requirements;  Recommend security strategies, plans, priorities and investments needed for improvements to CGI security controls;  Develop and maintain security architecture artifacts (e.g., models, templates, standards) that can be used to integrate CGI security requirements in projects & operations;  Support business units to respond to client questions, assessments, and audits regarding CGIs security posture and controls;  Provide oversight, support and orientation to ensure security is integrated throughout the delivery lifecycle of Corporate projects;  Track developments and changes in business, technology and threat environments to ensure they are addressed in CGIs security strategy;  Support the development and maintenance of CGIs security architecture framework and processes;  Review, evaluate the design and operational effectiveness of security controls and countermeasures used to protect CGI applications, services and solutions;  Remain current on security technologies, tools and services and make recommendations for their use based on security, financial and operational criteria;  Liaise with other security architects and practitioners to communicate CGI security practices and processes; Required qualifications to be successful in this role:  Proven experience in security architecture practices, processes, frameworks (TOGAF, Zachman, Sabsa) and strategic security planning;  Excellent knowledge of security and risk management trends as well as emerging threats and vulnerabilities;  Expert knowledge of security controls and countermeasures (defense in depth) including practical experience with identity management, cyber-security and IT processes / solutions;  Excellent knowledge of application development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Dev Ops) and the processes and practices used to secure them;  Experience with methodologies to conduct threat / risk modeling on new applications and services;  Expert knowledge of security / risk control frameworks (COBiT, ISO 27001, ITIL), and business continuity / disaster recovery frameworks (ISO 22301, ISO 27031);  Strong leadership and facilitation skills with an ability to build relationships with stakeholders;  Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills;  Highly self-motivated, self-directed and attentive to detail;  A University degree plus at least 10 years' experience in a security role; Desired qualifications:  Experience in security incident response and investigation as well as Security Operations Centers;  Experience with business case development, budgeting, IT governance and supplier management;  Knowledge of applicable laws and regulations as they relate to security and the protection of personal information and client data;  Relevant industry certifications including Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certification, Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certification, Open Group TOGAF, SANS GIAC or equivalent;  Excellent English and French verbal and written fluency. What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Skills: Enterprise Architecture Solutions Architecture
Title: Director, Cyber Security Architect

Job_Description: Strategic Transformation Leader  The world is moving from traditional transportation solutions into the realm of mobility management, where disruptive strategies and emerging technologies are forcing a rethink of how people, goods, and services will interact within the urban environment. Parsons is leading the industry in implementing the physical and digital infrastructure necessary for cities to thrive in this new world, providing secure, multimodal, technology-enabled solutions that integrate seamlessly with existing urban operations and emerging Smart City programs.  We are seeking a Leader to develop a strategic transformation group for our Canadian operation that evaluates and applies technology-based solutions to provide business value to our clients.  The group will research, evaluate, test and recommend new technology platforms and tools in the following areas: Information Management Framework / Big Data Business Intelligence & Analytics Geospatial technologies including GIS Asset Management for Infrastructure and Transportation Mobility Management & Smart City strategies   The successful candidate will be familiar with multiple existing and emerging technologies and be able to communicate how these technologies may be applied to enhance, extend, and transform our traditional offerings in the planning, design, construction, and management of urban infrastructure.  This role will work across our Canadian operations, with access to the subject matter expert(s) necessary to understand our capabilities, markets, and sales channels. Working with the Strategic Transformation Lead, he or she will develop and maintain market intelligence on potential partners and technologies that can support the following our work in the following markets:  Smart Cities Mobility Management Intelligent Transportation Systems Advanced Vehicle Technology Advanced Train Control Systems Advanced Aviation Systems Advanced Communication Systems Fare Collection Technology Critical Infrastructure Protection Systems Systems Integration Software and Hardware Solutions  The Strategic Transformation Leader will lead, direct and oversee this new group based on the framework of responsibilities outlined below: Collaborates and liaises with peers, information technology staff across internal divisions to share information and seek input on key initiatives, builds consensus with stakeholders Communicates with senior management decision makers on a regular basis regarding technology initiatives under consideration and the ongoing direction for the group Collaborates and communicates with project managers across infrastructure divisions regarding systems, applications and tools for project delivery, seeks input from key stakeholders Participates on corporate initiatives for innovative improvements including the evaluation of business cases and prioritization of key ideas under consideration for deployment Benchmarks new technologies under consideration with existing systems, recommends adoption, consolidation or retirement of legacy systems as appropriate, develops migration plans Maintains market intelligence though external channels that include research companies, vendors, industry partners and organizations Completes maturity assessments and analysis of predictions for future market share for emerging technologies under consideration Keeps abreast of major trends in multiple industries (including information technology, telecommunications, Smart Cities, and traditional infrastructure markets), with an emphasis on new and emerging offerings from outside of the traditional transportation market. Follows up in a timely manner on all possible leads. Disseminates information on innovative technologies across Parson's as appropriate Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate   The successful candidate will have a combination of the following skills and experience: 4-year degree (or equivalent) is required. Ability to translate complex concepts across multiple technical and non-technical audiences critical. Experience evaluating technology platforms a must Experience recruiting for technology-based positions and providing leadership to technical teams is required ITIL certification is preferred    Prior experience in transportation system or product development is an advantage. Experience with tech-facing transportation solutions (ridesharing, autonomous vehicles, data analytics, consumer apps) a plus.  The incumbent must possess strong written and oral communication skills, including excellent presentation skills. Must demonstrate practical experience working across multiple fields (engineering or non-engineering.) Examples of work products strongly encouraged.  Parsons is a technology-driven engineering services firm with more than 70 years of experience in the engineering, construction, technical, and professional services industries. The corporation is a leader in many diversified markets with a focus on infrastructure, defense, and construction. Parsons delivers design/design-build, program/construction management, systems design/engineering, cyber/converged security, and other professional services packaged in innovative alternative delivery methods to federal, regional, and local government agencies, as well as to private industrial customers worldwide.  All across the world, at every time of day, Parsons is keeping people moving toward a brighter, safer world. For more about Parsons, please visit www.parsons.com
Title: Program Director - Strategic Transformation

Job_Description: Collaborate with industry leaders, diverse teams and innovative minds.  Our Risk Assurance Practice: In our Risk Assurance practice, you’ll work with people who have a broad range of skills and expertise. It’s a great way to learn and build on a variety of business skills that will serve you throughout your career. You’ll work with people who have deep subject matter expertise across a variety of industries, including mining, energy, public sector and financial services. Working with our professional’s means you’ll get the coaching and training you need to develop your career, and have responsibility for leading and growing others.  PwC has one of the largest cybersecurity and IT risk practices globally. The firm has a long history of innovations in this space and continues to be a significant presence with pragmatic solutions. PwC is ideally suited for organizations that want to view IT risk from practical and holistic views and take them from assessment through to implementation. PwC’s strength is to connect these capabilities, based on its vast expertise in this space.  Our services combine strategy, governance, technical and risk management expertise and fall broadly within the following client issues:  Cybersecurity strategy & governance Risk Management & resilience Identity and Access Management Threat Intelligence & Vulnerability Management Data Leakage Prevention Cybersecurity Risk Assessments  The Opportunity: Manager, Cybersecurity (Identity Management) As a Manager of Cybersecurity, you will join our growing practice to meet our clients’ demand for high quality, independent advice and delivery capability focusing on strategy, governance and risk management. We are looking for dynamic personalities with a passion for security and privacy who understands what it means to be change agents in transforming businesses.  Responsibilities: Demonstrate advanced understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, IT controls and related standards Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement Understand complex business and IT management processes Lead clients through facilitated sessions to identify, define and refine solutions customized to the client business needs. Provide real life use cases to support case for change / transformation using one or more Identity & Access Management products such as Sailpoint, CyberArk, etc. Communicate to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and functional level appropriate for the situation. Provide post-pursuit requirements gathering, analysis and documentation. Manage project scope, schedule, status and documentation. Demonstrate a general knowledge of market trends, competitor activities and PwC products and service lines Actively participate in decision making with engagement management and seek to understand the broader impact of current decisions Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design and/or implement products and services Identify opportunities to improve engagement profitability. Mentoring and developing junior staff as required including supplying formal evaluation and feedback. Maintain a credential set that establishes technical expertise. Help recruit, retain and develop the team by bringing superior leadership skills. Requirements: Bachelor or Master’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Engineering or Business. Technical designations such as CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, ITIL or TOGAF A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in cyber security roles Solid mix of business and technical capabilities, and the ability to communicate complex technical and risk management issues to senior executives within the context of their business. Ability to develop and manage senior-level relationships, identify IAM opportunities with clients and propose solutions that meet the clients’ needs. Strong project management, facilitation and delivery skills. The ability to manage engagement financials and risk. The ability to manage a number of concurrent and complex IAM projects, meet deadlines and manage stakeholder expectations. Strong leadership qualities when working in a team and the ability to be recognized as the subject matter expert in a given field when our client requires. The ability to be seen as a role model for junior members of the team and provide guidance and coaching to the team. Clear, articulate and confident written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical and problem solving capabilities. Prior consulting or leading system integrator experience is a plus. Open to travel requirements.  Why Work for PwC Our employees make an impact with their dedication to client service, creativity, and high performance. Whatever your passion is, the opportunities available to you at PwC will help you realize your career aspirations.  PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.  PwC: the Opportunity of a Lifetime
Title: Manager, Cybersecurity

Job_Description: Job Description Location: Ottawa  IBM Security Intelligence is the global provider of high-value, cost-effective, security information and event management (SIEM) products. The flagship offering QRadar is currently the industry leader in SIEM. Qradar integrates previously disparate functions including log management, network behaviour analytics and security event management into a total security intelligence solution. QRadar provides users with crucial visibility into what is occurring with their networks, data centres, and applications to better protect IT assets and meet regulatory requirements.  At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity theft, frauds, etc. IBM Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts; and we are looking for Software Developers to come make a difference.  Why join IBM Security? Work for one of the most advanced cyber security companies in the world and one of the world's most trusted brands Work with a globally distributed and international team, with a culture centred on success Competitive compensation and benefit packages A world of opportunity for career growth What are your responsibilities? Understand and support the mission and vision of IBM business unit you belong to, e.g. IBM Security. Contribute new features and help your team resolve technical debt using agile development practices Collaborate with other development teams to ensure a quality product  This role may involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  English Fluent (verbal and written) Have knowledge in software development, product design and integration 3+ years of professional experience developing in Java Experience with REST APIs Ability to adapt to new and existing technologies quickly Have passion to innovate  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Python JavaScript, HTML Experience with Unix based operating systems  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.  Technology Risk Management and Information Security (TRMIS) is a group of technology, security and risk professionals in Canada, the U.S. and the U.K., focused on managing a comprehensive program to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls.  The Cyber Threat Management Team is responsible for protecting the Bank, customers and employees by mitigating and identifying technology threats to TD. Development of effective risk management programs help ensure TD’s best-in-class cyber security approach.  What We Stand For The TRMIS program is continuously evolving to mitigate risks to the bank, including introducing new initiatives and improved defense. With a layered approach to protect customers, employees and the bank from cyber threats, TD manages, challenges and reviews technology controls for all business applications.   Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 9-5  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions  Job Category(s) Technology Solutions  Job Description Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform: Highly motivated, team-oriented, self-learner, responsible, and focused on exceeding expectations Strong organizational skills to facilitate management and tracking of large numbers of findings, requirements and changes, and activities Sense of urgency, resourcefulness and enthusiasm in adopting and implementing identified technical solutions Ability to apply accurate logic and common sense in data and problem analysis Ability to protect confidential information and act with a high level of integrity Knowledge in current and emerging technologies in the space of Information Security, particularly with Vulnerability and Configuration Management Demonstrates understanding of the processes necessary to execute an enterprise-wide control function Ability to understand requirements and execute processes related to configuring and operating solutions in compliance with corporate security standards High level of confidence and assertiveness in high-pressure situations Ability to build strong relationships with individual technical Subject Matter Experts from all areas of Technology Ability to quickly analyze large amounts of information and provide necessary feedback and synopsis to team leads or technical managers Excellent written and oral communications skills and ability to articulate and present information to all levels of technical staff and stakeholders  Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:  One to three years' work experience in information security, cyber security, data protection or a related field Minimum of a two-year degree in information protection, computer forensics, computer information systems, computer science, or information systems management 1+ years of experience in performing vulnerability management for all enterprise platforms Knowledge of risk-based vulnerability prioritization, reporting, and developing remediation steps Knowledge of developing and reviewing processes and run books for vulnerability identification, configuration violations identification, analysis, remediation, and reporting Experience with identifying and troubleshooting problems Experience with configuration & change management operational processes Must have solid understanding of Network and Security infrastructure, topology including firewalls, routers, wireless access points, DNS, DHCP, and Group Policy Knowledge of securing virtual, physical and cloud environments Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Qualys, HPSA, HPNA, IBM Guardium or equivalent vulnerability assessment tools Professional IT security certification such as CISSP, SANS Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), CompTIA Security+, CEH, GSEC and/or CISM is preferred An understanding of regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, FFIEC, SOX, HIPAA, ISO 2700x, NIST standards  Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing: Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside. Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. Job_Description: About Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) Global Information & Technology Risk Management (GITRM) is a division of BMO that combines Information Security, Information Management and Technology Risk into a comprehensive department. GITRM’s mandate is to provide sound governance and guidance on information and technology risk, as well as to provide critical services central to protecting the Bank against cyber threats. GITRM (Business) PMO is accountable to execute on these critical services and solutions while operating securely in an increasingly connected global environment. Description: The PMO Analyst is a Best Practice and Process Expert - training, project oversight, quality assurance and methodology development. Will also be a Knowledge Management Coordinator - project records, standards, methods, and lessons learned must be stored in our project database. The PMO Analyst will control documents, facilitate communication between the project office and stakeholders and collect data to meet reporting requirements. Key Accountabilities: Maintaining the PMO sharepoint site, library and archives and any associated online project knowledge management system capability, to ensure information is always accurate and current. Govern clarity PM data accuracy. Run monthly PM Data Governance and KRI dashboard reports. Track and Follow-up on any non-conformances. Run monthly spotfire dashboard reports for each of the portfolio review meetings with the appropriate leaders and their teams. Manage, Track and Follow-up on Action Items from these meetings Preparing project performance analyses for PMO and senior management review Maintain and Coordinate the PM Intake process, including the “capacity vs demand” reports Coordinates and schedules training classes to advance the skills and capabilities of project managers and educate employees about EPMO changes. Create PDU forms and track inventory Maintain, Coordinate and Deliver on-boarding, off-boarding and training to new PMs Coordinating scheduled routines such as monthly project audits, forecasts, time-sheet approvals Assist with the day-to-day operations of the PMO Provide information to PMO management to enable PM assignment and handle updates/ announcements, as required Develop specific views for Clarity Supplier report as necessary Research the various Spotfire visualizations for useful resourcing and forecasting views for PMO Management Upgrade and enhance PMO Database, ensuring audit, risk and compliance standards are met Manage and control documents, such as form templates, meeting minutes, reports, plans and schedules. Maintain PMO vacation and training calendars Qualifications Skills: Basic knowledge of Project Management concepts and practices needed to develop/maintain processes and create templates to support project management Experience in change leadership and change management Solid knowledge and expertise in the use of program management methodologies and tools (e.g. Clarity, MS Project, SharePoint repositories, TIBCO Spotfire, Software Development Life Cycle, etc.) Strong communication skills Influencing skills We’re here to help  At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Job  Project Management Primary Location  Canada-Ontario-Scarborough Organisation  GITRM-X000060 Schedule  full-time Job Posting  05/14/18 Unposting Date  Ongoing

Job_Description: Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com  Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.  Technology Risk Management and Information Security (TRMIS) is a group of technology, security and risk professionals in Canada, the U.S. and the U.K., focused on managing a comprehensive program to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls.  The Cyber Threat Management Team is responsible for protecting the Bank, customers and employees by mitigating and identifying technology threats to TD. Development of effective risk management programs help ensure TD’s best-in-class cyber security approach.  What We Stand For The TRMIS program is continuously evolving to mitigate risks to the bank, including introducing new initiatives and improved defense. With a layered approach to protect customers, employees and the bank from cyber threats, TD manages, challenges and reviews technology controls for all business applications.   Job Type Regular  Job Status Full Time  Hours 9-5  Business line Other  Job Category - Primary Technology Solutions  Job Category(s) Technology Solutions  Job Description Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform: Highly motivated, team-oriented, self-learner, responsible, and focused on exceeding expectations Strong organizational skills to facilitate management and tracking of large numbers of findings, requirements and changes, and activities Sense of urgency, resourcefulness and enthusiasm in adopting and implementing identified technical solutions Ability to apply accurate logic and common sense in data and problem analysis Ability to protect confidential information and act with a high level of integrity Knowledge in current and emerging technologies in the space of Information Security, particularly with Vulnerability and Configuration Management Demonstrates understanding of the processes necessary to execute an enterprise-wide control function Ability to understand requirements and execute processes related to configuring and operating solutions in compliance with corporate security standards High level of confidence and assertiveness in high-pressure situations Ability to build strong relationships with individual technical Subject Matter Experts from all areas of Technology Ability to quickly analyze large amounts of information and provide necessary feedback and synopsis to team leads or technical managers Excellent written and oral communications skills and ability to articulate and present information to all levels of technical staff and stakeholders  Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:  One to three years' work experience in information security, cyber security, data protection or a related field Minimum of a two-year degree in information protection, computer forensics, computer information systems, computer science, or information systems management 1+ years of experience in performing vulnerability management for all enterprise platforms Knowledge of risk-based vulnerability prioritization, reporting, and developing remediation steps Knowledge of developing and reviewing processes and run books for vulnerability identification, configuration violations identification, analysis, remediation, and reporting Experience with identifying and troubleshooting problems Experience with configuration & change management operational processes Must have solid understanding of Network and Security infrastructure, topology including firewalls, routers, wireless access points, DNS, DHCP, and Group Policy Knowledge of securing virtual, physical and cloud environments Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Qualys, HPSA, HPNA, IBM Guardium or equivalent vulnerability assessment tools Professional IT security certification such as CISSP, SANS Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), CompTIA Security+, CEH, GSEC and/or CISM is preferred An understanding of regulatory and Controls requirements: PCI, FFIEC, SOX, HIPAA, ISO 2700x, NIST standards  Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing: Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside. Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more. Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.  We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.
Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager

Job_Description: Our organization is looking for a Senior Cisco Network and Cybersecurity Specialist in Calgary. The successful candidate will be required to develop network cybersecurity plans, coordinate and implement security programs in the cybersecurity project. You will be supporting existing environments, design, evaluate and implement plans to improve our cybersecurity.Primary Duties and Responsibilities· Improve cybersecurity through implementation of stronger authentication controls (Limited two- factor authentication)· Improve cybersecurity and operational efficiencies through significant enhancement of user access controls (Plan and expand TrustSec deployment)· Improve cybersecurity and operational efficiencies through development and deployment of secure standard configurations for network equipment (Implement CIS Benchmark configuration standards)· Improve cybersecurity through development and deployment of additional security functionality on existing infrastructure (Implement Firepower security intelligence)· Improve cybersecurity through extension of existing network connectivity access controls (Expand Network Access Control to additional network infrastructure)· Evaluate and potentially improve cybersecurity through deployment of mobile device security solution (Explore deployment of Cisco AMP to iPhones)· Support business priorities through architecting and deployment of secure network services by external parties· Improve cybersecurity through migration of successful pilot monitoring system into production (LogRhythm NetMon)· Enhance business capability, efficiency and flexibility through architecting and deployment of secure Bring Your Own Device network capabilities· Improve cybersecurity through continued development of vulnerability management program (Rapid7 Nexpose);· Address additional tasks and business priorities as requiredRequired Qualifications· Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Network Engineering or related field.· Minimum of 8 years’ experience related to the investigation, evaluation, testing, implementation and support of network cybersecurity solutions addressing a variety of challenges in a large-scale enterprise organization.· Training in Cisco products, as well as industry training on standards and best-practice frameworks.o Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP Security) or Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE Security)o ITIL or COBIT certifications· Previous experience and/or certification in architecting, implementing and troubleshooting the following technologies:o RSA SecurIDo Cisco ISE (particularly strong skills required)o Cisco Wireless LAN Controllerso Cisco Routing and Switchingo Cisco ASA and Sourcefire systemso Cisco AMPo LogRhythm SIEM and LogRhythm NetMono Rapid 7 Nexpose· Experience in Cybersecurity analysis and implementation· Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills· Excellent technical documentation skillsJob Type: ContractSalary: $90.00 to $95.00 /hourExperience:CISCO ISE: 3 yearsCCNP / CCIE: 1 yearCyber Security: 8 years
Title: Senior Cisco Network and Cybersecurity Specialist

Job_Description: IATA is seeking a senior level risk and insurance professional to join its Member & External Relations (MER) Division. Reporting to the Corporate Secretary and SVP MER, the incumbent will provide leadership and expertise to the industry on programs designed to ensure the continuity of insurance coverage to the broader airline community, while reducing industry costs. Maintaining responsibility for managing and further developing industry risk management initiatives, the successful candidate will also be responsible for directing IATA’s corporate insurance requirements and, as a subject matter expert, supporting the company’s Enterprise Risk Management program. This is a high profile position with key interfaces with the insurance brokerage and re-insurance sector, IATA member airlines and a range of key internal IATA stakeholders. Responsibilities Industry Risk Management Represent the interests of IATA’s member airlines on aviation insurance matters, and develop industry insurance strategies and risk management solutions aimed at containing overall risk exposures and costs. Organize an annual Industry Risk and Insurance Management (RIM) Forum, which advises on emerging insurance and risk management issues of concern to the air transport industry, and assist in the execution of key industry campaigns in the field of risk management and insurance. Provide thought leadership and guidance in the creation and innovative risk management approaches for the industry including for example global and local default insurance programs, designed as a cost effective alternative to bank guarantees and other types of security, in support of IATA’s Industry Settlement Systems as well the innovative use of captives to address inherent risks and their treatment related to both existing and new business initiatives and ventures. IATA Risk Management Support the preparation of insurance budgets and premium allocations and manage insurance renewal activities, including preparation of underwriting submissions, negotiation, procurement/placement and review for compliance of terms and conditions of insured and/or self-insured programs. Manage the relationship with IATA’s brokers and insurers, monitor the performance of services against service level agreements. Work closely with business units to provide insurance support and training. Develop and implement a pro-active claims management program to include claims administrator performance standards, claims reviews and audits. Provide leadership to internal claims management staff, and oversight of insurer claims management efforts. Act as a subject matter expert to the IATA Risk management Committee on insurance matters by providing reporting and developing key metrics, including an analysis of loss information, identified trends, and opportunities and recommendations to mitigate future losses. Support IATA’s Enterprise Risk Management program by providing expert advice and analysis on the monetary value of all identified risks, the likelihood of claims, and identified gaps between insurable exposures and actual coverages in place. Support the development and maintenance of IATA products (e.g. publications, conferences) and services (e.g. training) designed to provide industry guidance on the discipline of risk management and insurance. Collaborate with senior management and other leaders in defining the company's risk profile and tolerance. Provide education and training to all levels of management in striving towards a risk intelligent organization. Provide periodic written and verbal reports to senior managers. Perform the duties of the Risk Champion for the MER Division by assisting the business areas in identifying risks in existing or new processes, products, systems and change activities, and ensuring the information recorded accurately reflects the current level of risk in terms of description, control effectiveness evaluation, and likelihood and impact assessments, taking into account the status of prescribed action plans. Support the contract review process and negotiate contractual insurance requirements by providing guidance to management regarding contractual provisions (e.g. warranty, insurance, indemnifications, liability, etc.). Support the Legal Department by advising on any mediations, arbitrations and other significant events associated with litigation as needed. Qualifications and Skills Success in leading corporate-wide efforts to identify, assess and mitigate/insure key organizational risks by working collaboratively with senior management, process owners and Board members. Expert knowledge from wide exposure to various corporate insurance and risk management methodologies and frameworks. Successful experience in reducing a company's total cost of risk through loss control and claims management practices. Expertise with a variety of insurance policies including executive/professionals, cyber, general liability, automobile and property coverages. Unquestionable ethics, integrity, and values. Strategic, creative, and analytically minded. Sound judgment and ability to act independently. A "big picture thinker" who understands vision and strategy, but also a hands-on executive who can get things done with limited resources. A trusted confidant and advisor; someone who is sought out by his/her staff as well as by other senior leaders for advice. Ability to successfully influence senior/executive leaders based on a high degree of personal credibility, drive for results, prior experience, and insights into the business. This individual will be collaborative and will encourage open communication. High-energy, results-oriented, resourceful, and mature leader who is capable of establishing himself/herself as a credible strategic business partner. Excellent communication skills with ability to interact comfortably with senior leaders, executive level management and board members. A strong leader and manager of people with the ability to recognize outstanding performers and build a strong team in support of the company's rewarding performance culture. Ability to inspire and motivate others. Strong problem-solving skills, including creativity and innovative thinking, combined with a willingness to challenge the stat and act as a "change agent." Ability to quickly assimilate relevant information in unfamiliar situations. Ability to travel as needed within and outside of Canada Ten to fifteen years of experience in insurance and risk management. Knowledge of ISO and other risk management frameworks a plus. Strong workers' compensation and aviation liability experience at the international, multi-country level Knowledge of finance and accounting and, familiarity with methods for allocating insurance costs An undergraduate degree in Finance or a business discipline is required. Masters in Business Administration preferred A professional risk management certification is preferred (ARM, CRM, etc.). At the heart of IATA are our Values and Behaviors. We all have different personalities, styles and areas of expertise, but you’ll recognize us by the consistent way we act and behave in line with our Values and Behaviors. We are looking for people who bring them to life in everything they do – they are:  Act with integrity and uphold our standards Think strategically in support of the global big picture Partner and manage to create high performing teams Putting people first by acting with a simple human touch  Here at IATA we are proud of being a Diverse & Inclusive Organization – we have people from all over the world working in our offices, and we extend this to our recruiting practices. We are a meritocratic organization and an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Director, Industry Risk Management and Insurance

Job_Description: TekStaff is an IT Placement agency and interested in positioning you with our client.This is a 6 month contract located inMarkham, Ontario.Description:General Expectations- 10-14 years of relevant experience- Demonstrates advanced knowledge and ability, and can apply the competency in new or complex situations; and- Guides other professionals.Description and RequirementsKnowledge and ability to support the enterprise computing infrastructure (e.g., enterprise servers, client server, storage devices and systems, hardware and software) in the provision, management, storage, operation, scheduling, support and maintenance of the infrastructure.Knowledge requirements: - Principles, practices, standards, methods and techniques related to interoperability of hardware / software configuration controls;- Platform environment (e.g., client-server environment and enterprise server / mainframe environment);- Storage and retrieval (e.g., area network, mainframe storage, media storage, and virtual storage);- Systems hardware and its characteristics (e.g., mainframe computers, mini and micro-computers, CPU, memory, disk, registers, bus, and channel);- Hardware / software and connection, implementation and maintenance;- Operating systems, communications and software utilities used on enterprise server / mainframe and distributed computer systems;- Cooperative processing (two [2] or more computers simultaneously processing portions of the same program or operating on the same data such as multiple-CPU systems, distributed systems);- Monitoring of systems software (i.e., the operating system and all utility programs that manage computer resources at a low level) including compilers, loaders, linkers, and debuggers;- Operations performance monitoring and capacity planning of the delivery platform; Job_Description: Requisition ID: 23240 Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. Job Purpose The role is responsible to prevent, detect and suppress technological crime against the assets, staff and customers of the Scotiabank Group and Affiliates by investigating highly complex cases involving organized crime. Take proactive action to identify and investigate emerging forms of electronic fraud and provide expert digital forensic services in support of criminal investigations often working with a global stakeholders and senior management.  Key Accountabilities  1. Lead Technical Investigations: Lead high complexity investigations globally as well as oversee the cases of the team relating to known or suspected technological crime against the Scotiabank Group and affiliates on a worldwide basis and gather sufficient evidence to assist in determining criminal and civil remedies against the perpetrators. This is inclusive of technical/data security breaches, business conduct violations, employee defalcations, customer/non customer fraud/theft, relating to digital banking, investments, loans and bank card products as well as utilizing electronic means to trace and locate the proceeds of criminal activities as well as assist in the recovery of assets. Take immediate action in conjunction with line management, Information Security & Control, Intelligence, Fraud Management, as well as external partners including law enforcement, banks, and investigative bodies on a worldwide basis to investigate and prevent financial loss and reputational risk to the Bank in alignment with the department’s mandate Assist in major case management investigations and critical incidents being led by Corporate Security Investigation Services. Prepare escalations reports and recommendations to senior management/key stakeholders pertaining to investigations completed by the team. Ability to articulate technical findings to target audience is essential.  2. Execute Digital Fraud Investigations: Prevent, detect and investigate various forms of electronic fraud such as targeted hacks and crimeware against the Bank and its customers internationally. Oversee and manage digital fraud investigations conducted by the team as it relates to Phishing, malware and account takeover cases and identify trends and recommendations to mitigate cyber fraud risk with key stakeholders and line management. This includes the investigation of anomalous or erroneous transactions and information, as well as identifying source and intent and assessing threat to Bank systems and financial integrity Responds to cybercrime against the Bank globally on an immediate basis, and may be expected to travel on short notice. Must be able to multi-task and set priorities quickly to determine the order in which situations need to be handled autonomously.  3. Manage Forensic Processes and Procedures: Secure, protect, evaluate and correlate evidence in a forensically sound manner, sufficient to support criminal charges and support collaboration with legal, the police and other authorities. This includes ensuring the allegations are well founded and provable, with a high expectation of a successful outcome to avoid potential risk to civil liability. This entails the preparation of supporting internal/external communications, including court briefs as necessary and the development of sound operational action plans with attention to detail documentation and preservation of evidence. Develop and manage standard operating procedures to govern forensic practices and procedures concerning the extraction and proper handling of various forms of potential digital evidence, conduct proper analysis and safeguard findings and conclusions in a manner suitable for criminal or civil court proceedings. Testify and represent the Scotiabank Group and affiliates as an expert witness in courts, as required.  4. Oversee Operations and Project Collaboration: Utilize programming languages or scrips to enable intricate searches and data analysis as well as automate various forensics processing tasks to detect and investigate wrongdoing and threat actors Assist management with process reengineering to consistently improve investigative methodologies and processes including technology and tools. Work with management and various departments on major project such as system and or application development and implementation to assist with investigations. Must be able to work in a fast past environment, but able to multitask and managing changing priorities is a key success criteria for the role.  5. Develop Intelligence and Security Assessments: Assist in the preparation of digital fraud investigation metrics and KRIs for operational risk and various stakeholders on all known or suspected internal/external crime against the Scotiabank Group and affiliates Maintain current awareness of evolving trends in the financial industry, relative to technological crime, investigative techniques and new enhanced delivery systems within the Scotiabank Group and other FIs. Provides counsel and guidance from a cyber fraud perspective on risk assessments of delivery systems or new payment initiatives and make recommendations on security enhancements in an effort to reduce cyber crime exposure and protect the Bank’s assets, staff and customers of the Scotiabank Group  Functional Competencies Coaches and oversees the investigations of 5 staff members and provides guidance and direction to team members when required on an ongoing basis both during and off business hours. Therefore, must be to manage highly skilled technical staff to coordinate and obtain accurate investigative results through effective communication/action plans to suppress or prove technological crimes against the Scotiabank Group and affiliates Exercises sound judgment, common sense to conduct medium to high complexity investigations in accordance with the Bank’s best practices and procedures and is guided by experience as well as the Canadian Criminal Code and related Federal & Provincial statutes Discharges responsibilities with minimal supervision and seeks direction from the Director when conducting complex computer crime investigations or confronted with unusual circumstances Refers criminal activity to the police for appropriate action where the Bank has sustained a loss with the exception of defalcations and suspected money-laundering transactions in which case, makes recommendations to the Director Investigation Services to follow through approval process Possess knowledge of the Bank’s hardware and software systems as well as policies and procedures to effectively conduct technical investigations and identify potential leads Independently determines if all gathered evidence is sufficient to support criminal and civil action and ensures full disclosure as required by law in civil and criminal processes. Makes decisions on the action steps involved in an investigation, ensuring that the Bank is not compromised or exposed to potential civil liability or reputational risk. Fluency in Spanish is an asset  Education / Experience  Post-Secondary University degree in Information Security, Information Technology, or Computer Science/Engineering is required or Minimum of 8-10 years’ experience in Digital Forensics, Security or Information Technology field is required. Information Security related certifications are preferred Working knowledge of the Criminal Code of Canada, the Canada Evidence Act and provincial interpretations relating to computer crime  Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
Title: Senior Manager - Digital Forensic Services

Job_Description: Why join Irdeto? We are on a mission! A mission to secure the world’s digital platforms. Why? Because a secure platform allows our clients to produce and deliver great content. In return, you can enjoy the latest blockbuster movies and your favorite live events at all times. It doesn’t stop at the media industry. Our security technology is securing connected cars, applications and devices and mobile payments, just to name a few. We are innovative, international and part of Naspers, one of the largest technology investors in the world. Cybersecurity Services Market Unit The mission of the cybersecurity services team is to secure the most valuable media assets and devices. We do so by building, delivering and supporting products and managed services to our global customer base of leading media companies like Hollywood studios, broadcasters and sports rights owners. We have the most advanced security consulting and anti-piracy teams in the industry. With access to the latest tools, subject-matter experts and technology, we are a market driven, and innovative team that values creativity, hard work and the delivery of quality results for our customers. You, the Software Developer in Tracemark Cloud Services, will be joining our Cyber Security Market Unit, to help with creating and maintaining products that provide services surrounding watermarked video content. What you will spend your days doing: Working with a tight-knit team in defining product architecture along with designing, implementing and maintaining new features Working directly with solution architects, customers, partners and the development team in proposing and evaluating solutions Developing and deploying products in various cloud environments Working in an agile fashion Videoconferencing, so you can see your globally dispersed team. You will work in cross functional teams that include professional services and technical operations as part of end to end product delivery and troubleshooting  Experience you bring: Hands-on experience with cloud environments: AWS, Google Cloud and/or Azure Hands-on experience with video technologies: Adaptive Video Delivery (such as HLS, DASH), Media Containers Formats (such as MP4, TS) Video Codecs (such as FFmpeg) Knowledge of video workflows is also a plus Experience developing with C/C++, Node.JS and/or Python Familiarity with continuous integration processes  Things are nice to have: Experience with React, Mocha, Jmeter, Git, GitlabCI/Jenkins, CI, CD, YAML, Docker, Kubernetes Understanding and having worked in agile/scrum Experience with Ansible or CloudFormation Experience with AWS hosted services, including SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience in networking and network security – routing, firewalls, load balancing, DNS  Required Education and Experience: Several years of experience in technical leadership combined with a track record of software development delivery Bachelor’s degree of Computer Science or related technical degree or equivalent experience Ability to work in a fast changing, highly dynamic, geographically dispersed environment  Not a perfect match for the role? Experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable and passion goes a long way when we are looking at fit. Diversity is what makes Irdeto great. If your experience is close to what we are looking for, we highly encourage you to apply.  What do we offer you? At Irdeto, we know that it is the people who make our company a success. We encourage personal and professional growth and success among our globally diverse workforce by offering: Competitive remuneration and benefits Career and personal development opportunities Flexible working spaces in state of the art offices A focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness Working for a truly global company with offices in 15+ countries With nearly 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, Irdeto is a solid company to join. We are looking for people who are energetic, dynamic and driven to be part of our community. Irdeto welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Welcome to Irdeto!
Title: Principal Software Developer

Job_Description: Job Description The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. At IBM Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity thief, fraud etc. IBM Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts; and we are looking for Software Developers to come make a difference.  Why join IBM Security? Work for one of the most advanced cyber security companies in the world and one of the world's most trusted brands Use the most modern software development tools to work on the leading edge of software development, building micro services based cloud-first infrastructure Work with a globally distributed and international team, with a culture centered on success Competitive compensation and benefit packages A world of opportunity for career growth What are your responsibilities?   As a security cloud platform developer, you will be expected to demonstrate solid conceptual and technical skills as you develop, implement, and eventually help to run core infrastructure components to back IBM Security’s cloud portfolio of products You will work with product owners to implement new components, and new features in existing components You will help your team find and resolve technical debt using agile development practices You will help your team support and run your services in production in a DevOps oriented fashion You will work with other products and teams in the IBM Security division to help them utilize and develop against the platform components you build  This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.  FCHS*18  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  English Fluent (verbal and written) 3+ years of professional experience developing in Java 3+ years of experience in one or more of the following: Ruby / Python / Go Experience in agile software development methodologies Experience developing microservices based platforms based on RESTful APIs Experience developing in a service-oriented Cloud environment Willingness to take ownership of your code –you build it, you run it Ability to work with other geographically dispersed teams  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Experience working on extremely highly scalable platforms is a plus Experience in one or more of the following technologies is a plus: Apache Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Apache Spark, Hadoop, Elastic Search, Node JS  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
