Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.  We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.
Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager

Job_Description: ABOUT IT AT CN  CN harnesses the power of information every minute of every day to make better decisions. Almost every aspect of our business relies on technology; this is why CN invests around $100 million every year on IT projects and infrastructure. And with close to 1,000 in-house employees, CN’s IT team is more than a first-class technology shop – they’re railroaders, dedicated to enabling our people to work better and to helping our trains run safely.  WHY YOU WANT THIS JOB  CN is currently recruiting for the Security & Log Management Tools integrator. As an integrator, you will implement and integrate mission critical security systems in, large-scale, geographically diverse environments.  This role is responsible for integrating Operational and Security Log Management solutions required to run a wide variety of Operational and Security related applications. This includes producing blueprint for the solution, implementing the solution and transferring the knowledge to the operation team. This role requires a service oriented mentality, always seeking the right balance between operational and business requirements.  This requires an in-depth knowledge in the implementation (Enhance or Build and Deploy) of the technology platform tasked with meeting both SOC functional and non-functional requirements.  RESPONSIBILITIES Production of architecture, design, procurement and deployment deliverables for the following components : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) User/Entity Behavior Analytics Cyber Threat Intelligence Vulnerability scanner Security Configuration Scanner Web Application Vulnerability Scanner Incident Response Orchestration Case Management and Ticketing Reporting Forensic Analysis Network Behaviour Anomaly Detection Design and implementation of SIEM content such as use cases, rules, views, reports, alerts, dashboards, etc. Advise on the development of training material for the technology platform used by the SOC. Translate customer requirements into use cases; design and implement as ArcSight content. Contribute to the technical solution architecture by identifying the existing capabilities available technologies in place versus the need for the acquisition of new technologies Interface with various vendors for acquisition of equipment and software/hardware product selection Translate the technical solution architecture into a detailed infrastructure and technology components design. Ensure the tight integration of all the components. Define infrastructure and technology installation specifications including automation, monitoring, high availability and disaster recovery. Work in collaboration with the project manager to define work breakdown structure, estimate project effort and project schedule Guide the system administrators, software administrators, data centre facility administrator and/or telecom integrators through the proposed technical design and specifications. Address any potential design or support issues with them. Produce test plans to test all infrastructure and technologies identified in the technical design. Strong Subject Matter expert assisting the project team in problem resolution or workaround Define the stabilization and knowledge transfer plans to the IT Operation team. REQUIREMENTS 10+ years working experience in Information Security field. Security operations experience such as incident management, intrusion detection, firewall deployment and security event analysis. 5+ years working with SIEM (preferably on Arcsight) and other SOC technologies (Case Management, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Incident Response Orchestrator). Experience with system administration on both Linux and Windows technologies, including the integration of devices such as Windows, AIX, Linux, Firewalls and IPS to a SIEM. Wide range of technical knowledge and in-depth understanding of ArcSight ESM, and has performed the functions of a Senior Analyst, Advanced Content Author or Security SME with respect to SOC technologies. Provide a practical solutions-based approach for the design and implementation of a complete enterprise SIEM deployment; understanding methodologies, terms, concepts, and best practices within the context of the Micro Focus ArcSight product line. Installation, configuration, troubleshooting, customization and optimization of the ArcSight product suite and its dependencies. Strong knowledge in network security operations and familiarity with a variety of endpoint security products.  SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field Experience working with vendors to resolve bugs, request enhancements and gain in-depth knowledge of product roadmaps Extensive experience implementing the ArcSight suite of software and appliances in an Enterprise Environment Experience developing ArcSight FlexConnectors Ability to Create / Develop / Performance Test and Deploy Advanced ESM content for Security Use Cases Extensive experience developing automated monitoring of enterprise tools 5+ years of experience in a highly controlled IT environment Knowledge of SDLC process is an asset Dynamic and excellent troubleshooting/problem solving skills Able to perform under pressure Ability to influence decision-making Advanced technical writing skills Experience working in complex environments and diverse technologies High level of analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities   CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Job_Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation. Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline. Profile Description: The Client Landscape Architect (CLA) is responsible for the end to end architecture within a Infrastructure and Data Management (IDM) account. The CLA is the focal point for ensuring the technical integrity of the client’s infrastructure. Working closely with the Client, Account, Market and/or GBU CTOs, Technical Engineering and the appropriate delivery units, the CLA ensures a coherent and consistent technical strategy is applied, providing technical direction, maintaining operational integrity and architectural governance on all infrastructure solutions within the account. The CLA should be aware of developments in Atos’ technical strategy and innovation processes as these evolve and apply them to the specific needs of the account. This is to ensure that the client derives maximum benefit from Atos’ wider experience/perspectives, and solutions & architectures being deployed conform to Atos policies wherever possible. Supporting the Account pre-sales lifecycle the CLA shapes and develops change requests to meet the customers’ business requirements while also working to identify new sales opportunities. Responsibilities: Provides operational ownership of the end to end Account Architecture mainly focused on IDM delivered services Know and understand the account infrastructure architecture across all constituent parts Can act as the Account Architecture Authority, providing Governance and Assurance to both pre and post sales driven design change Contribute and support the development of technology strategy, roadmaps and future state architectures for the account in conjunction with the Sector and GBU CTO and the client’s business requirements Develop strong relationships with the client becoming a trusted advisor Ensuring solutions and designs adhere to the Atos IDM standards and policies wherever possible, raising exceptions as necessary Provide direction and guidance on all technical aspects of the IT infrastructure, ensuring adherence to relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices Take a key role in understanding the Clients business requirements and contracted services, relating these to the Account technical strategy and mapping them to the various delivery streams Be the focal point for new business and incremental sales opportunities shaping client request through early engagement and detailed knowledge of the estate providing solution context and direction to the pre-sales architects Develop and maintain an Account Architecture Document which describes the end to end scope and design of the services being delivered to the client. Ensure appropriate high level design documentation is produced as a recognized set of deliverables that are consistent to the Atos Architecture Methodologies and Frameworks. This does not preclude the CLA from contributing to the production of the documentation. Contribute to client innovation process, ensuring that developments in the Atos portfolio are considered and presented to the client where relevant Maintain an awareness of and promote any relevant statutory, internal, or external regulations, standards, and codes of good practice, e.g. those relating to security, quality, data protection, audit etc. Stay abreast of technology developments in the market and, where appropriate, build emerging and maturing technologies into the account’s technology roadmap. Skills: At least 10 years experience in one or more infrastructure domains (Compute (hardware, OS, virtualization), Storage, Network, Security, Middleware) Experience implementing production solutions on one or more public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google, etc.). Ability to communicate across all levels of the organization, from technical subject mantter experts to upper management Ability to lead large teams of technical subject matter experts in delivering low level designs to meet overall architectural solution Excellent written and verbal skills Experience with one or more architectural frameworks (e.g. TOGAF) preferred   Your Application If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format. Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.
Title: Client Landscape Architect

Job_Description: The Corporate General Counsel will have an integrated role, working across the company to provide legal expertise, risk management and regulatory governance. As the Counsel looks to increase and maintain the company’s reputation, s/he will ensure compliance, legal conformity and diminished probability of exposure. Success in this role will be determined by a direct and tangible impact on steering business success while guaranteeing the company follows strict guidelines and protocols. Our client is looking for an entrepreneurial, inquisitive and analytical Lawyer to join the team as a critical member in meeting negotiations, setting best practices and crafting the legal requirements to meet our strategic business goals. Expectations of this role are to build out the legal function from creating a legal framework to drafting/creating documents, refining existing documents and policies to negotiating on behalf of our client with all stakeholders to protect our client’s interests and reduce exposure. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Provide accurate and timely legal counsel to management on a variety of topics such as but not limited to contract law, IP, non-competition, trademarks, board governance, cyber security, privacy law etc.; Draft, review, and negotiate on behalf of our client with external stakeholders on a variety of topics. Develop policies to administer the company’s corporate legal affairs and bridge gaps in existing policies; Devise risk management and effective regulatory compliance strategies; Interpret and ensure compliance with privacy legislation, alerting the Executive team and management of regulatory changes or new legislation; Communicate legal risks to business partners related to negotiated provisions in contracts; Create programs to ensure management executes on Service Level agreements and delivery obligations to customers; Research and evaluate different risk factors regarding business decisions and operations; Research unique legal issues impacting the organization by identifying applicable statutes, judicial decisions, and codes; Review Statement of Works (SOWs), and assist in reviewing and writing RFI / RFPs; Provide advice and participate in Due Diligence in joint ventures, strategic partnership deals, and mergers and/or acquisitions; Explain legal language and advise executives on business terms of various deals; Provide advice and guidance on advertising and marketing materials to ensure compliance with legal requirements; Provide advice and guidance on Human Resources issues and requirements in Canada, the USA and globally. Requirements  Law degree from an accredited Canadian or American law school; Minimum 5 years’ experience at a top tier firm or in-house experience; Called to the bar in a Province of Canada; Member in good standing to practice law; At least 4 years’ prior experience as in-house legal counsel on creating, drafting legal contracts, terms and conditions, SOWs, MSAs etc to protect the legal interests and reducing the liability for organizations related to such matters as anti-competition, intellectual property, privacy law, corporate law, employment law, CASL and general contract matters; Knowledge of regulatory policies across multiple jurisdictions to assess potential business impact and opportunities; Ability to provide training to management/executives and its affiliates on substantive legal topics; Deep experience in business law, familiarity with regulatory reporting within a technology field Expert knowledge of corporate and contract law, and exposure to IT/IP law; Must be proficient in drafting and solidifying agreements, contracts and other legal documents; Strong negotiator and has led/facilitated multiple commercial negotiations; Boundless professionalism and a capacity to multitask and manage time effectively using prioritization; Conduct work with integrity and responsibility; High degree of professional ethics and integrity; Ability to work well on your own but enjoy participating in a dynamic and fast-paced team environment; Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work across the organization and lead cross- functional teams; Strong communication skills to communicate complex and/or controversial topics and concepts to a wide and diverse audience both internally and externally; Exceptional organizational abilities, prioritization techniques; Innovative and resourceful with a strong sense of corporate awareness.
Title: General Legal Counsel

Job_Description: Mandatory Skills:   5+ years related QA Manager Experience People management and Test Automation experience ( using Microsoft Technologies preferable) Subject matter expert on quality best practices Experience managing a quality assurance software product organization Experience managing remote employees and/or offices Experience managing offshore teams Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to work with diverse groups. Strong organization skills Able to observe bottlenecks in process and then develop processes and procedures to overcome them Independent decision maker – develop ideas and proposals to suggest changes and make decisions Strong initiative – proactively make use of resources to offer solutions or resolve problems Collaboration and negotiation with internal and external groups Team building and motivational skills Proven capability to delegate work across a large team or multiple teams Understands software development lifecycle in a product development environment Proactive problem solver   Preferred Skills:  Experience in industrial connectivity standards and networking protocols such as ModBus, DNP3, OPC UA, OPC, IEC-104 and other relevant Telemetry centric protocols. Experience with QA Test Automation Experience with defect management tools Experience with source control management systems Cloud Technology knowledge Deep understanding of Windows environment, Active Directory Security and highly distributed systems Experience in testing user and system authentication, encryption, cryptography and other cyber-security standards and measures Experience with OASyS products and other industrial automation products is highly preferred Prior experience in the Oil and Gas Pipeline Industry is a big plus   Technical Skills  SNoPrimary SkillProficiency Level *Rqrd./Dsrd. 1Testing FrameworksPL1Required 2REST / API Service TestingPL1Desired 3XUNITPL1Desired 4SQL profilerPL1Desired 5SQL Server Management StudioPL1Required 6Product Reliability TestingPL1Desired 7Performance ValidationPL1Required 8AgilePL1Required 9Microsoft Test ManagerPL1Required  Domain Skills  SNoPrimary SkillProficiency Level *Rqrd./Dsrd. 1Distribution Management-EnergyNADesired  Proficiency Legends  Proficiency LevelGeneric Reference PL1The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. About Cognizant Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 205 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.
Title: QA Automation Manager

Job_Description: Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager Location: Negotiable Travel: Travel Required  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.  Why Accenture Security?  Serving as a trusted security partner for more than 20 years to more than 330 clients across ~70 countries, Accenture Security helps organizations build resilience from the inside out so they can operate and grow confidently in a rapidly evolving threat landscape. Our 5000 security professionals bring exceptional industry expertise to tailor intelligent security services to our clients’ unique businesses and industries. We provide a full spectrum of services – from security strategy development, to business transformation to managed security services – on demand and at a global scale.  Leveraging our global resources and next-generation technologies, we create an integrated, comprehensive program tailored to each organization’s specific business goals and industry. Recognizing that there is no finish line in securing enterprises, we are constantly collaborating at our global cyber labs and centers with our broad, interdisciplinary innovation ecosystem of the best minds in security. Our focus on continuous innovation gives us a front lines perspective that ensures we are adapting to match the pace of security challenges.  Accenture’s unique ability to combine deep Security expertise across Strategy, Technology and Operations means that it is able to offer clients an enterprise-wide security program to predict, protect, detect, and respond to threats in an industry specific context.  Job Description  Accenture Security professionals: Are highly credible with the ability to engage on a broad C-suite agenda. Possess the personal and professional attributes necessary to guide senior leadership in the formulation of strategies that produce robust and dynamic protective security capabilities as well as enterprise resilience capabilities. Possess deep industry expertise sufficient to not only understand the nuances of an industry, but also guide client executives in developing suitable strategies with limited capacity and ever-changing threat landscapes. Understand current and future client needs in the context of the security marketplace as well as client industry dynamics and apply insights to recommend short/long-term value creation for clients that have the appropriate level of impact. Demonstrate an ability to: Understand business direction of companies and create optimized security strategies that meet business needs, seeking to balance defensive and responsive strategic elements. Communicate complex technology concepts and terms to executive clients in business terms to support formulation of enterprise strategy formulation. Advise on aligning and optimizing security operations to meet business objectives while maintaining identified compliance with legal, best-practice and regulatory requirements. Produce risk-based strategies that maximize the effectiveness of finite financial resources in the face of ever-escalating cyber threats. Perform as a Security Strategy Consulting Practitioner subject matter expert in at least one or more of the following seven key security domains: Extended Ecosystem - articulating risks and exposures across 3rd parties, cloud providers, “shadow” IT, partners, and suppliers; Governance and Leadership - reviewing and developing effective structures for communication and decision making across an organization; Investment Efficiency - evaluating the effectiveness of client expenditures across the technology portfolio to ensure optimal balance between enablement and protection; Business Exposure - identifying business exposures resulting from cyber-attack vectors (e.g. insider threat, competitive intelligence, supply chain, distribution, and materials security, etc.); Resilience Readiness - evaluating an organization’s ability to respond transparently to interruptions resulting from cyber-attacks; Cyber Response Readiness - reviewing an organization’s ability manage and respond to cyber-attacks from a business process and technical level, and across all levels of an organization (Exec MGT, legal, HR, IT, Security, Compliance, etc.); Strategic Threat Context - understanding the myriad threat factors (geopolitical, competitive, criminal, and market threats) in conjunction with cyber-attack vectors used to disrupt business operations. Basic Qualifications: Expertise in one or more of the 5 Security Domains (Cyber Defense, Digital ID, Application Security, Strategy & Risk, Managed Services Minimum of 5 years of security experience; Minimum of 3 years management consulting experience and/or internal consulting Minimum of 3 years of experience with Products focused clients (including retail, consumer goods & services, transportation services, travel industry, life sciences, automotive) Minimum of 1 year experience in at least 2 of the following areas: Compliance (HIPAA or PCI or SOX or GLBA.), Infrastructure, Security operations, Applications, or Architecture experience; Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated work experience within data strategy, management and operational reporting and enabling technologies; Demonstrated work experience in threat management, cyber security, cloud security, or application security; Successful career progression in one or more of the following: sales/business development, including pricing strategy, deal shaping, and business case development; Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian; Extensive experience in Microsoft Office product suite; MBA; CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred.  Professional Skill Requirements Have a deep intellectual capacity and relevant experience to develop creative and breakthrough solutions; Possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to understand complex issues with the ability to quickly absorb information and deploy conceptual and creative problem solving; Successful track record in sales origination with an entrepreneurial mind-set; demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams to shape, sell, communicate, and implement security strategy engagements; Demonstrate first class written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner. Own and develop our offerings and assets; Be a natural leader with the ability to easily establish trust-based relationships; skilled in gaining valuable insights through collaboration and communication; Lead, mentor and develop our people; Possess drive, determination and optimism with proven ability to adapt and remove obstacles to achieve results. It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed. Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions—underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network—Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.  We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.
Title: Accenture Security Canada - Products Senior Manager

Job_Description: Incident Responses Analyst  Position Summary:  As an Incident Response Analyst at Equifax, you will provide incident response and analytic capabilities to an enterprise wide cybersecurity program. The Incident Response Analyst will possess technical knowledge and experience performing incident response, threat hunting, network and system monitoring, malware analysis, and has performed cyber incident related digital forensics. The position will include a robust assortment of security projects that support the Global Security team.  Additional responsibilities of the Incident Response Analyst include: Provide tiered technical resolution for security incidents and SOC service requests with an emphasis on Tier 3 and greater Conduct host and network analysis, forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations Recognize and collect attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations Build scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance incident investigation processes Effectively communicate investigative findings and strategy to stakeholders including technical staff, executive leadership, and legal counsel Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans in response to incidents Perform analysis of complex datasets to produce relevant intelligence products Support internal investigations and identify security gaps and strategies Leverages ability to identify new attack TTPs and recommend mitigation techniques Will use disparate data sources and evidence to detect and decipher abnormalities in various log formats, with a primary focus on the internal threat landscape Ability to follow established processes and to improve as needed  Required skills of the Incident Response Analyst include: 5+ years' general information security experience 3+ years' experience in a Security Incident Response role Knowledge of tools used for network security (DLP, NIPS, HIPS, AV, Firewalls, etc.) Mastery of *nix and Windows operating system functionality Proficient in the use of the varied and diverse log analysis and forensic tools Thorough understanding of network protocols Strong research, analytic, writing and briefing skills Ability to effectively manage multiple, concurrent activities, while understanding and managing priorities, dependencies and risk Expert capabilities to research, create, develop and deliver professional briefings, multimedia presentations, and written reports to both operational and senior leadership levels Ability to work independently, as well as mentoring other team members Ability to work or be on-call during off hours Demonstrated flexibility, initiative, judgment and discretion English language proficiency Willingness to learn new tools and processes and proven track record of learning new technologies, methodologies, and skills Organizational, time management, customer service and problem-solving skills  Education: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) required Post-graduate degree preferred Certifications such as GIAC (GCIA, GCIH, GSEC, GCFA, GCFE, etc.), CISSP, CEH or related certification(s) desired  What exactly does Equifax do?  Equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. The company organizes, assimilates and analyses data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers.  Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our people makes a difference in our business. Equifax offers a performance-driven culture that rewards results and encourages growth and development. Many expect us to be a serious workforce, and we are - we're serious about continuing to grow our business, serious about working together as one team, and serious about continuously building a strong, engaged workplace that embraces integrity and change as much as it does fun, camaraderie and philanthropy.  Some noteworthy achievements for the company include: Named to the Top 100 American Banker FinTech Forward list (2015-2016); named a Top Technology Provider on the FinTech 100 list (2004-2016); named an InformationWeek Elite 100 Winner (2014-2015); named a Top Workplace by Atlanta Journal Constitution (2013-2017); named one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies (2011-2015); named one of Forbes' World's 100 Most Innovative Companies (2015-2017). For more information, visit www.equifax.com .  Primary Location: CAN-Toronto-5700 Yonge  CAN-Anjou, CAN-Toronto-33-Bloor  Function: Function - Security Governance and Compliance  Schedule: Full time
Title: Incident Response Analyst
